author: {'steamid': '76561198151463023', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1528549306}
review:
After i finished this Visual Novel, i just realized, my life is very lucky compared to them, and i am thankful for God gave me life without flaws and happy family,i should be more grateful, thanks for the Developers, my eyes open to respect life more.
I should live my life to the fullest
I should be more happy that im lucky
I shouldn't have Done anything harsh toward my friends and family
I shouldn't have waste life & time
I should love myself, Family and friends more cause i don't know when they will gone
I should put more Effort and Faith like Himiko does
My GOD they don't deserve it, they should live happly, it's not fair......

author: {'steamid': '76561198092970988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1517717179}
review: It's not really the game's fault: I have learnt that non-interactive visual novel is not my thing. The story itself is interesting, although at no point was I sucked into it (could also be due to the style). What I really don't get is: why one achievement for the voiced version and another for the unvoiced? There is no reason to watch it twice. Is it just there to tease us completionists?

author: {'steamid': '76561198014418689', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1514634045}
review: The most beautiful game i've ever played. I didn't like part two as much, I still found it to have well written characters and a moving backdrop to part 1, full of beauty in its own right. If you  be moved in a way that so many other games cannot, try Narcissu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093543784', 'num_games_owned': 5218, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1513505271}
review:
Disclaimer: this is a kinetic novel; it really does not matter wheter you do 1st or 2nd first. I did 1st first. Its author advises doing the 2nd before 1st. Story is slow though, but worth it.

[b]Plot:[/b] simple but memorable and beautiful. It does address the issue of life and death (in real life) and suicidal awareness..
[b]Character:[/b] great development and interesting connection between them
[b]Music:[/b] needless to say it's great
[b]Art:[/b] game focuses on vocal to express, so not many CG's, but they are drawn well enough
[b]Price:[/b] free so I would not complain
[b]Effect:[/b] depressing but not to the point of traumatic. It's sad but it's beautiful.

[b]Overall: [/b] highly recommended. Makes you think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413254556', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1518401429}
review:
"Even if I could bear my own pain, I couldn't bear another's. Those leaving, and those left behind. No matter how much a best friend, Alois could not become Patrasche."

"For the first time, she smiled for me, smiled for the last shot on the dispoable camera. Smiled with the emerald green sea to her back."

For those left behind, pray for them, smile for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067178806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1673004631}
review:
Essenziale, minimalista, disadorna, aggettivi non propriamente lusinghieri in questa toccante visual novel assumono nuova forza e significato. 

E' composta da due episodi: il secondo Ã¨ un prequel, che perÃ² non ho letto perchÃ¨ (personalissimo parere) non c'Ã¨ bisogno di aggiungere altro a quando raccontato nel primo episodio.

Non aspettavi risposte multiple o bivi narrativi, si legge e si ascolta...

author: {'steamid': '76561198311502944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1502638386}
review: These novels are extremely sad. I cried at the end of the first one, and did my best not to at the end of the second. The stories told here are absolutely heartbreaking, and there is no happy ending, which just makes the final words of the novels even more heartrenching. I recommend these novels to give you some insight on just how horrible it can be to lose hope, but how wonderful it is to live your final moments with those you care about. These are wonderfully told, and I only wish those characters had happier ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321939288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1590366877}
review: I feel that Narcissu's story succeeds at its goal, which is to make the player, or reader, feel the protagonist's sadness and loneliness. However, Narcissu 1st attempts to do so through a bland male protagnist and a flat female protagonist, which makes the first game hard to finish. Thankfully, the second game does an excellent job of showing why the female protagonist acts the way she does, and does so in a way that makes the reader care for her plight and support her decisions. I recommend this game for anyone who enjoys a story about inner turmoil and reflection, and I ask that you try to put up with the misleading first game, which honestly should be considered the framework for the second.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099028565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1398549618}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080752729', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1510214570}
review:
A game that will definetly move your heart!!
Both stories are sad.. and it's too much like novel that you might wonder "what's the point of making it a game". but I loved it a lot... the soundtrack always spot on!! and the voice acting is lovely... and heartbreaking in the sad scenes.

- Narcissu
A story sabout a unnamed young man who meets a young woman (Setsumi) meeting in the 7th floor, a place where you wait for your death... They later decided that they don't want to die there and their jouney began.... the story is while very simple it can be hard to predict sometimes, and the coversations are very interesting.

The story becomes too sad in the end... but I still felt that thier death had a meaning, that it wasn't all in vain.

- Narcissu 2nd side
Prequel set 7 years before the previous story about a woman Setsumi knew... 2nd side is better in everything!!
Himeko is a very cheerful girl who contrasts Setsumi a lot... I can't express how much I like this game!!

--------------
Recommended if you want a game that moves your heart, makes you sad sometimes but will leave you with things to think of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385501958', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1504651293}
review:
From developer stage-nana and publishers Sekai Project comes Narcissu 1st & 2nd, the story of a girl who has to choose between 7F and home.

This story focuses heavily on disease and suffering, of a girl having to medicate and go through the adverse affects of medication, and going through her life knowing that she will ultimately die.

I wasnâ€™t sure what I expected when I downloaded this novel from Steam, and I went into it very confused at first. I just knew it was rated very positively, but it sat in my Steam library for a long time after downloading it. Finally, today, after realising I really need to clean some games out of my library to make room on my laptop, I decided to finally open this and play it.

What I definitely did not expect was to be moved to tears by a story such as this. It was incredibly moving, and the story really hit me in a lot of places I didnâ€™t know I could be hit emotionally. The artwork in this really helps to move the story along, and the soundtrack as well, is just so beautiful, it really helps move the story along, and emit feelings in the reader that honestly made me have goosebumps. I have honestly, never been moved so much by just a simple visual novel â€“ this affected me on the same level an incredibly sat film would.

Stage-nana did incredibly well with this story, and I would love to see more from this, and them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137081930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1503121496}
review: Fuck this game, just fuck this fucking game. I'm done, it mixed relationships and death, and I'm done. I'm sick of being an emotional wreck. I don't care how exceptional this game was, I should've delayed playing it. This game is fucking beautiful but it chewed me up and spat me out. This was the nail in the coffin for me. I really did enjoy it, but why did I allow myself to be emotionally tortured again, especially when these visual novels became progressively heartbreaking. Ugh, fuck me and fuck this. I don't need to be this depressed and unstable before college, like what the fuck.  (really though I love the shit out of this game, don't want that to be confusing) I'm shattered, I'm not recovering. Fuck visual novels.

review:
A good read in short amount of time. A heartbreaking story mixed with a perfect OST and minimalist visuals. It's free so there's no consequence in trying except for the excessive amount of tissue paper needed.

10/10

 I cried. No regrets.

review:
The game has very little user interaction, but that is to be expected from a game like this.

The story is good, very good. It really touches you and is about something that can happen to anyone.

I highly recommend playing it, especially because it is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374942999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1497766374}
review:
I'm not really sure what to say about this, but in a good way. the story pulled me in and i couldn't pull myself  away, this was very different from any story i've read or game i've payed and i'm glad i gave it a go.
It took me just over 2 hours to get through it and it was definitely worth the 2 hours, it left me wanting more, feeling like surely the main character had more to their story after the ending. 

I highly recomment this to anyone

author: {'steamid': '76561197980449859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1500426681}
review: I've put off reading these stories for a long time. Tough material, stories of terminally ill youth finding meaning in their final days. The package consists of two short stories, with the second part being longer and to me, more emotional. I did find that the writing style and lack of character visuals for reference sometimes made it hard to tell who was saying what lines. But you get multiple translation choices and can play with or without voices so it's easy to experience this just the way you want to. In retrospect, and after seeing the author's comments on this very matter, it may be better to play in the reverse order.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083748092', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 2509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2078, 'last_played': 1503603620}
review:
A great story to think that even in the end of your life, not everything is lost.

Review: First, to play this, you MUST know you are going to play a visiual novel, so do not expect:
- Gamelay
- Animations (At least not always)
- Other thing than music/text

So with that said, Narcissu is a beautiful visual novel with a quite heart touching story, the fact that the main character do not appears frequently adds a bit of immersion to the game, i would recomment it to play it if you got 12hs to waste on an emotional story. If i had to point out a thing to improve, it would be the dialogues, sometimes i found lost and i don't know if the one saying the phrase is Himeko or Setsumi, (You could fix is by adding a pic before the dialogue or the name, like "Himeko: Hi.") but it's a minor thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068567612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1499746592}
review:
An emotional rollercoaster was experienced for me playing through this visual novel. I decided to play it out over the course of two weeks to give myself a break.

I am glad I completed the stories fully. 

The themes and concepts at hand are portrayed beautifully. I would recommend everyone give this game a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098809768', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1498923245}
review:
Two kinetic (no choices) novels about people with incurable illnesses. What do you do when you're slowly marching towards your death? Do you make it come quicker? Do you try to prolong it in the hopes of a cure? Or do you just try to make do with what you have and live?

Visuals: 10/10
Audio: 10/10
Voices: 9/10 (some voices were a bit loud for me, but thankfully you could set the volume for individual voices)
Story: 9/10
Price: 20/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198066481649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1514282837}
review: This is definitely one of the most emotional an depressing stories I've read in my life. The story, the characters, and the music all blend to an experience I will appreciate and respect for the rest of my life. And it's free, and I think that is one of the best things that the creator could have done, because it is a story everyone should experience. Unless you have the attentionspan of a Marshmallow, then the slowness may grind your gears...but then I would still say you should finish the whole story...marshmellow...

author: {'steamid': '76561198065255910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1431934107}
review:
Are you some masochist wanting to drive your soul into an abyss of FEELZ or simply a curious wanderer who's also a cheapskate after seeing the 'free' pricetag..? 

I'm a mixture of the above and I was pretty curious about how 'visual novels' actually work; and well, it's just that- it's basically a story book with a heart-wrenching narrative and apt music to accompany it. For my first 'visual novel' I was quite impressed. It was like watching an extremely sad anime (which I LOVE).

The music did get a bit repetitive afterwards (maybe I took too long to actually read through it) But damn, the story and everything is just amazing. As a masochist and someone who just loves to get on board the FEELZ train, Narcissu 1st & 2ND definitely hits that spot and I would recommend it to anyone willing to spend some time to read through this short but well-crafted story.

Art: 7/10
Story: 8/10
Music: 7/10

Some things to note on this one:
It's not a story with 'choices' or 'multiple endings,' it's just a simple read-through, just so you know.
There are two stories here, the 1st is the original story, and the 2nd is a prequel.  It is recommended (by the author) to read the 2nd first, but I didn't catch that until after I read the first one.  Either way works... I thought the 2nd was better than the first, if that matters somehow.
Not that I care too much about it, but the art could be seen as lacking.
The music seemed to fit in pretty well. 
And then we get to the story and characters... This will be tough.

The characters are... not that interesting.  They are bland, to me anyway.  And this usually would be a criticism, but when you go through the story, it makes sense why they are that way.  So, I don't know how to... review this part.  I thought they were boring, and the interactions for the first 90% of the (1st) game are almost cringe-worthy... but I understand why it's that way.  I know this may not make much sense, but take it as you will.  The 2nd story is better with this: some of those characters are pretty interesting (interactions are still a bit weak).

The story is a big 'feels trip,' if you can put yourself in the situations described and imagine it, you will feel strongly about the story, and this is what pretty much makes up for.... everything.  A lot of people praise this, and it certainly made me feel more empathetic at times.  Also, the game is free, so you can give it a few hours of trying it out if you'd like and make a decision as you play.  The story was definitely worth the read.

I, personally, have some issues with the story, but that is of a personal nature: for my review, I'll recommend trying it out and just read above for my 'neutral' take on this.  The rest of what follows is just my personal thoughts/feelings on this.

I felt... that this story 'glorified' or 'romanticized' something that should not be glorified at all.  I know it's a story, and it's expanding one's way of thinking and just a take on things... but I still don't like that at all.  If you read the story, you'll probably guess it rather quickly.

This story also goes into religion somewhat, and presents what I feel is a... one-sided view on things?  I think that's the best way to describe it.  I completely understand why it's included, I know why people feel this way, and I'm sure it's a popular view.  It makes sense with the story.  But it sucks that nothing was really presented to show a different way, a different view to balance this.  So I will post that view here, if you wish to read (spoiler alert though):

[spoiler]
God loves you and cares.  I know it's difficult to understand sometimes, I know it's difficult to see, I know sometimes it does NOT feel that way, and things happen that don't make sense.  It's fine to be mad sometimes.  But He does care, so don't give up on Him.  Or yourself, for that matter.
[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097996432', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1497085272}
review:
I'm not really into visual novels, but this one, even don't having choices or interaction, it's, imo., a very meaningful piece of art.

You might think [i]"what's the point of playing a book?"[/i] But this visual novel uses everything to turn the simple read into a great experience, the passing, music and visual choices (like the choose for less, but more significant, area of illustration) are all great in setting the theme and touching the emotional of the reader, in a way that neither a book, audio-book or a pack of illustrations could do by their own. And that's what art is all about, using the media to provoke feelings and thoughts, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198128962064', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1494194771}
review: By far the best free VN i've read on steam. The writing is very good and the theme's are presented well. Not every character gets as much development as they might deserve, but that is probably because it is so short. Besides that it's great :). However if you don't like dramatic/sad stories, stay away from this. in that case, there isn't a single thing  to like about this vn (but who doesn't like a sad story every now and then ;)).

author: {'steamid': '76561198065776960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1516374476}
review:
The VN that started my journey to the land of VNs. 10 years later and I still haven't looked back.

Thanks to Tomo Kataoka and stage-nana for the VN
Thanks to insani for the wonderful translation

The later games may not be into your taste, but if you've read this far then I'd recommend to play the original narcissu 1 and using insani's translation. It is what led me into the land of VNs and this is back in 2005 I believe. Time sure flew a lot since.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122244584', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1493008284}
review:
Well, first... let me just explain my surprise and what grey areas there are in calling something a "Visual Novel". 

I know that, as far as credibility among gamers go, visual novels are among the lowest, most "casual" rung in reputations. However, there are some games I enjoy very much which are often referred to as visual novels. [i]Ace Attorney[/i]. [i]Danganronpa[/i]. To an extent, [i]The Walking Dead[/i], though it is more commonly referred to as something along the lines of an "interactive movie". Even some rpgmaker games, such as the line of games: [i]To The Moon[/i], [i]A Bird Story[/i], and, I assume, the coming sequel [i]Finding Paradise[/i]. 

But the thing is... these "visual novels" normally come with some kind of interactivity. Moving around, examing objects, quick-time events, dialogue options, even some mini-games. They gain the title of "visual novel" from the intense focus on story and that, at times, all you can do to advance the story is to continuously press the button to move to the next line. But they have other features. [i]Narcissu[/i], on the other hand, does not.

That is what surprised me about [i]Narcissu[/i]... That there was literally no gameplay and you just clicked your way through all portions of the story. I'm not going to hold this against the game. It was clearly tagged as such under "visual novel". I'm simply used to, I guess, games that are in the same realm as visual novels, but not quite. So I had a hard time maintaining interest. That, however, does not mean I regret reading through the story. 

[i]Narcissu 1st[/i] I found exceptionally compelling. The thoughts of life and death are rather similar to my own. The tedium from inaction at the thought of wasting away in a hospital, terminally ill. The unbreakable spirit in doing what you want in life and dying on your own terms. Every person's right to die when they want or feel they need to die. I found myself to be rather fond of Setsumi's perspective. [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] wasn't a bad expansion upon the characters, but it is longer and I didn't feel as interested. However, the epilogue ties things up nicely. 

I kind of liked this story, and I loved the sentiment behind it. As long as you know ahead of time that this is a true Visual Novel, then there would be no reason not to enjoy it. And if you're the emotional type, bring some tissues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301896992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1491408534}
review:
Narcissu is game which i would highly recommend since, 
1. Its free
2. Easy achievements
3. Touching story
4. Great Soundtrack 

The story tells us about 2 characters who are suffering from terminal illness and who they are going to prepare to die like where the would die etc. This visual novel conveys a strong emotion sense which can make you cry or shed tears. 10/10 would recommend. All aboard the feels train! Next stop your heart!

review:
Ok, here we go... I really don't give many reviews, but, this one deserved a good review that I'm not going to go much detail in. I've played a few Visual Novels before but nothing like this! From the very beginning to the end I was captivated to the amazing yet sad story. Anyway I think anyone who loves a good (amazing) story and loves Anime (like me LOL), i truely think You SHOULD play this game, come on! Try it! 


12/10 would cry again

author: {'steamid': '76561198096320151', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1466103775}
review:
â™¥ FranÃ§ais en dessous ! â™¥

My review may have a "knowledge bias", but I didn't like this kinetic novel (kinetic meaning you have no choice to make) for its lack of accuracy. It is a very liked game so I know I might face a shitstorm, but well...

I have heavy chronic diseases, and I worked in a hospital  before having to stop working.
This kinetic novel (two stories) is about young people who know they will die, and just wait for their end in a special floor in a hospital (... or try to give life a sense one last time). 
Well, even if they will die, as hospital staff you don't let people watering flowers under a hard sunny sky, or just fooling around like they want. Hospital is not a hostel. You never, ever, let drugs in a hospital without watch and being locked with a key, you never have a floor with just no staff around.
When you are really sick (and even more when you will be dead soon), you can't fâ™¥â™¥â™¥ing take care of flowers under the sun, you just vomit because you can't stand the weather anymore. You can't drive, because you are so tired you can not even read, or think. You can't walk a mountain (!!), because just walking a bit makes you feel dizzy. No matter how hard your will, how high your spirit, your body stays broken. So you try to reflect on life, to be with your close ones, to be happy for your last moments, while being in your bed, in your room, because that's all you can do.
And as a reader, I don't know how to feel empathy with a girl just saying "betsu ni" during 80% of her story, with all the little things you learn about her having a root in the second story (a prequel) like this girl never had family, friends, influences, character in her life before that; and I can't stay focused on a story with so many false things and just have the clear attempt to make you cry. (oh, and also, I have a strong Faith. Well, some Catholic people seems to have been touched by the way the topic is touch on this story; but I didn't as well, it wasn't deep enought, philosophically and emotionally, for me).

It's just a novel by, and about, normal people who won't die (and never worked in a hospital), thinking of how it would be to die soon and young. You may get the feels if you don't know anything of it, but if you are in this case, it just feel untrue and a bit pathetic.

Some good points for this game:
- good voice acting.
- free.
- easy tophies for trophies hunters.

That's all. HF.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥
Frenchy French time !

Bon, donc pour commencer, j'ai des biais "de connaissance" qui expliquent sans doute mon impression nÃ©gative pour ce kinetic novel (histoire visuelle sans choix Ã  faire, juste lire, Ã©couter et passer les pages), aussi aimÃ© soit-il: j'ai des maladies chroniques bien handicapantes, et avant de tomber malade, je bossais dans un hÃ´pital. Et je me suis dit qu'avoir un avis "de l'intÃ©rieur" pouvait Ãªtre intÃ©ressant.

Du coup, mon avis sur le jeu est confrontÃ© Ã  la rÃ©alitÃ©. Par exemple:
- Quand on bosse dans un hÃ´pital, jamais un Ã©tage n'est laissÃ© sans aucun personnel. On ne laisse jamais les mÃ©dicaments sans surveillance, et sans Ãªtre dans des armoires fermÃ©es Ã  clef. On ne laisse personne aller et venir librement, mÃªme s'ils vont bientÃ´t mourir -bonjour la surveillance des constantes vitales- et encore moins faire des choses comme aller arroser des fleurs en plein cagnard.
- Quand on est trÃ¨s malade (et encore plus quand on est Ã  quelques semaines de mourir, hein.), on ne va pas arroser les fleurs en plein aprem l'Ã©tÃ©, parce qu'on ne supporte plus les tempÃ©ratures et on est trop occupÃ© Ã  vomir. On ne peut pas conduire, parce que la plupart du temps on est dÃ©jÃ  trop fatiguÃ©(e) pour comprendre un livre, et mÃªme penser des fois c'est limite. On ne va pas faire des balades en pleine montagne (......) parce que mÃªme marcher un peu donne des vertiges. Peu importe le moral, le mental qu'on a, Ã§a ne rÃ©pare pas le corps magiquement (malheureusement). Alors on essaie de rÃ©flÃ©chir Ã  sa vie, d'Ãªtre avec ses proches, de rÃ©gler ses papiers, de profiter du temps qui nous reste, dans notre lit, notre chambre, parce qu'il ne reste que Ã§a.

AprÃ¨s, on peut me dire "ouiii, mais c'est une histoire, c'est touchant". Ouais, sauf que quand on "connaÃ®t", on est sans cesse choquÃ©(e) par le fait que... c'est une histoire Ã©crite par des gens qui vont bien (et n'ont jamais bossÃ© dans un hÃ´pital), sur des gens qui vont bien en fait, mais qui s'amusent juste Ã  imaginer ce que Ã§a ferait de mourir jeune et bientÃ´t. C'est juste une histoire plein de choses pas vraies, pas cohÃ©rentes, dans le but de faire pleurer.
En tant que lectrice, je ne vois pas comment m'attacher Ã  un personnage qui passe son temps Ã  dire "betsu ni" ("rien de spÃ©cial") 80% de son histoire, et qui en plus pour le peu de caractÃ¨re qu'elle a, tient tout de l'hÃ©roÃ¯ne de la seconde histoire (une prÃ©quelle) comme si elle n'avait elle-mÃªme jamais eu de famille, d'amis, d'influence d'aucune sorte ni mÃªme de caractÃ¨re avant de la rencontrer. Personnage bien construit donc. En tant que personne ayant une forte spiritualitÃ©, mÃªme si certains Catholiques semblent avoir Ã©tÃ© touchÃ©s par la seconde histoire, pour moi ce n'Ã©tait pas assez profond ni philosophiquement, ni Ã©motionnellement.

Bref, une histoire lente, pas crÃ©dible, pas creusÃ©e. Il faut ne pas connaÃ®tre pour de vrai ces sujets pour Ãªtre touchÃ©(e), honnÃªtement. 

Mais je vais donner quand mÃªme quelques points positifs (juste, pas du tout suffisants, pour moi, pour mÃ©riter une recommandation):
- le doublage est trÃ¨s bien fait, et le jeu est de bonne qualitÃ©.
- gratuit.
- trophÃ©es ultra-faciles pour les chasseurs.

Et c'est tout. Amusez-vous bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240898030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1489801992}
review:
Ich habe gerade mal knapp eine Stunde gespielt und muss sagen, dass es mir jetzt schon sehr gut gefÃ¤llt.
Die Musik ist einfach unfassbar fantastisch und man merkt schnell was fÃ¼r eine traurige/krasse story hinter dem ganzen steckt. 
Zwar ist es auf der Visuellen Ebene echt nichts krasses und man bekommt nur diese kleinen Bilder zu sehen die (zumindest bisher) meisst ziemlich unspannend sind. Die wundervolle Musik gleicht das aber ziemlich aus und...ja man sollte sowas eben wirklich wegen der Story spielen und nicht groÃŸartig wegen den Bildern. FÃ¼r Grafik kann man dann gerne Animes gucken, aber ich finde es hier nicht sehr schlimm. Man muss auch immernoch bedenken, dass es kostenlos ist und, dass es von 2007 ist.

Bin auf diese Teile Ã¼brigens durch den 3. Teil gekommen, da dort viele gemeint haben, dass der 3. Teil hauptsÃ¤chlich was fÃ¼r Fans des 1. und 2. Teiles ist. Wenn die Story dort auch gut ist/bleibt und die Grafik im 3. auch ein wenig interessanter ist (wahrscheinlich auch wenn nicht) kann ich mir gut vorstellen mir den 3. Teil zu kaufen.

Probiert es einfach mal aus, immerhin ist es ja kostenlos! FÃ¼r mich ist es die 2. Visual Novel, wobei ich bei der ersten (Sweetest Monster) auch erst sehr wenig Spielzeit habe.

Achja was das Englisch angeht: Ich muss mit den Englisch-Kentnissen die man bis Klasse 9 so hat und die ich bei meinem Dasein im Internet so erlangt habe schon immer wieder mal den Ãœbersetzer nutzen, allerdings ist das meisstens nicht zwingen nÃ¶tig, sondern nur wenn mans ganz genau wissen will. Mit dem meissten komme ich also klar (im gegensatz zu "Sweetest Monster", da ist es sehr viel mehr "Fach-Englisch".

LG :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015151479', 'num_games_owned': 2341, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1489772233}
review:
Una delle novel piÃ¹ toccanti in cui mi sia mai imbattuto. 

Installata giusto per curiositÃ  data la sua natura gratuita e i molti pareri positivi, me ne sono davvero innamorato in poco tempo. Ho apprezzato in particolar modo Narcissus 2nd, sorta di prequel della storia originale, che pur affrontando le medesime tematiche della prima offre una visione piÃ¹ ampia e meno circonstanziata, con un cast piÃ¹ allargato ed assortito e personaggi, a mio giudizio, meglio caratterizzati ed empatici. Ma resta solo una mia particolare preferenza, dettata probabilmente anche da una maggior aspetto "moe" che la permea rispetto alla piÃ¹ fredda e laconica Narcissus 1.

Sia come sia si tratta di un'opera che, pur non brevissima come ci si potrebbe aspettare (circa 10 ore di gameplay), vale assolutamente la pena giocare. 

Bei personaggi, storia toccante, buon ritmo, tanti *FEELS* , comparto grafico molto gradevole, e una OST a dir poco magnifica e che potrete ascoltare a piacimento tramite il comodo jukebox integrato una volta terminata la novel.

Cosa si puÃ² volere di piÃ¹? Ah si. Narcissus 3rd ovviamente :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198098371909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1561996598}
review:
I finished reading the Visual Novel for the first time on my PSP when I was looking for  a good ported VN for PSP. I was so drawn into the story that somehow my depression suddenly vanishes and gives me a new reason to live my not so good life. Narcissu is a story about terminally-ill people who somehow, even though there's no more hope in their life, carried to do something that every terminally-ill people want to do. And that is to die where they want to die.

I bought the copy of the Light Novel in my own language when it was on sale on some local anime convention. And I can proudly say that Narcissu is one of the best linear VN out there that's also great for people who want to play VN for the first time. I bought the 10th Anniversary Anthology Project because I want to support the developer to make a jewel that is on par with Narcissu.

In short, Narcissu are one of those story that can change your life forever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088513355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1416292143}
review: Got to say when I first came across this vn I scrolled the comments first. Seeing all the teary-eyed comments had me going, it cant be that bad. Gladly, I was proven wrong and found myself blubbering by the end. Had to walk away a couple of times (almost as bad as *eden). You know what your getting yourself into and its like a slowed down version of a recorded crash, (you can forsee the end at the beginning and you know its coming but there's nothing you can do to stop it).  Emotional rollercoaster 10/10 I loved it and will look forward to the creators other works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305808904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1591844475}
review:
this game completely and utterly OBLITERATED me emotionally. i shed so many testosterone filled tears i feel completely drained. if someone wants to know what having your soul crushed in the vice of vengeful god feels like then look no further than this visual novel.
dispite having minimal character visuals it has god-tier writing and music to more than make up for it. i can't recommend this enough. anything that can emotionally devastate me like this i hold to the highest regards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257740218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1463762885}
review:
Narcissu is very well known amongst those who play visual novels, whilst the style of a kinetic novel may not suit everyone, the story will definitely keep you captivated.

Death is inevitable for everyone, seeing it from the perspective of someone who knows they have very little time left and not being able to understand how to feel about it really makes you think about life and death and what they really mean.  I highly recommend Narcissu, the story is wonderful and will leave you upset, yet somewhat content and accepting of the situation the characters are in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123895876', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1433370263}
review: Naricasu was one of my favourite animes in the entire world. I am a huge light novel reader and have read many editions of "Cory in the house". I believe that this takes Cory in the House to a whole new level. Cory Baxter was my idol all through my adolescent years as I was beginning to experience change. Cory's struggles with the presidents daughter always led me to think... why? Why... The thought that goes into everyones mind while reading/watching the show(only hardcore Cory lovers read the novels)... But thats when it came to me. Naricasu. The same writer as the writer of the Cory in the House novels. Naricasu was made FOR Cory in the house! All the evidence is here... Naricasu makes you think of Cory, and Cory makes you wonder why... Why... 3 letters in why... 3 sides of a triangle... ILLUMINATI? No, it couldnt be... But now that Im thinking about it, it all makes sense... the evidence was in front of our face the entire time and we didnt even know it! Cory is black. 5 letters in black... 5 + 5 gives us 10... 10 letters in Illuminati! Still not convinced? I wasn't either. But this last fact will surely make you believe me. NARICASU rhymes with DONT EAT MY SOUP... Dont eat my soup rhymes with hoola hoop... Yes, this is surely the final step... If we take the word HOOLA and take away the letters H, O, O, L, and A away, and then write hte word ILLUMINATI, we get the word, ILLUMINATI. Coincidence? I think not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147976791', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1563226438}
review:
Una novela visual muy purista: No hay ningÃºn tipo de toma de decisiones, no hay cambios en la historia, simplemente son un par de historias contadas de la mejor manera posible. Eso si, preparate para los "feelings".

Cualquiera de las dos historias que se incluyen son atrapantes, en algÃºn momento se pueden hacer un poco largas y al principio cuesta distinguir que personaje esta hablando, pero una vez que te acostumbras te vas dando cuenta como todas las historias se van enlazando para explicar cada detalle de las mismas. La banda sonora logra de manera muy satisfactoria la inmersiÃ³n en la historia que se te esta contando.

Es una lÃ¡stima que no este traducida al espaÃ±ol, pero si no tienes problemas con el idioma ingles, la recomiendo muchisimo.

review: A great free to play visual novel to start getting into visual novels. Great voice acting and sound effects, and also a moving storyline to put anyone to the brink of tears as we watch the patients on the 7th floor of the hospital.

review:

If you're looking for a short visual novel that will you give a waterfall of feels, then I say that these games are for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025047055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1465114325}
review:
tldr: Narcissu is made of feels.

Do you wish to die alone, or to burden those who care about you with your passing? It is sad, but we are all mortal, and we will all die. This is the story of people waiting for inevitable death, their struggle and their heartwarming strength to try and accept this. It is a story of life, but not all lives are long.

Narcissu is not a story of tragedy: It is not a story made to hurt you but it will hurt. You will cry but they will not only be tears of sadness. It will fill you with (platonic) love, loss, and acceptance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066319006', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1468130247}
review:
Bueno primero que todo, esta novela lo que tiene de bueno principalmente, es que es gratuita, ya que no hay que pagar absolutamente nada, y NO es una demo y un free to play, sino una novela visual completa. como es una novela visual, obiamente este clase de juego solo les gustara a los otakus o amantes del anime, que seria mi caso.

La historia es algo melanconica, pues no es una novela de comedia, ni de ecchi, sino una de del genero recuerdos de la vida, ya que es una historia nos puede pasar a cualquiera, y lo unico que tienes que hacer es hacer clip y dejar que los personajes te cuente la historia del juego, nada mas, esta novelas solo tiene una ruta unica, por el cual no busques formas de cambiar la historia, pues no se podra.

en cuanto la parte tecnica, lo nueno es que son 2 novelas en una, pero lo malo es que esta en ingles, por el cual debes dominar un ingles basico/intermedia para entender la historia, tambien sirve como escusa para mejorar tu ingles, aunque la comunidad tiene un parcher para traducir el primer juego al espaÃ±ol, lamentablemete para el segundo juego no hay.

en conclusion esta novela se lleva una nota de 5/10 y nada mas, no es videojuego hardcore, sino una simpre novela para relajarse y difrutar de una gran historia y derramar lagrimas

review: I revisit this when I need to cry sometimes. It gets me every time for many reasons. I return after time has passed, and wonder, will I still cry? It breaks numbness. The plot is that deep; it makes you feel when you are so numb emotionally, you could pass as a robot. Highly recommended. Memento mori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079704709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1471654010}
review:
The game is amateurish if matched it to most modern VNs, but the story was strong and meaningful. The plot consists of two hospitalized characters, one whom is us (male character) and the other who is female. You really do get a feel for the characters as the story unfolds, and learn about the conflict and what course of actions the characters take, no matter how rash it may appear. 

Fun fact: the 2nd is actually a pre-sequel of the 1st. 

The arts and music in the game were harmonious, and really did set the mood in the story. I'm not to keen on playing it again, but it is defintely worth a try for anyone who hasen't yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219805677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1481627938}
review:
[h1]More the fool, I.[/h1]

So there I was in the wee small hours of the morning rubbing my sleepy eyes and thinking that maybe I'd spend a few minutes with a visual novel before turning in. That's right. [b]More the fool, I.[/b] I was still awake hours later with moist eyes and pondering what I'd just experienced. Narcissu 1st & 2nd deals with death and dying and the unfair fate of being terminally ill and expiring young before having much of a chance at living. It's also about those left behind. It's a story ( a group of stories, really) that is very complex, yet told in a very simple and endearing way. It's easy to see what a labor of love this is for the author.

A few small pointers:
[list]
[*]Don't rush this one. Set aside some time and take it slow.
[*]It doesn't seem to matter what order it's read in, but understand that Narcissu 2nd is something of a prequel.
[*]As mentioned above, Narcissu 1st & 2nd deal with death. It may not be suitable for small children.
[/list]
[b]TL;DR   A very moving story about the terminally Ill. Highly recommended.[/b] 10/10.

review:
You have to be very brave, this game includes a lot of reading.

If your japanese is a little rusty you can enjoy this visual novel without voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198077293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1476431795}
review:
All aboard the cry train, destination: tearsville!!
So yeah, it's a kinetic novel, about terminal illness, and how the sick people and people around them deal with this. Obviously you shouldn't go into this expecting to come out feeling all happy and carefree, but it does manage to touch on subjects that a lot of games would steer away from. 7/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048567103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1295, 'last_played': 1480132685}
review: narcissu is an absolutely breathtaking VN in an interesting style that keeps you focused on the story, providing atmosphere with stunning scenery and gorgeous music. the plot and the characters are touching in way that will be refreshing for VN veteran and get those new to the genre absolutely hooked- bring lots of tissues with you for this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093312686', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1482976191}
review:
Though bit old, Narcissu surely is timely classic that all Visual Novel fans should play. Beautiful cinematics, art, music, voice acting (though few and far between), and writing are all what make this an experience that will leave an impression on even the coldest of hearted.

The game explores the concepts of youth, freedom, illness, and [spoiler]suicide[/spoiler]. By the end of the game, the quiet atmosphere and story had me tearing up, with the game lingering on my mind for days on end. Simple, linear, and no decision making makes this a rather straightforward title, however this doesn't detract from the enjoyability by any means.

A great free introduction for those interested in the Anthology Project too! 

https://store.steampowered.com/app/426690/Narcissu_10th_Anniversary_Anthology_Project/ 

A MUST HAVE for both veterans and newcomers to the visual novel genre!
Thank you, stage-nana !

author: {'steamid': '76561198057568486', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1474040415}
review:
I couldn't complete the game, it was very sad yeah, but that's just part of a reason. My aunt died at the same time I played this game, this is the biggest coincidence of my life. It was so sad game, and then I hear something awful as the tragedy was told. She died in a hospital. This game is about hospital..

...Anyways, as I saw the start of the game and no other game have yet gave me sad feelings (only tv series and movies), so I nominated this game as "The â€œI'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eyeâ€ Award " in 2016 Steam Awards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026847982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1533776292}
review:
[b]Narcissu is a masterpiece among Visual Novels.[/b] To this day Iâ€™m saying this game made me sink into Visual Novels as a genre in general. 

Itâ€™s a narrative game in which you learn about a deadly disease and suffering of people. Given thatâ€™s a Kinetic Novel, thereâ€™s no choices or anything like that. But honestly, you donâ€™t need any of that. That way is just perfect for it. The characters are amazing. Have their own personalities and see their diseases in different ways. Most importantly though â€“ they make you (as a reader) realize how precious life is and appreciate things you have and take for granted. The whole story is followed by phenomenal soundtrack, which just adds up the value and heightens the feelings. And when it comes to feelings -> [b]YOU WILL CRY[/b].

I thought years ago this is a masterpiece and it still has not changed. If someone would ask me for recommendations of a Visual Novel, Narcissu takes the first spot. Itâ€™s free and delivers a serious blow to the gut that makes you fall in love with it and sink into the genre.

And when I said it will make you cry, I was serious. You can [strike]see [/strike] hear me cry on YouTube in videos, which are in [url= https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF6bMpb7g7_TrBmsqCEkRYAMzWNwZMEST]Narcissu[/url] and [url= https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF6bMpb7g7_Ta88dbJ_cUFGUmrv5_u5fW]Narcissu: Side2nd[/url] playlists. Oh yeah, this free game basically has two games in it!

https://youtu.be/MKh0atXbl14

https://youtu.be/-W6cXlYnMd4

author: {'steamid': '76561198061519611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1478526243}
review:
Narcissu is a kinetic novel (no choices, just reading) about several young people in a hospice (place for the terminally ill). As such, it is a fairly heavy story with none of the fan service/romance type of themes you might see in typical VNs.

I have to say that when I first started, I did not like the art and felt the game was confusing because you can't tell who is talking. The latter is because there is no sprite that shows up on the screen when someone is talking like in typical VNs. After finishing the game (about 4 hours total play time), those complaints are still there, but I was drawn in by the story. I think it is an interesting take on the philosophy of mortality. Just one of those games where you can think about it afterwards and decide whether it makes sense for you or not.

If you are into VNs I think it is worth a couple hours, especially since it is free. 

Tip: When you start a game, it will let you choose between launch screens. It is not obvious that you are actually picking between 1st or 2nd since there is no labeling. You should be playing 1st before 2nd for proper story continuity. You want the left screen for 1st, or right screen for 2nd. If you start the game and it talks about a boy, then you are in 1st. If you start and it takes about a family of girls, you are in 2nd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118301647', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1478201387}
review: This is a review for Narcissu 1st, I'll be doing 2nd later waiting until I recovered. But boy, What a emotional rollarcoaster. You are put into the shoes of a young man at the ripe age of 20 who was admitted to the 7th floor. Meaning he was 'awaiting advanced medical care" when in reality it just meant he was dying and no one could help him. There he met a beautiful women who was shorter but at the same time older than he was. From there bloomed a beautiful relationship. I won't go much farther because it's a story you need to experience yourself.  I do recommend playing through this Visual Novel. Not any choices but the story alone will set you along for a ride. Hell it's been two hours since I beat the game and I'm still crying. Narcissu 2nd Review will have to wait a bit for me to recover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002578537', 'num_games_owned': 1715, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1477315631}
review:
A sad but powerful tale that describes the very real despair and pain of terminal illness patients who have to deal with their impending doom, their feeling of powerlessness, and how they hope to cope with it all.

I'd definitely recommend the first one, and even though the second one helps understand why one of the characters in the first story is the way she is, I thought it took way too long. I liked both, but if I only had Narcissu 1st I wouldn't have complained.

Yeah, definitely check this out. But if you're doing this in one sitting, like I have, make sure to lighten up your mood afterwards. And appreciate life and all it has to offer.

review:
Hace aproximadamente un aÃ±o me leÃ­ la primera novela, y aunque en comparaciÃ³n de otras pueda pecar de "simple" es realmente bonita y emotiva, no es que se haya convertido de mis favoritas ni mucho menos pero es realmente recomendable de leer al ser corta y sobre todo gratuita. Este tipo de historia agradarÃ¡ especialmente a quienes busquen una historia cargada de sentimientos, y esta ocasiÃ³n tambien con una pizca de crueldad, o dicho de otra manera, realidad.

La segunda novela visual (que viene a ser precuela de la anteriormente nombrada) si al principio me pareciÃ³ aburrida en comparaciÃ³n con la primera, la segunda mitad me pareciÃ³ muy pero que muy buena, incluso me hizo llorar en cierto punto. Es una lÃ¡stima que la primera parte se me hiciera cuesta arriba en algÃºn momento pero me alegro de haber continuado leyendo aÃºn asÃ­. 

Â¿Recomiendo Narcissu 1st y 2nd? SÃ­, si buscas un tipo de novela visual tranquila y emotiva, ambas historias cumplirÃ¡n bien su cometido, ademÃ¡s de que siendo gratuitas no hay excusas para, al menos, dar una oportunidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242438868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1530591199}
review: These VNs are great for beginners, and veterns of the genre shouldn't shy away from them either. The music and artwork fit splendidly with the narrative of the story. The 1st one I prefer over the 2nd, but this is not a nock on the 2nd. The feels are real, have your tissues ready. The text doesnt break immersion. The plot is mind numbly interesting. But neither is perfect. Both are kinetic novels (No choices) and Im not a huge fan of this. Also, the 2nd provides good backstory to the 1st, but the suspense and mystery are totally killed by the knowledge of the 1st. If you liked these, check out ChuSingura 46+1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318058463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1473349223}
review:
Wow okay, I am sure many people may see a easy game to 100% especiallly if they read the guides on steam and realise I quick way around reading it all out I urge people to at least read all of the 1st one; I wasn't too sure about the story at first but at the end I was left with tears in my eyes and on the verge of crying' such a beautiful story even if you do not get it at first. 

It is a simple read yoru way through it, no choice options or anything like that but to me that didn't really matter, that story touched me in such a way that as I said made me have tears in my eyes, while I can not recommend this game to anyone that is more into being active and doing things in what you do rasther than just read, I can recommend it to anyone that has see's a value in the beautifulness of a good story or has been touched emotionally by games or things in the past.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993514796', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1472328608}
review:
My stats seem to be a bit broken for this one since I didn't have Steam open while I read through it but, I truly enjoyed this VN.  I tend to like VN's that get an emotional response from me and, even though the author said that he was trying to avoid doing so, he got one from me.

I still remember when I originally read Narcissu 1st back in 2005.  It hit me hard (whenever a novel of any kind opens up with suicide statistics you know you're in for an emotional ride) but, Side 2nd really fleshed out Setsumi's character in a nice way.  The epilogue even gives us closure for our unnamed reader surrogate protagonist from the first novel which really helped me tie up the loose ends in my mind.

With this being free too, it's an easy recommendation for anyone who enjoys this medium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170515406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1492235483}
review: Playing Narcissu is like entering a ring with a professional boxer. Prepare for emotional blow after blow, even when your eyes are swollen and weeping you stay in the ring until the very end. Better have the tissues near. Although the 2nd comes chronologically first I recommend playing 1st then 2nd. 1st helps get you into the world and tells a short sad sweet (albiet slow) story. 2nd is about twice as long and really gets you into the depth of the story of the true protagonists. Well written and nicely acted. Very nicely illustrated backgrounds and lovely if sparse character artwork. One minor complaint in the unrealistic nature of certain part (particularly the journey time in the first part) but if you can quiet the mathematical extreme logical part of your brain and just enjoy the emotional narative Narcissu is well worth the read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038743618', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1485367555}
review:
It's very understandable why this game is highly rated and recommended for those new to visual novels. The two vns are free, although there is no fancy CG or dirty scences, you shouldn't find your time wasted on these vns.

Plot: Very well written, able to make you have feels. The story doesn't lie to you.
Characters: You're given just enough information for the characters to be real and the rest is up to you.
Time: You can play both novels in under 5 hours.
Music: Music is pretty and appropriate
Voice Acting: not usually something i review in vn's, but even though i don't speak japanese, the emotion is apparent.
Take the time to read through these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073833195', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1534803974}
review:
Note: I've only finished Narcissu 1st and I'm working on 2nd. Will update review once I finish 2nd. 

This VN has surpassed my expectations, especially for it being a free download (a rarity on Steam and for a VN). Some people mentioned that it's really dated, and I do agree, but it's not a bad thing. The simple graphics and artwork make you appreciate the story more, and leaves everything more to your imagination. The soundrack so far has been amazing, and ties very well with the very melancholy/gloomy mood that 1st is set in. I have a feeling that the majority of my gameplay time will be just listening to the OST. The story was drawn out, but I think that was for the better as well. It allowed you time to connect and sympathize with Setsumi and the Protagonist. I knew what to expect with the ending, as it's typical with Japanese stories and VNs in particular, but man, that ending hit me hard. Tears weren't really shed, but the feels did hit me once I realized what happened. 

A very thought-provoking story, and I highly recommend it. Even if you aren't into the VNs, each story takes only a few hours to complete (Narcissu 1st can be completed in one sitting). Definitely worth the download. Read Narcissu 1st first voiced with English subs if you want to get the best experience.

10/10 would get the feels again.

review:
Nun wer schon immer keine Lust auf ReizÃ¼berflutung, fantastische Musik, eine berÃ¼hrende Lokalisierung oder eine optisch ansprechende Darstellung hatte, kann sich dieses PrachtstÃ¼ck von VN gÃ¶nnen. 
Der Charakter des Protagonisten ist clichÃ©behaftet, der von Setsumi geradezu beschÃ¤mend mittelmÃ¤ÃŸig.
Zugegeben es ist kein Fanservice-Fest wie zum Beispiel Nekopara aber man muss sich schon ZurÃ¼cklehnen und darÃ¼ber sinnieren ob ein Spiel eine positive Bewertung verdient wenn der einzig positive Aspekt auf dem fehlen von Borderline-Hentai Szenen beruht.

Insgesamt brauche ich eine komplette Entgiftung meines KÃ¶rpers und eine MÃ¶glichkeit mich um diese verlorene halbe Stunde wieder zu bereichern wobei mich ersteres wahrscheinlich in den Todestrakt der 7F zurÃ¼ckstauchen wÃ¼rdfe und mich zwingen wird mich aus einem 15cm Spalt in den Tod zu stÃ¼rzen.

Wie man aus dem Gesamtbild meiner Kritik extrapolieren kann hat mich dieses Spiel so kalt gelassen wie eine mitzwanzigjÃ¤hrige totenstarre Leiche im KÃ¼hlraum eines Japanischen Salarymans.

Alternativ empfehle ich jedem der seine Dosis Narcissu 1st & 2nd noch nicht eingenommen hat ein Glas Eiter zu leeren.
Versucht nicht mich zu bekehren,

author: {'steamid': '76561198017655609', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1469417195}
review:
(This review is only about Narcissu 1st, as I have not played the second one yet)

I went into this game with very low expectations, I believe because I stumbled upon a bunch of negative reviews that sounded really reasonable.

My criticisms are basically only about the presentation. Contrary to what you'd read in other reviews, it's not because it's too minimalistic: I respect a conscious decision by a developer, and some people (me included) might even like the approach. My problem is that whoever made this VN has contradicted themselves with weird design choices: judging by the in-game commentary, it seems that the intent of the game was to leave most things up to the player's imagination, and they couldn't decide wether the game had to have voice acting or not, so they gave you the option to choose.

This would have been absolutely the right choice, if it weren't for the fact that the game has the actual characters appear, even if just once or twice throughout the whole VN, which to me completely negates the whole "I want you to imagine it" experimental book approach. It's either contradictory, or I didn't get what the author meant, or he was just referring to imagining the characters voices?

Anyway, all of that is nothing more than a minor complaint: especially for a free game, the story dealt with such a heavy theme in a way that would result "boring" only to people who failed to read between the lines, and truth be told the story and character development is not even that subtle (including having some occasional moe-y tropes, but rare and well placed, and this is coming from someone who doesn't like that kind of thing), yet in its "light" approach it manages not to neglect the serious theme that is being used. In a way, the premise itself is what makes you see such a sequence of seemingly mundane events in an entirely different way. ...actually, that's probably pretty much the whole point of the VN and I'm just stating the obvious because I'm dumb.

Difficult to say why I liked it so much. I suppose the theme of what to do when going towards certian death has always fascinated me (in fact, I tried this VN to study how other authors approached this theme, since I am writing something with that theme myself), and that kept me in a constant state of... not tension, but something like that? Another term that right now I can't find, something that has more to do with dread and bittersweetness.

It's a small game dealing with a big theme and it definitely surpassed my expectations: definitely struck a chord with someone like me who is usually not very emotional, so I'd say give it a try. Best experienced when in the right mood.

Another minor criticism: the ending (when the male character speaks for the last time, not the "other character's ending" before that) was a bit clichÃ¨ if not even cheesy, but at the very least still came off as emotionally touching as the rest of the game due to its context.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999346443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1469851743}
review:
Is this what "visual novels" are? Absolutely ZERO gameplay, just some reading over pretty panels and to some touchy music here and there?

I'm sure there are many people who would like this, but this is not for me and I don't recommend it to anybody really. If I want to read, I read a proper book, and don't need pretty pictures or music for that, either.

I gave it an honest go, though; I did actually go through each story (granted, second time around was just excercise in clicking fast without even watching, just to get achievements) and even there, for me... it's rather 'meh'. Slowly paced stories about terminally ill people. Touchy-feely-artsy, eh?

I would rather play something like To The Moon, where it's touchy-feely, too, but at least more of a proper game... Brothers: Tale of Two Sons another great touchy-feely game but leveraging the medium of a video game... Heck, I would even recommend more something like Dear Esther or Gone Home for walking simluations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275097140', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1470561436}
review:
Free to play, awesome script, short but touching story...

What will you do, if you know your life is like the sand in a sandglass?

There're no tears, no bereavements, but I feel so depressed when the story comes to the end

A splendid story, a tale in the winter

Please, bloom our life as a splendid blossom. 

One day we will finally come to the end of our life, but, we can do everything we can, to color the road we walked through.

12/10 Recommend for every adults.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037850703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1468320482}
review:
Fantastic, nihilistic entry level visual novels. While available for ten years prior to this, the port is free of any flaws, has multiple translations available and has optional voice acting. The dojin group that made these games, â€œStage-Nanaâ€ got a lot of mileage out of the relatively few art assets in the game, and tell an impact story without being pretentious (which, considering the subject material is damn hard). 

Unlike other visual novels, there isnâ€™t really an option to input any â€œchoiceâ€ in the story, thereâ€™s no interaction from the player. I wouldnâ€™t consider this a flaw, as the stories are short by comparison to other VNâ€™s and it completely works for the type of story theyâ€™re trying to tell. 

Oh, and itâ€™s free. So thereâ€™s that. If you dig visual novels, or thought The Antlerâ€™s â€œHospiceâ€ was a bit too upbeat for you, give this a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045173210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1468106170}
review:
[b]PROS:[/b]

+ Great story which will make you cry like a bitch (Play this game at nights.)
+ Good soundtrack which fits perfectly to the story. (I even made a remix for one of the tracks!)
+ 1st story leaves you with lots of questions in mind. 2nd story is a prelogue, it answers all these questions and punches you right in the face with dem feels.
+ First-person narrative is a great choice for this game!
+ I managed to finish the stories without having any break. So the story is that good :)
+ It's free, it's not short and it comes with achievements.

[b]CONS:[/b]

???

? I didnt enjoyed the character visuals nor the voiceovers. But this might because im not an anime fan.
? The story wont tell you anything about the deadly disease. So you wont learn anything about it.
? At first you might get bored but some time later story will hook you. At the 2nd story you might get confused but things will be clear near the ending.

[b]VERDICT:[/b] Im depressed as fuck.

[b]STEAM AWARDS - NOMINATED:[/b] The â€œI'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eyeâ€ Award

author: {'steamid': '76561198158536059', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1486786464}
review:
on that blindingly bright day 

on that very day of winter 

This is a story of disease and suffering

of medication and adverse effects

of thoracotomy scars and cellular poisons;

of the living who cannot help but to die and of the dying who cannot help but to live;

of a resting place other than "on 7F" or "at home".

This is a story of so many things.

But most of all 

This is the story

of a girl whose heart was standing still

and a boy whose breath was being stolen away,

both of whom die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263136721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1595750938}
review:
The hospice, when the life starts to wither and no ways back.
The hospice, when death is knocking the door and no ways to shoo it away.
Make it short, narcissu shows the relationship of dying people, the role they play (to be left, leaving, and bystander).
The story is so rich, so deep and give new meaning of regret, hope, condemn. pray, and helpessness.
And if, just if, your time is decided. What is your list of ten things to do before dying?
Is making peace with yourself included?

author: {'steamid': '76561198062301817', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1463713389}
review:
You may have wondered sometimes what's the meaning of life. This question takes a whole other sense when you'll die young and you're aware of it. Narcissu explores this theme, the fatality of death, and it does it very well. 

Both games are heavy, but the second one is somewhat a little more light-hearted. The characters have more personality and more drive, and one of the protagonists even manages to be funny, or at least tries to. However, both are beautiful stories. They show people trying to make the most of their life despite how short it will be, and despite how sick and weak they will have to face it.

Even though those are very sad stories that made me feel down, I enjoyed them and recommend to read them to anyone interested in dark stories that make you reflect on life and the absurdity of it. Aftwerwards, it made me feel good and optimistic: yes, there will be a point in my life where I have few things I'll be able to do in my remaining time like the characters in Narcissu, but contrary to them, I have the chance to live a fulfilling life filled with many experiences until then. I hope that's how you'll take it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202368430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1656867164}
review:
A very sad and well written story.
also the music for the Side 2nd OP was very good

author: {'steamid': '76561198063240304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1450692832}
review:
This game was really sad. But it was very enjoyable to read. I, a very visual novel obssesed guy enjoyed this game to an extent which people wouldnt comprehend. This game teaches you so many things in life that you will see the world in a whole different way. Although i must say...i was dissapointed in the ending. I had a better ending in my head but i guess...that would have never happened. This game teaches you that you should never give up, and dont give up on your loved ones. Even if they are saying stuff like "forget me" or "just leave me alone". Not to mention that people who are healthy are having it the best. People who have a job, car and basically everything which you would "normally" have.

Nonetheless i recommend checking this game out. I recommend it to everybody, and i guarantee you that you will learn things which you would have never learned before.

- Riki

author: {'steamid': '76561198287165636', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1470406363}
review: This is truly a VN that everyone should try out. It has touched me a lot. While it's sad, it is not as much of a tear-jerker, and it is not meant to be one. But the strength of this one isn't in an over-emotional end, but a beautifully written story that makes you live an even more beautiful journey and see how do the characters deal with all of things that seem trivial to the "others", but seem not-so trivial to them because of the state they're in. This VN evokes as many questions as it moves emotions. It tackles a really touchy and thought-provoking topics. Personally, I could relate to a good amount the inner thoughts that occured to certain characters. Definitely worth trying. I go as far as to say it is perfect, if perfection exists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081808619', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1463719880}
review:
First off, this is not a game in the least bit, and there are no choices other than to just click to continue the story.

Secondly, I have never read through a more time consuming, depressing story in my life. 

If you want to be extremely depressed for no reason at all, and if you like to watch SPCA commercials, this is for you.
Embrace your sadness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063731333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1463446824}
review:
It's 02:00 and I just finished this for the second time in maybe 3 or 4 years. I never bothered to review it the first time though, because I wasn't sure how to put into words what I experienced. I still don't think I am.

Oddly, there's not a lot to say. This novel is profoundly beautiful in its minimalistic presentation, the way the characters (of which there's only really one) are conveyed is surprisingly simplistic, yet that's where a lot of the emotional impact comes from. 

It's strange, but your character themselves is more of a passive proxy for describing the futility and beauty of the last few days of someone's life. There isn't a major amount of dialog, but what little is there really serves to illustrate the feeling this someone experiences in their last few days alive; to die on 7F or at home. A last act of defiance.

Music is fantastic, very fitting with the rest of the novel in that it's melancholic, passive yet still powerful enough to pull you into the scene and hope for the best. Not a ton of scenes, but they aren't the focal point anyway; they don't even take up that much of the screen. Text is also presented well in a nice, minimalistic fashion, yet still descriptive enough to paint some really great imagery.

It's a really unique experience, but probably not something you want to read before going to a party or something. It's a beautiful short story. I wouldn't recommend this one if you're depressed though. There's not really a happy ending here, beyond the freedom of the last few days; you're probably just going to get upset.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094270356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1482057384}
review:
This is a pretty depressing visual novel. It captures the feeling of depression so beautifully. Honestly I don't know if I should recommend this novel or not.

Depending on your perspective, you can interpret this story as good or bad.

In my point of view, this kind of story make me realize how lucky we are to be given the chance to live our life as meaningful as we can. Not everyone has that chance in life. 

If you yourself have experienced losing your loved ones, or currently have someone close to you suffering from a terrible illness, I recommend you read this. 

This novel expresses the feelings of people that are in the process of dying from sickness with no hope to be cured.

I DO NOT recommend reading this to people who are currently suffering from depression though. I'm afraid that reading this will make you more depressed than you already are. No matter what happens in life, don't lose hope.

One of the most respectable and beautiful visual novels yet released to Steam. While there are a few compareably high quality Visual novels with a stories centered around important life lessons this one is the most memorable yet. The story is deeply touching with a wide range of emotions and also very thought provoking. The scenery is an incredible mix of anime styling with realistic touches further giving it a personal feel. For those who would like more out of the Narcissu series for a small cost I recommend purchasing the Narcissu 10th Anniversary Anthology Project so that you can see more of the story surrounding Himeko from the side 2nd.

Similar games that I also recommend: 
Season of 12 Colors
Ame no Marginal
To the Moon
Planetarian

author: {'steamid': '76561198017919951', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1459515570}
review:
The entire Narcissu series is a thought-provoking and heart-breaking story about people who have reached a point where their disease becomes incurable and so they are delivered to a palliative care ward in a hospital, commonly referred to as "the Seventh floor" in this series.

Playing through the first part and the second part was equally as touching and heart-breaking as you are pretty much introduced straight to the case. The young character(s) you are "playing" this visual novel as is/are diagnosed with a terminal illness, so they are sent to the "Seventh floor" where they receive palliative, non-curative treatment as there is no treatment for their illnesses (in the first, the second part's hero is a young girl who is a frequent patient at a local hospital). From there on you get to experience how they deal with their condition, see their more interesting days, take note of sparks of possible hope for the characters.

Stories like these really have a tendency to break your heart and force a tear out of you.

However, on the other side, there is a bit of a problem with how the developer(s) described the palliative, non-curative treatment floor (remember, the Seventh floor). It felt almost like a lifeless area where nurses and doctors didn't seem even interested on making sure their patients are doing fine, while in reality, palliative treatment teams are always keen on making sure their patient experiences the best they can before their final hour's arrival.

Still, the tragic stories in these visual novels are solid. They are well thought-out, well-described and, if you can empathize with people, then these stories are sure to force a tear out of you and make you feel sad for a long, long time.
