author: {'steamid': '76561198084464400', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1458059075}
review:
PROS:
- very emotional
- touching story
- one of the best soundtracks ever <3
- easy achievements
- 2 stories and one mini story

CONS:
- it will capture you until you finished it (it was 6 AM that day :O )
- only a few different pictures

RESULT:
A must play visual novel, with one of the most touching stories I've ever experienced. <3
The soundtrack really helps to create this emotions and it is even awesome to listen to without playing the game. The 2 stories are very awesome writen and you really want to know, how it ends. You can't close it, unless you finished it. I remember playing it till 6 AM, because I wanted to complete the game. This story was simply so good.  <3
The only little bummer is, that there are only a really few pictures inside it. I would have loved, if there were more inside. ;)
But it's forgiven, I wish to do same good as this game, when I develope my characters and story. ;) (\Ã´/)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077974929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1456885922}
review:
I came into this game knowing that it was about sick characters and I left caring about those sick characters. It is definitely worth a play through. The 2nd one was the better one and the only I actually cried on. The flow and the characters of that one really gets you. It's hard not to get attached to the characters. The 1st one wass alright, just not as emotionally tugging as the 2nd. It only really followed two characters and their really long car ride.

The images of the game are beautiful, no doubt about that. Although there was at least one that struck me as strange. I'm not sure if describing it would be spoilers, but for someone who just got out of a long hospital stay, their face would not look like that when they get on the bar. Unless she had magic anime muscles, which might explain everything. Just a minor detail though, the art isn't at all bad! (They all look like children too, even the adults. But again, minor detail.)

The music was just great. It really fits with the situations and gives you the feel of this being their moment. I don't know how to describe it, actually. Just know that if I had rewards to give out for best music in visual novels, this game would get all of them.

It has voice acting, if that's what you're into. But I honestly just rushed through that part and played through it silent twice to get the achievements. To me, since i played it silent the first time around, all the characters had their own voice inside my head. The actual voices aren't bad though.

Do I recommend this? Heck yes. Definitely. Play it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045602137', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1474142375}
review: Sound stopped working? I was playing and all of a sudden the music and voices just cut out. My headphones were not muted and are working just fine. I have sound in everything else, but just not this game? I tried uninstalling and reinstalling multiple times, but to no avail. I never got more than that first 5 minutes of music and voices. Other than this, pretty good game. Anyone with this problem?

review: This story was heart wrenching and heart warming at times. The music was beautiful, story was written and translated well, there was solid voice acting, art was pretty good, and the characters were relatable in some ways. It deserves my rating of 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183290835', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1527356970}
review:
[h1]Touching story. But quite long and kinetic[/h1]

The story is very touching. It may get boring after a while since its kinetic and quite long. But thats the only con it has. Otherwise the story, the music and the graphics were cool. And personally, I liked the 2nd part more than the 1st.

Not recommended for people who are more into action related stuff. This game can be really sad and depressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062567427', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1460372509}
review:
This is indeed a very, very sad story.
The game put me into depression for some time.

[i]One of the worst feeling in this world?[/i] 
[spoiler]Saying goodbye. That kind of goodbye which you will never see the person again.[/spoiler]

[b][u]Narcissu 1st[/u][/b]
[i]"There was only one picture recorded of her smile in this cheap throwaway camera...but it was proof that we lived."[/i]

Narcissu is a very text-based VN. Rather than saying it is a VN, it seems more like a 2 hours movie. Different from typical VNs, it has very few illustration and pictures. However, the awesome soundtracks and BGMs successfully compensate the lack of visual presentation. It carries reader along with the story.

One worth-mentioning point is that the gender of the protagonist is unrevealed until the very late chapter. It leaves the reader to freely imagine and make assumption. Whether the protagonist is a boy or a girl in reader's mind, the story still makes sense. And at the end, [spoiler] I got it wrong. (god idk why) [/spoiler]

[b][u]Narcissu 2nd[/u][/b]
[i]If.. I were a saint, it... my words were.. not simply for comfort... "Then now, a miracle would happen" [/i]

Story of Narcissu 2nd takes place before Narcissu 1st. A story of another person with the same despairing fate. However, it is a bit lengthy. Although it explains some circumstances which have made me curious in Narcissu 1st, there are no remarkable facts that surprise me. Reader may lose interest in it. Personally, I got a bit bored at certain point. The story didnâ€™t hook me like the 1st did.

Lastly,
[b]"sore ja... sayonara... "[/b] Might be the last thing you do not want to heard from your loved ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046516422', 'num_games_owned': 1790, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1496897500}
review:
Do you like the feels?
Because I felt them.
So hard.
I played through Narcissu 2nd and let me tell you this, I cried so much by the end of it. I haven't even had the chance to play 1st, yet I still cried so much. Currently predicting the 1st will just be a cluster of feels all over again, but ten times worse.

10/10 would cri again

author: {'steamid': '76561198067696359', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1456319480}
review:
This VN dispels the coldness of my mind...
I finally found the drama of life that really can fill my empty heart...
It gives me more than what i receive from "my life"... 

The story, the character's voices, the musics, the backgrounds... 
All of them just make this VN so beautiful and... so sad...

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059146314', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1479971176}
review:
This is one of the best visual novels a have played, ItÂ´s pretty well written and very detailed, with a not very affable or pleasant theme but with a great value.

I would alert that this history is sad, and a lot of people look the whole plot as it, I personally found it at the end as a message of acceptance and optimism, giving a feel of hope, confidence and so  the depart of someone.
 
The game has some languages support and come with subtitles and also dubbed, It has an amazing soundtrack (too much that I ended buying it lol), I recommend the use of headset while playing, It shows some really good artwork that with combination of the sound effects you can get a good perspective of the protagonist, and also the game now comes with achievements for each chapter you have completed.    

I have to say that I donÂ´t consider this a videogame but it can be enjoyable as one, so if you are not in to this kind of stuff, just give it a try now, itÂ´s for free, and I hope you can enjoy it too! :)

Oh,[b] a little note[/b], for me it was pretty slow the moment of changing to the next dialogue, so to do it faster change the speed on menu, also press Â¨AÂ¨ to put autoplay mode, It would be even better.  

I gave it a 9/10, I really enjoy every moment of it, and had a good time but as I said, I donâ€™t consider it a game but more on a style of a book.

I hope you will have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251948454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1495759844}
review:
Il me reste encore quelques chapitres de la 2nde VN, mais je peux d'ores et dÃ©jÃ  donner mon avis... Ces nouvelles, mÃªme si trÃ¨s peu illustrÃ©es (les mÃªmes images encore et encore), vous font voyager Ã  travers tellement d'Ã©motions, Ã  condition que vous soyez un tant soit peu impliquÃ©s vous-mÃªmes dans ces deux histoires. Tristesse, colÃ¨re, bonheur, joie... Je pense que chacun de nous se reconnaÃ®tra Ã  un moment ou un autre dans un personnage, un lieu ou encore un moment.

J'ai pour habitude de dÃ©sinstaller de mon PC les VNs de Steam, qui en gÃ©nÃ©ral, une fois lues, n'ont plus grand intÃ©rÃªt, et les relire n'apporterait plus grand chose passÃ©e la premiÃ¨re lecture. En revanche, celle-ci est tellement belle, je suis sÃ»r de la garder pour la relire, encore et encore. 

Seule petite bÃ©mol, c'est en anglais, donc dur Ã  partager avec des personnes qui ne parlent pas ou peu anglais (connaissant le niveau d'anglais moyen du FranÃ§ais, voilÃ  quoi...). Mais sinon, bon tordage de boyaux, sortez les mouchoirs !

author: {'steamid': '76561198149679647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1451959269}
review:
It was not what I would consider a "game" by any means.. It was not very interactive. It was just a story book with sound effects. But the storyline was awesome... A real tear jerker!!!!! 

It makes you really think about what 'life' is, and how much it is worth. After reading this story(yes, READING the story) it really made me stop taking my health; and life; for granted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104834708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1454865594}
review:
Narcissu is very different from most visual novels on steam particularly when you consider the story. Narcissu 1st and 2nd focuses on the lives of terminally ill characters and their struggles coping with loss of hope, fear, denial and guilt whilst covering the legacy of the 7th floor.

The topic covered is very thought provoking i feel that it has been handled pretty well with some beatiful poetic writing, mystery adds to the backstory of characters also the musical score is selected well and greatly compliments the mood and emotions within scenes. I would like more artwork but it is well drawn this is forgiveable as the narrative is the key strength of this Visual novel i would recommend reading the 2nd part first before reading the first part as this will give you a better feel for the story plus thats the chronological order,

I would recommend this VN 8/10 PS have a box of tissues ready it can get pretty emotional.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999259229', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1430380270}
review: Sad Story, but if you have some time to read a story about characters enjoying the very end, I recommend this visual novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273740951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1454624356}
review:
Spoilerfree review:

- Visual Novel: You basically read it with some really pretty visuals and music. The voiceacting is little and Japanese, but really good. You practically click your way through the story, it's pretty sweet and tragic. From the artwork at firs tI had expected sth-loli-like or maybe fanservice, but the game has a good tone. It's mostly novel-like in that it shows you the environment with music, but very little of the actual characters and they're not as young as you'd think.
- 1 and 2 can be played independantly. If a tragic ending or Visual novel-styles don't turn you off, it's a really great game and overall very good quality for a free game. 
- Once you've finished you can also just listen to the soundtrack for free and run it in the background like a CD and check out extras such as commentary on the game and development.
- Easy achievements for those who want them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095821086', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1454548984}
review:
[h1]VN fans will love this[/h1]

This title has a great soundtrack and a nice art style, so those that truly love VNs will appreciate this. As for me personally, I just CTRLed my way through this to get the achievements. Still a cool effort nonetheless.

[b]7/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198046737869', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1454394097}
review:
If you haven't already gone through this visual novel, please do so. It may be free but it's most definitly worth your time.
And please, start with the 2nd Narcissu first. It definitly offers more of a payoff that way, and the notes do state that that is the preferred way of reading it.

But anyway, my review.
I wasn't ready for the amount of feels I was going to get from a free visual novel. I didn't expect much, ya know? But boy, was I plesantly surprised. Though, I use plesant in a weird way: I had a great time wiping away my tears, I guess.

There were issues, yes. The panel changing was a little odd sometimes. There were spelling errors drizzled about. I even had two clicks that were just odd symbols for who knows why. But there are easly looked over if you just skim like I did.

Narcissu 1st was definitly the odd ball for me. There were questionable actions taken by the characters and some things I felt were not well explained, but the ending was so worth the journey there and most everything that was confusing was explained in the 2nd part. But as I said in the very beginning, if you start with the 2nd it should make more sense.

I don't have much else to say, other than the fact that you /need/ to play this game if you like visual novels. Take it with a grain of salt because it's a totally free experiance, but it's an experiance you don't want to miss.
Oh, and don't forget to pass on the rules. It's a legacy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120657384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1454367384}
review:
This game as the writer tries to say, is not a tear-jerker game. It is such a tear-jerker. In ways I didn't think were possible. 

There needs to be more to this game. I need to know what happens next and where the story goes. If this game were to cost money and i knew how good it was, I would buy it in an instant. This is one of the best story driven games I've played in a while now, and I want so much more to this! 

This was an amazing game and i would recrommend it to anyone who is into story driven games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117807044', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1624209129}
review: I only started this Visual Novel yesterday and I have already completed it. I really enjoyed the story and warmed to the characters and found some the topics it raises interesting and thought-provoking. It had some nice images too, though this isn't really the sort of game you'd download for graphics. I like the soundtrack and it fits the story well. I would have paid for the game. And will probably play again in a few months time, just in case I missed anything the first time around.  I don't think it will be everyone's cup of tea as there's not a huge amount of light-relief from the heavy subject matter but if you are fine with that, it might be one for you.

Several times I had a thick lump in my throat and in the scene at Mount Fuji (2nd part) was my hold back the tears no longer possible. Very nice is also the "Video" in the 2nd part of the chapter. "15 Summer". Wonderful.

This story should not be missed under any circumstances (it costs only a little life, but this is totally worth it).

Two thumbs up. Please play !!!! Uhh, click !!!

Another Game-Tip "That Dragon, Cancer Â° Really hard substance (Scream Scene).

Dieses Spiel, man kann es eigentlich gar nicht so nennen, also diese â€Weiter-Klickâ€œ-Geschichte beweist einmal mehr, dass es keinem riesigen Budget und keiner â€Bombastâ€œ-Grafik bedarf um eine wirklich (be)rÃ¼hrende Geschichte zu erzÃ¤hlen.

Diesem (kostenlosen) Kleinod gelingt es mit einfachsten Stielmitteln, zum Beispiel den fein ausgearbeiteten Charakteren oder der bezaubernde Sound/Musikuntermalung, intensivste Emotionen zu wecken.

Man muss sich und der Geschichte natÃ¼rlich ausreichend Zeit geben um in ihr eintauchen zu kÃ¶nnen. Schnelles wegklicken der Dialoge ist hier wirklich fehl am Platze und zerstÃ¶rt die Wirkung vollends (STRG-Taste gedrÃ¼ckt halten).

Das Thema ist sehr ungewÃ¶hnlich und beklemmend. Es paÃŸt sehr gut in das relativ neue Genre der "Empathie-Spiele".  Die Story handelt von sterbenden Kindern in einem Hospiz und den daraus entstammenden Problemen. Die Charaktere mÃ¼ssen sich mit den Fragen, â€Wieso ich ?â€œ, â€Wie falle ich meinen AngehÃ¶rigen nicht zur Last ?â€œ, â€Will ich mir den Zeitpunkt meines Sterben diktieren lassen ?â€œ, auseinandersetzen.

Der 1. Teil der Geschichte berichtet vom Ende der Protagonistin Setsumi. Der 2. Teil erzÃ¤hlt die Vorgeschichte von Setsumi dazu und bringt viele Nebencharaktere und deren individuellen Geschichten, welche alle vielfÃ¤ltig miteinander verwoben sind, ein und schlieÃŸt am Ende den Kreis zum 1. Teil.

Speziell zum Ende des 2. Teils geht es immer mehr um religiÃ¶se Themen (â€zu jedem Gebet gibt es auch einen Fluchâ€œ), philosophische AnsÃ¤tze (â€ist ein Suizid zu rechtfertigen ?â€œ, â€darf ich meine AngehÃ¶rigen enttÃ¤uschen ?â€œ) und um die Frage nach dem eigenen hinterlassenen FuÃŸabdruck auf unserem Planeten.

Offensichtlich sind die Designer/Autoren der Geschichte mit dem Thema Hospiz und Suizid sehr vertraut (Personal, AngehÃ¶riger oder Patient).

Positiv zu nennen ist auch die deutsche Lokalisierung, welche sicherlich nicht perfekt, aber doch sehr gut gelungen ist und einem somit die MÃ¶glichkeit bietet diese Geschichte kennenlernen zu kÃ¶nnen.

Leider gibt es auch einige â€LÃ¤ngenâ€œ und einige Elemente welche zu oft eingesetzt werden (zirpende Zikaden, Eisessen, u.Ã¤.).

Fazit:

Mehrfach hatte ich einen dicken Klos im Hals und in der Szene am Berg Fuji (2. Teil) war mir ein zurÃ¼ckhalten der TrÃ¤nen nicht mehr mÃ¶glich. Sehr schÃ¶n ist auch das â€Videoâ€œ im 2. Teil im Kapitel â€15. Sommerâ€œ. Wundervoll.

Diese Geschichte sollte man sich auf keinen Fall entgehen lassen (kostet ja nur etwas Lebenszeit, aber diese ist sie vollkommen wert).

author: {'steamid': '76561198224808192', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1453161025}
review:
Did you like Clannad Afterstory? How about Anohana, or Angel Beats? Well this anime- er visual novel, is definately for you! Similar artstyle to Clannad, with a soft drawing style to it. Many feels like the above mentioned and more- because this stuff is real and happens all the time. Not to mention, the dialogue and characters are very much interesting and references are well placed. I'd love to see an anime adaptation of the full Narcissu series actually, and I'd watch the hell out of that. 

There was a few problems of course. Minor spelling errors, some words repeated twice or when clicking the diolgue it sometimes would just show a random number. This might be an error in coding but it wasn't anything too bothersome. Also, this isn't the kind of VN where you make important choices to change how the story goes, so that might be a downside for you. To boot, the story is very long and to those easily bored or hating endless text this might make you drop this amazing story altogether... which sucks for you.  

I ran the full first and second parts with voice actors which really did add to the whole thing. The voice actors were great and their voices suited how their character was very well. However, at times certain ones would get a bit too loud and annoying. 

Can I just mention how AMAZING the animation scenes were? I felt like I was not playing a VN, but watching an actual anime every now and then. And the music was absolutely beautiful and breathtaking. I still have the songs running in my mind at this moment. Overall this VN is definately something I'd recommend if you don't mind a long and good story and want to cry your face off for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172106854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1452143853}
review: Well, I can only praise this visual novel and the people who made this. I recommend playing at least the first part in one sitting (it's not that long that it would be impossible -around 3 hours in a slower reading pace-) to maximize its feelings and its atmosphere. The first one was a masterpiece 10/10, while i was reading it I felt like i was theras if I was the protagonist, however the 2nd slide didn't make that big of an impression on me (after you read the first it "barely" had anything to give other than a great story), I'd still rate it around 8 or 9 out of 10. I haven't played the unvoiced versions yet, but I probably will reread it especially the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066265556', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1455301812}
review:
Narcissu est mon premier Visual Novel et restera le plus Ã©mouvant, combien de larme ai-je versÃ© dessus ...
Une vÃ©ritable perle, une histoire sensationnel.

Ne vous attendez pas Ã  des voix trop kawaii, des images ecchi et toutes autres banalitÃ©s d'aujourd'hui, mais admirez plutÃ´t les magnifiques dessins simplistes tout en profitant de l'histoire au maximum.

En revenche, c'est dommage qu'il ne soit pas disponible en FranÃ§ais sur steam, regrettable, sachant que des traductions existes, certe non officielle, mais tout Ã  fait correcte. Steam Ã  un vrai manque de langue disponible sur les Visual Novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089514448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1442377069}
review:
Visual novel about the certainty of death in the lives of two terminally ill kids. The dialog, music and story gives insight to what we are doing with the precious time that we have and how we choose to spend it.

Bringing back memories from the hospital and of friends in it just makes me realize how well the story develops with these characters. The story touched my heart...

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198125442171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1450748855}
review: I started playing visual novels a couple of years ago by chance. I haven't played a lot but the ones I have had, always had a darker and more mature storyline. If you are into that, Narcissu is a great starting visual novel. The first game lasts for about 2 hours, but both games are well worth your while. This is one is a well hidden gem which I would recommend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983485859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1450790086}
review:
It's sad to unrecommend a game, and I don't do it often. More than that, it's been a long time since I've felt compelled to write a review at all. But shortly after starting the second part I started to feel the urge to write this.

I've feel bored, confused and aimless with this game. I've played a lot of visual and kinetic novels, including some [spoiler]sad[/spoiler] ones, so no blame on the playability aspects is put. It's about the content and "art direction".

Maybe it's because of my personal beliefs on the matter of [spoiler]suicide[/spoiler] that I couldn't connect at all with the characters. The lack of character art, descriptions, context... aggravated that. In fact, I probably enjoyed the best the second part prologue, which is the part with [spoiler]no drama[/spoiler] in it. I guess that the styling of the message didn't favour the content of the message at all. Of course, this may be different for you (YMMV).

I failed to see the message of the work too. Often I found myself wondering "What should I be feeling or asking myself?". Even after reading the game notes I'm not sure of the purpose of the work. And I think that's at least partially a fault of the design decisions.

As an example of this, I didn't like the voices, nor the art. The voices would have suited best some half-hearted commedy than this story ambitioning to be as deep as possible without being less broad and remaining evocative to the reader. More than support the story, the voices broadened the gap between story and reader. And I'm a player that as often as possible relies on text-to-speech synthesis to voice unvoiced games. The most interesting game reflection is the one I'm having while writing the review. The author asks himself, as you can read in the game notes, whether the game's assets must be kept minimalistic to not impose a particular view. Probably the neutral TTS voices I usually listen to do the trick of increasing my enjoyment of games without being intrussive.

Closing, finally. Many people seemed to enjoy this game. However the game is so lacking that can be very hard to enjoy at all. While not being a bad game, it's one of the dullest I've ever played, a remarkably unremarkable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053739541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1448874324}
review:
There's nothing much to say about Narcissu 1st & 2nd
Beautiful stories.
Excellent music.
Tho [most of] the CGs are small (panoramic), relative to the resolution, the art is very good. Even after being stretched to fill my screen, they still look good.

It's mostly like reading a book but you can hear some voices of narrative and most of the people speaking, which is real nice. The voice actresses did a splendid job.

Such a gem of a free game. Worth every second I spent playing it. 9/10

I'm looking forward to the release of the 10th anniversary anthology project!

author: {'steamid': '76561198257636818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1448782992}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078732092', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1448578541}
review:
This was a wonderful experience. The story is well-written, and honestly, it prompted me to reflect on the value and shortness of life. It's a short visual novel, but it powerfully evokes emotions in the brief time we get to know the protagonist and Setsumi, whose lives are made brief due to their respective illnesses. Though the characters are distant at first, there is an intimacy between the them that develops which was touching and the soundtrack and voice track simply enhance the experience. For a doujin work, the artwork is quite well done and the minimalistic approach of presenting the setting and characters allowed me to have a more personalized experience with the story. The rare moments when I actually got to see the Setsumi's face actually felt precious. I really liked this approach. However, I did notice some inconsistencies with some of the art, but it was not terribly noticeable.
It's a touching story about two terminally ill patients who are unhappy with their situation, who go on a search for a place that they can die peacefully. It's a tear-jerking story and it is well worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989985442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1446588012}
review:
Narcissu is a very touching story about how unavoidable death is.
In the first part of the game the protagonist is a boy who doesnt really have a goal in his life. When he gets sick he soon hears that he cant be cured and is going to die. Because of this he needs to go to the seventh floor of the hospital where he meets a girl who also is going to die but neither wants to die there nor at her home...

The second part of the game is about the girl who the protagonist meets in the hospital. In this part she has yet to be sent to the seventh floor and meets someone who will change her life forever...

The game has a really beautifull story and you can choose if you want to play it with or without voice acting. The developer gave the player this option because he wants the player to be able to imagine the voice but also understands that some would rather hear the text spoken. For this same reason there arent many images of the characters in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981189539', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1447517468}
review:
Narcissu merges an absolutely stunning soundtrack to a heartfelt story. The way they weave together music and artwork makes this graphic novel something extra. Narcissu will make you feel. It will tug at your heartstrings.

This is one of the most touching stories I have ever read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115938776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1447267236}
review:
Game: Narcissu 1st & 2nd
Genre: Visual Novel
Developer: stage-nana/Sekai Project
System: Steam (PC)
Total Score: 72/100
Value Score: 7.2/10

â€¢ Story: 8/10
â€¢ Characters: 8/10
â€¢ GamePlay: 4/10	
â€¢ Graphics: 7/10
â€¢ Sound: 9/10
â€¢ Music: 10/10
â€¢ Length: 5/10
â€¢ Replay Value: 4/10
â€¢ Player Value: 7/10

Pros
+Touching and emotional storyline
+Fantastic Soundtrack
+A lot of extra features/extra side content
+2 games in one
+Free to play on Steam

Cons
-Completely Linear Visual Novel - no choices and storyline has one path
-Very short
-Replay value forces players to play the same story with only difference between having voiceovers on and off

author: {'steamid': '76561198097348943', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1448911554}
review:
Prepare and enjoy the feels~ A good story with a good background. 

I like it when the characters doesn't do anything outside human normal responses to situation, like desperately finding a cure which will alter the story entirely. The characters still have objective, despite the atmosphere was rather gloomy and give the no hope vibe, the characters are seeking something which is just to let it go (to be realistic to wait for their end ) but doesn't want it to end like that so they wanna end it while living the last of their life in the fullest. As the story lacked direction to begin, little and little things add up, then gives off "I CAN SEE THE ENDING" full with hopes and feels which was awesome.

Definitely worth to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004842640', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1447010710}
review:
Excelente tÃ­tulo, mas nÃ£o Ã© algo que eu indicaria para todo mundo. Visual Novel, como gÃªnero, jÃ¡ Ã© um gosto adquirido - e esta, em especial, mais do que qualquer outra. 

NÃ£o espere aqui aÃ§Ã£o desenfreada e adrenalina. O que hÃ¡ aqui Ã© uma trama introspectiva e triste, que a meu ver deve ser degustada aos poucos, para preservar o impacto emocional das duas tramas e de cada capÃ­tulo. Demorei quase um ano para terminar as duas histÃ³rias e digo que foi a melhor coisa que fiz. Se tivesse maratonado, duvido que a histÃ³ria teria me tocado como me tocou. 

Basicamente o jogo trata da morte. NÃ£o a morte como o destino inevitÃ¡vel de todo mundo, um acontecimento Ã³bvio porÃ©m nebuloso, perdido no horizonte do tempo - mas a morte como uma realidade prÃ³xima e palpÃ¡vel, o caso dos doentes terminais. PorÃ©m, ao falar da morte, fala-se tambÃ©m da vida. A vida dos que vÃ£o e dos que ficam. E isso Ã© feito com muita delicadeza, e sem se esquivar de temas espinhosos como religiÃ£o e suicÃ­dio. 

Gostei bastante da versÃ£o dublada, sÃ³ Ã© uma pena que o protagonista do primeiro jogo nÃ£o tenha sido dublado. A trilha Ã© adequada e o tema do segundo jogo, em especial, Ã© delicado e tocante. A arte Ã© bastante econÃ´mica, focando mais em paisagens que nos personagens, mas atende razoavelmente ao que se dispÃµe a fazer. 

Enfim, um excelente sopro de criatividade em meio ao mar de mesmice que Visual Novels tendem a ser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282696', 'num_games_owned': 1265, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1446988385}
review:
Who needs voice acting if you dont have graphics of the characters when they speak? :/
It is soo damn weirid! I need to at least see how things looks like. Therefore art seems to be soo... Minimal! Even for a free game it's not cool. I am Visual person and as for the Visual Novel maintain appearance of the characters is crucial. Soory for fans I just cant play this.

Even when all other things seems to be at least good. Visual aspects are poor, incredibly poor.

review: I wouldn't exacly call this a game but its great none the less, this 'game' is purely reading text of a story, click by click. Both these stories take a great deal of time to read fully, and for me personally i just dont have the time nor the patience but for those people who do get stuck into the story-line can finish it easily. For as far as i read, these stories will hit you in the feels but its great. Enjoyable background music that creates atmosphere and pretty scene artwork, For the achievevement hunters, these ones are easy to obtain and in a short period of time, read the guides. Its worth giving it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093955394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1445796489}
review:
[b]TL;DR[/b] This is an amazing game overall and it's great in most aspects. (Art is debatable)

Where to start....
I had played the first game a while ago, back when steam wasn't famous and the visual novel genre wasn't really famous, it was my second Visual Novel ever, Tsukihime being the first.
I replayed Tsukihime not so long ago and with a greater capability for analysis I found it even more enjoyable and noticed some stuff I didn't notice the first time. Not so long ago I told myself "Hey, why not? Narcissu is now available on steam, let's replay it."

Just as with Tsukihime, I enjoyed it even more this time, and it was way more painful. They present a sad reality and execute it really well, the inner conflicts of someone who knows they will die soon without a specified date. The OST just fits perfectly for each scene and makes you feel even closer to the character during their conversations, even cheerful conversations can feel painful at times because of the tone the characters speak with(The VAs do a pretty great job with this, I was amazed). You notice the pain they are carrying inside and you feel for them.

And then comes side 2nd, which expands into this topic by presenting you another part of the conflict: Those who are left behind. The trouble close relatives go through when someone they hold dear  is close to dying, and how they try their hardest to support them despite their pain. And not  only that, but they develop further the main character from the first game and it makes you realize how she turned out that way. Every little detail mattered in the development of her character. 

In the end, just like first, you go through a feelings roller coaster, the conversations tug heavily at your heart and the more you advance the more you know about the 7th floor and its patients. Each of the characters feel real and each of their interactions contribute to character development for every of them (This applies for both games). 

It's truly an amazing piece of work. Soundtrack, writing, conversations, voice acting, characters. Sure, the art may not be the most appealing, but the feel you get from it is just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046521780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1460169401}
review: Though we'll never truly be able to understand those who are doomed to die and know so, we can try to empathize with them at the very least.  When your innocence is shattered by the very words of "You have cancer," what would you feel? Pain? Sadness? Anger? Rejection? Fear? All 5? Or simply nothing? The couple in this story represent the human last attempt at being free before death.  Do we choose to die free or die in the same old boring place that we so despise?  These questions are what made me love the story, and the facts that it reminded me of Thelma & Louise and Interstellar and that Hans Zimmer composed the music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109152724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1444460380}
review:
Even if you are not into visual novels at all, you should give it a try. Not only because it is for free, but because it has a great story as well as  beautiful fitting music and just let you think about life and its meaning. It`s a nice small story worth spending the time for.



Selbst wenn man nicht wirklich auf Visual Novels steht, sollte man es ruhig mal ausprobieren. Nicht nur weil es komplett kostenlos ist, sondern auch weil es eine sehr schÃ¶ne Handlung mit passender Musik hat und einen selbst evtl. Ã¼ber das eigene Leben und wie man seine Zeit verbringt nachdenken lÃ¤sst. Es ist eine nette kleine Geschichte welche es Wert ist seine Zeit fÃ¼r zu geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005079922', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1400051745}
review:
(Updated review at 28 years of age)

There's something about "waiting to die" in Narcissu that I deeply resonated with, even as a 18 year old when I first played this 10 years ago.

For aren't we all terminal?

Aren't we all in a waiting room?

(Original review, written at 18 years of age, reposted to steam)

Short and sweet, NarcissuÂ is a sad, haunting tale accompanied by gorgeous music and beautiful artwork, and itâ€™s a good example of the literary form of visual novels. It requires a little patience from the reader, but itâ€™ll make you think, and unless youâ€™re carved out of stone, itâ€™ll make you feel, too. You may feel sad, you may feel confused, you may even feel outraged, but your emotions will be stirred, and that was the authorâ€™s sole intention. Itâ€™s a road trip worth taking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026598110', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1441796571}
review:
(don't mind my time counter for this game. I played this long before it came out on steam)
A very sad story set in the 7th floor of an hospital. This floor is where terminal ill patients are sent for them to stay for their last moments and our main characters are the inhabitants of this floor. 
From this you can already imagine that this is not going to be an happy story (despite the 22 yo lolita)
You will cry. And a lot. The entire visual novel is a story about life and death, which puts in contrast the behaviour of Setsumi, whose hope is long gone, and Yuu, who just arrived and has yet to understand Setrumi true feelings.
This game comes with the second game of the series, that is a prequel, which explains some plot holes about the first one.
While the first part earns points for the originality of the story, the second one looks a bit like a repetition of the previous one so not everyone may like it: we again have a terminally ill protagonist, older than our previous character, who is going through the same that Setsumi  will have to face in the future. The second one is "lighter" than the previous one, and sometimes a bit easy to predict
 BUT
What you should notice is the completely different kind of ending (which I won't spoil) that they have, making the first one even more sad when compared. 
TL;DR
It's free, it's 2 in 1, it's beautifully sad. Read it
P.S. Since a lot of people don't seem to know... This is a KINETIC NOVEL, which means that there won't be any choices.
Yes, there are visual novel that are read-only. No, they don't suck for that (Higurashi and Umineko)
So quit giving bad votes for the lack of choices, that's not how you judge a visual novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116428872', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1440773974}
review:
This's my first time trying a visual novel. It happens to be Narcissu as my first choice because it's free and among the free VNs, this VN's title interest me the most.

After I try it, I realize that I just choose such a good VN. Instead of cheesy anime girl story with "plot" just like almost every manga-anime this day, Narcissu offers a deep and touching story. The author lays out the one's life, who wants to live life to the fullest for one last time before facing their own death, beautifully in a simple VN. The story was able to make me shed tears. Still, could be heartwarming as well. Beautiful soundtrack, good dubbing and banner sized picture also strengthen the feel of the story.

For my first try, I must say that I'm impressed.

review:

review: Beautiful visual novel i would pay for this game! Haunting sad story of living with the pending doom of death knowing your going to get sicker and sicker and eventually die. I love this story's way it questions you whats kindness? would you want to die on your own terms or surrounded by the family that you have burden and destroyed their usual lives by your terminal illness? A visual novel you must read and its free !

author: {'steamid': '76561198045200324', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1439895331}
review:
[h1]"SÃ³ vou explicar uma vez, entÃ£o preste atenÃ§Ã£o..."[/h1]

[i]Narcissu 1st[/i] foi a primeira "Visual Novel" que li, a alguns meses atrÃ¡s jÃ¡ tinha lido mas nÃ£o cheguei a terminar  segundo jogo na mesma Ã©poca entÃ£o a algumas semanas atrÃ¡s baixei novamente mas dessa vez joguei novamente [i]Narcissu 1st[/i] em PT-BR e terminei [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i]. E caramba, escolha incrÃ­vel para eu poder dizer: "essa foi a primeira Visual Novel que li".

[i]Obs: Se quiser ler o resumo da anÃ¡lise pule direto para "ConsideraÃ§Ãµes Finais".[/i]

[b]â—„ EstÃ³ria / Objetivo â–º[/b]
[quote=]... Naquele dia ofuscante...
... Naquele mesmo dia de inverno...

Esta Ã© uma histÃ³ria de doenÃ§a e sofrimento; de medicaÃ§Ã£o e os efeitos adversos; cicatrizes de toracotomia e venenos celulares; da vida que nÃ£o pode ser ajudada mas morre e da morte que nÃ£o pode ser ajudada mas vive; de um local de descanso diferente que o "7Âº andar" ou "em casa".

Esta Ã© uma histÃ³ria de tantas coisas.

Mas na maioria...

Esta Ã© a histÃ³ria
de uma menina cujo coraÃ§Ã£o estava parado
e um menino cujo fÃ´lego estava sendo roubado,
ambos os quais irÃ£o morrer.[/quote]
JÃ¡ na descriÃ§Ã£o, jÃ¡ deixa explÃ­cito que a estÃ³ria apela muito para o lado emocional. Na verdade seriam dois jogos, falarei um pouco sobre ambos.

Em [i]Narcissu 1st[/i], Ã© contada a histÃ³ria de Setsumi e do protagonista, diferente de muitos jogos do gÃªnero por aÃ­, Narcissu nÃ£o Ã© uma histÃ³ria de amor, Ã© apenas a histÃ³ria de dois pacientes, residentes do sÃ©timo andar, lugar onde os pacientes com doenÃ§as terminais ficam.

Em [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i], abrange acontecimentos antes de [i]Narcissu 1st[/i], novamente apelando para o emocional mas dessa vez contando a histÃ³ria de Setsumi e outra personagem. [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] conta com alguns personagens extras, estÃ³ria igualmente tocante porÃ©m possui capÃ­tulos muito massantes e desnecessÃ¡rios, teve momentos que nÃ£o via a hora de terminar.

O autor recomenda seguir a seguinte ordem: [i]Narcissu 2nd, Narcissu 1st e o EpÃ­logo[/i]. PorÃ©m eu nÃ£o recomendo seguir essa ordem justamente por [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] ser massante, pode fazer vocÃª desistir antes de chegar no prÃ³ximo entÃ£o recomendo ler na seguinte ordem: [i]Narcissu 1st, Narcissu 2nd e EpÃ­logo[/i]. Recomendo muito jogar as versÃµes com voz.

No total vocÃª vai levar em torno de 6 a 7 horas para completar todas as histÃ³ias e pegar todas as cinco conquistas.

[b]â—„ Jogabilidade / Controles â–º[/b]
Como de costume, jogabilidade e controles de "visual novels" sÃ£o descomplicados. Teclas de "EspaÃ§o", "Enter" e botÃ£o esquerdo do mouse avanÃ§am os diÃ¡logos. 

Tecla "Ctrl" avanÃ§a o texto em alta velocidade, recomendado o uso apenas para pegar as conquistas que envolvem completar o jogo "sem vozes" depois de completar o jogo normalmente "com vozes".

[b]â—„ GrÃ¡ficos / Visuais â–º[/b]
Diferente de outras "visual novels", Narcissu nÃ£o possui diferenciaÃ§Ã£o entre sprites (personagens) e backgrounds (planos de fundo), ambos sÃ£o desenhados estÃ¡ticos na cena, quem jogou "visual novels" mais recentes talvez estranhe isso.

[b]â—„ Efeitos Sonoros / Trilha Sonora â–º[/b]
A trilha sonora Ã© simplesmente sensacional! Se a estÃ³ria dos jogos sÃ£o tocantes, a trilha sonora ajuda e muito para levar o jogo a outro nÃ­vel.
Uma pequena amostra:
https://youtu.be/qO0tEH-FZLg
Outra coisa que tenho que dar um Ãªnfase, as atuaÃ§Ãµes de voz! Cara! DifÃ­cil explicar em palavras o que o cara sente quando as personagens falam, meio que da para sentir o sofrimento que a personagem estÃ¡ passando. Realmente, difÃ­cil descrever em palavras, entÃ£o recomendo muito que jogue as versÃµes com vozes.

[b]â—„ Multijogador Local / Multijogador Online â–º[/b]
O jogo nÃ£o possui nenhum tipo de multijogador, seja local ou online.

[b]â—„ DLCs / ExpansÃµes â–º[/b]
Ambos os jogos sÃ³ possuem um DLC que seria a trilha sonora de ambos os jogos, nÃ£o comprei mas uma hora dessas pretendo sim comprar e ajudar o autor.

[h1]ConsideraÃ§Ãµes Finais[/h1]
PrÃ³s:
+ EstÃ³ria emocionante;
+ Duas estÃ³rias para leitura com um total de mais ou menos 7 horas;
+ Visuais diferenciados de outros "visual novels";
+ Trilha sonora simplesmente sensacional;
+ AtuaÃ§Ã£o de voz incrÃ­vel;
+ Gratuito;
+ Apenas 300 MB;

Contras:
- Alguns capÃ­tulos de [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] sÃ£o um pouco massantes;

[b]Nota Final: 8.75/10[/b]

Na moral, para quem gosta de "visual novel", recomendo muito Narcissu. E novamente digo, Ã© incrÃ­vel eu poder dizer que foi a primeira visual novel que eu li. E para nossa alegria foi confirmado o remake de [i]Narcissu 1st, Narcissu 2nd e NARCISSU 3rd[/i] e espero que venha para a Steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198192380330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1439892371}
review:
I finished the first story in voice-mode.
The reason I do not recomend this is due to personal reasonsâ€“ I don't enjoy super depressing, sad and slow story-lines with a plot were you know everyone awaits death.

On the plus side: 
The art is pretty nice, even though I don't like the 'moe' -styled characters.
The music is calm and sentimental.
It has immersive stories that might bring you frickle little people into tears. I'm not excluded.

Downside as I said:
It's truly depressing, about ill people just waiting to die.
Moe characters x sad story? Personally? No thank you most of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080755773', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1438835422}
review: This game is sad, very sad, there are quite a few moments that hit you right in the feels, and the story is very well thought out. Side 1: You play as a young male (I'm not sure of his name) who has just been assigned to Floor 7 of the hospital, where he meets a young woman named Setsumi who tells him the rules of 7F. One of them being "You have two choices on where you die: At home, or on 7F." Side 2 is a backstory to Setsumi from before she was assinged to 7F and is where the majority of the feels were located (for me anyway).  Overall, 10/10 Would definitly read again.

review: ok.............so.........yeah. this was one of the best VNs ive read. the character art (how little there is) was sub-par at best(keep in mind ive only read the first for now). but the comunication of emotions was fenominal. the great score mixed with the exelent writing really made you feel more a part of it than just a reader.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025028109', 'num_games_owned': 2088, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1438558774}
review:
Narcissu 1:

I thought I was prepared to read this, but nothing can prepare you for this.

The story is about two sick patients in a hospital who have embraced their inevitable deaths. One day they both have a chance to escape the monotony of the life that they had forced apon them when they were young. Where will they go with no destination? What will they do knowing nothing but the life of a patient in a hospital ward?

There is no greater plot, there is no romance, and the relationship between the two main characters could hardly even be described as friendly, but the coldness of the cast and simple story both play very important roles in tying the incredible atmosphere of the VN together.

The game actually comes with two translations one of which focused on retaining the original script's phrasing (resulting in some rather poor grammar at times) while the second translation focused more on  shapng the script into something closer to what a native english speaker would have written. Both read surprisingly different, and neither is the wrong choice.

9/10 would piece together my heart again

author: {'steamid': '76561198041940756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1437595837}
review:
A beautiful and sorrowful story of disease and learning to embrace your inevitable death. Very unlike other stories in general which are usually about trying to escape death or living out life despite the main character's illness. Also unlike other stories, this is [b]NOT[/b] romantic and instead the chemistry between the two main characters is very cold and somewhat uninterested, at least on Setsumi's part. Another thing to remember is that this is [b]NOT[/b] a visual novel, it is a kinetic novel. There are no choices and you just read on. 
9/10 only real problem was that the music abrubtly stops at scene transitions instead of fading out. The music is really good though and contributes immensely to the overall feeling of the story.
Remember to play side 2nd first as it provides the backstory for the 1st story.

TL;DR : Depression/10 It made me cry, and It'll make you cry to. It's free, so why not try it out? also has really gud music

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1474663829}
review:
Free to play japanese Visual Novels.  Two very sad and long stories.   Spacebar to move through it.  No decisions.  Subject matter might not be good for little kids.
 Has nice background music, sound effects and voiceovers, has nice artwork, has steam achievements for reaching the end of stories.  On the second runthrough, you can start a new story, of the other version and pick the last chapter to get the other achievement. 

The Extras is the Sound mode, pick through the soundtrack.

If you like novels, give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101566933', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1447935722}
{'steamid': '76561198117625637', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1437780076}
review:
Im going to try to be short and sweet with this one

first of all this is not your typical visual novel, you barely if ever see anyone and the images are very small stills unlike most you'll find in other similar games like katawa shoujo. unlike katawa shoujo there is no choices you only read, this is not a bad thing but if you expect to see multipule endings this will not be the one. The story is incredibly depressing there are very few feelgood moments and the dialouge is stiff and blunt most of the time. The writing makes it hard to follow sometimes as without any names above the words you may not know whos saying what until you piece it together. this had a hard time getting me involved with the characters as the main character you never even find out his name or what he's sick from. nothing from what he likes to what his life before he got sick is revieled leaving you fairly in the dark about anything other than what happens after getting sick. The story is rewarding to finish however it is far from something id run to my friends to tell them about. the music is good and fitting most tmes however none of it is memorible either. overall I give this a thumbs up to play but only for those really really wanting to play another VN after exausting all other options. if you have not played a VN before look elsewhere there are better done ones elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142584872', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1447721261}
review:
top be honest, I was making jokes about the game to my friends at first.
Then I fell in love. It's not like the kind of thing you'd find on steam, but it has a beautiful story, the game is a story. I was expecting more like an interactive game when I downloaded it, but then I realized that's not the point. The music is great, it totally helps set the tone for the game, but it's so sad, but yet so good.
10/10 Download this shit. 
[b]Plus it's free.[/b]

review: This game reaches a level of sadness and tragedy that possibly surpasses To The Moon's. Narcissu deals with terminal illnesses and how we cope with them as the ones leaving or left behind. Make sure you know your own mental state before engaging with this story.

review: this is one of the few visual novels to leave such a deep impression on me. if you enjoy getting your feels gland violently tickled than i recommend this for you. the soundtrack is astounding, the plot delevlopmet is out of this world and over all this will leave you with something in your heart that you didnt know you could have. one of my personal favorite VN's of all time would recommend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096067158', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1434290092}
review:
Beautiful slow paced linear storyline VN. Handles some very deep issues and questions that most of us will experience in life- a bit of a heart breaker. Definitely not too short- a good few hours worth of content in here.

For a free to play game- this is something for everyone who enjoys VNs, and now that the achievements are fixed (Finally!!!) it's something great for us achievement hunters too :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198070299699', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1438234539}
review:
10/10 Would cry myself to sleep like a bitch again.
In all seriousness, though, I really did like this VN. Would I read it again? No. I wouldn't be able to take the sadness again, and it's one of those stories that is only really enjoyable once (imo). I wouldn't recommend it for people who are depressed, as it deals with extremely depressing and emotionally destroying subjects. So if you feel like you can handle some sadness and have a few hours of spare time on your hands, read it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066188729', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1436009932}
review:
Amazing. Let's just cut to the chase here... These VNs are ROUGH. Very well done, beautiful, engaging, and tasteful, but it's a tough one. After unlocking the dev's Notes, you know these weren't meant to be "tear-jerkers," but I just about had a fit after 1st.

If you have ever wondered about the world of chronic/terminal illness and the associated psychological warfare that accompany the regular symptoms, this is almost a case study. This game masterfully illustrates the inner workings of the minds of those essentially given a diagnosis of "IDK, good luck to you." It's about grief, guilt, and grace.

I appreciate the focus on the deeper questions people given a finite timeline to work with have to answer. Sometimes it's not just about depression or self-blame. Rather, it can be about feeling objectified and out of control, coupled with a deeply profound view on the long-term effects interactions will have on anyone involved in the health/well-being process. 

Focusing on how people in these positions can and will think about how to execute the "end-game" was extremely welcoming and refreshing to see explored, When the body fails and is beyond personal control, most people don't know the internal struggle that ensues in trying to be resolve the situation and re-align the bodyand mind in the most peaceful way possible.

I unintentionally played the game 1st and 2nd, without knowing the developer wanted it to be played in reverse. However, I enjoyed the juxtaposition of the stories, and the conclusions that can be drawn by revisiting the first part after completing the second are very eye-opeing. I was happy that the subject of religion and morality was brought up in the 2nd, because it is a deep and frustrating struggle that people really wrestle with in the medical world (and will continue to do so).

Overall, highly recommended, especially if you or someone you know is going through a similar fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199505427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1476067747}
review:
Narcissu 1st & 2nd is not just simply a good visual novel, but rather an unique lesson and even a simulation of life and death. Imagine lying on a hospital bed, with your friends and family slowly but surely moving further and further away from you until the day you become truly alone. What will you do then? What will you make of a life when you cannot help but to die, and even while dying you cannot help but to live? Narcissu answers those questions while teaching you about the meaning and value of life and death itself, 

"This is the story
of a girl whose heart was standing still
and a boy whose breath was being stolen away,
both of whom die."

Just because it is certain that you will die, it does not mean it is certain that you cannot live. Being able to break the so-called fate of having your resting place be on 7F or at home and being able to be truly alive even as your life is slowly being taken away.

Taking all of the clichÃ©d expectations I had of this marvelous experience and going into the story with a naive mindset, I was blown away by the amount of feeling and depth that went into this wonderful creation. It really struck to me that even in a situation where one could only await death, these characters were still able to continue being able to smile. 

I will not go deeper into this review for the sake of having to spoil more of this bittersweet and overwhelmingly blissful experience.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198116754087', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1475268314}
review:
Excellent story with decent soundtracks.

SPOILER ALERT

[spoiler]This game is a must play for visual novel gamers because of its deep plot about a girl suffering from cancer. Our story starts with a protagonist, a young man who is admitted to a hospital with lung carcinoma. He eventually meets another girl who has the same diagnosis as him. She indicates that they are slowly dying and the cancer may returns after therapy. She is in her final stage of cancer as she may pass away at any moment. As the cancer progresses, they will eventually die at the seventh floor of the hosptial at the palliative unit, or at home with family. The girl calmly expresses that she doesn't want to die at the hospital nor home. She wants to escape and asks the protagonist to come along her. That's her final wish... to die alone without her family and friends... because they are the ones that suffer more.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198069844628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1435250533}
review:
A great and emotional free to play game. 

The game's art style, characters and soundtrack is really good 
The story can make your heart all tingly with the help of some really good voice acting and instrumental music playing in the background to set the mood right.

On the downside however, I kinda wished there were more images of the characters and some choice sequence so players can have a little bit of interaction in the game. 

But all in all, if you're looking to kill time and just relax or read something that can make your heart feel really heavy, then you should definitely try this out.


2nd was even better. I swear my eyes got watery quite a few times. Definitely not forgetting this game anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075597069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1434921005}
review:
If you knew you were going to die, would you cry? or would you curse your fate?

Narcissu is the story of two terminally ill patients of the 7th floor, that decide to leave the hospital for a trip.
We follow their journey through Narcissu and in Narcissu 2nd, a prequel to the first, we witness a similar story.

This VN is short, in around 5 to 6 hours, I finished both games and the epilogue and acquired all the achievements. 

The story is very beautifull, but somber, which is expected when the main protagonists are barely hanging on to life.

The style is very minimalistic, most of the art is scenery. A lot of people complained that the art style was not to their liking, but I think it's very pretty, serene and delicate. It's definitely better in Narcissu 2nd.

The music is wonderful and calming, I love it and bought it instantly. If you like relaxing piano tracks, it's worth the listen. You can access it in the extra menu of the game.

I recommend playing this VN, it's free and it is short enough to occupy you on a rainy afternoon. Though the themes explored in the story are daunting and heatbreaking, it still touches upon something we can all retale to, death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134965145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1434707243}

review:
Very emotional story, if the player can enter the spirit of it:

The apathy of the "doomed"... the running away from no where, to no where. 
The proof that text based games don't require "waifu" or any of the sorts to be awsome! Great game(s)! 10/10

However if you are not a fan of the story telling kind of games, and willing to compromise, you will find the start extremely boring!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085602184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1440880453}
review:
When I first tried this Visual novel, I had no expectation, because it was "just a free game, it wouldn't be free if it was that good". 
And I was wrong, this kinetic novel (you don't make any choices) is really great.

It's really poetic, and sad,the music is awesome.... 

I've only finished the first one (the 2 chapters are independant) but i'll start the second soon, when I'll have a whole night to spend. 

Yup, I'd pay money for that; it was a good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020655314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1434169686}
review: Trucks of feels. Onions being chopped in the room. Somehow rain was summoned. 10/10 would cry again

author: {'steamid': '76561198065717178', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1464285511}
review: So I've played through the 1st game and probably halfway through the 2nd. So I felt like I should state my opinion. First I love the game (err visual novel) some dont like to just read but I do so this linear style suites me. Second the atmosphere of hoplessness you can really see and when people say a lot of it is pretty bland in hontsty they were pribably going for that. The whole process of sitting infront of a boring TV waiting for enevitable death fits that. Third to me its one of those games that for me didnt have a lot of emotion every time but when it was needed it really hit me like a train now I wasent curling up in a ball crying like when watching clannad but it really had very strong emotion behind it  if you are a very imaginatinve reader and the texts becomes almost like a movie in your head. All and all I rate it a strong 8.5/10 for the first game, the second game as of now is a vast improvement of visuals and even including a sort of music video makes the overal package 9.5/10 (I wont give a full rating for the 2nd game since I havent completed it fully)

author: {'steamid': '76561198130084012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1439482371}
review:
Pure Visual Novel Game no choices & puzzles etc. It just like im watching drama than playing game
Well i don't know how to say it but yeah ow yeah well... WOW NICE BLABLABLA (that is my experssion)
I don't realize that i dont even blink my eye until my mother snap me out.
Just Worth It & made me crying (damn my tears gone out on there own)
Well for me Narcissu 1st was 2 hours read(119 minutes) & 2nd still on process

For the story:
It's about meaning full life even you know that for time is almost run out
there still hope for survive even in desperated condition.
In the end "Setsumi" got her meanigfully live even she commit suicide (my heart tremble unstable at the climax and after climax/ending and i cry)

For the Quality of game :
Sad story and Courage to survive "Great"
Artwork and scenes "Great"
Soundtrack "Perfect"(well bit looping for it but i like it)
Overall 9,0/10

It's very worth it really i guarranted if you are VN lover

NB: Mabye before you playing the game/start the story recommended to check the notes first

author: {'steamid': '76561197998273415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1431502347}
review:
[b]âŠ•[/b]Different subtitle sets are available. The environment is very pretty. For taking place mostly inside a car, Narcissu 1 is engaging. Peaceful soundtrack. Surprisingly Fulfilling for a Free to play game! Several key/mouse options to click to progress, allowing you to alternate how you're positioned while reading.

[b]âŠ–[/b]The sequel was pretty weak and droned on aimlessly. All of the game's visuals are trapped in an uncomfortable little letterbox. This is a unique stylization, but a little annoying. There are no character sprites, you see the female lead perhaps 4 times total in the first game. At times, it is nauseatingly melancholy. Voice option is bad.

[b]âœ[/b]Itâ€™s free, so why not? it's a nice little ride. If you're looking for a peaceful, satisfying read with a nice conclusion then this is a great F2P story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113300023', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1434436989}
review:
There is no fourth time, the third time you are admitted is the last, so prepare yourself.
Narcissu 1st and 2nd is a kinetic novel (Without choices) that portrays the lives of young adults living in the 7th floor of the hospital, the floor in which its residents awaits their deaths. Narcissu 1st and 2nd is a very well made visual novel with highly emotional and wonderfully written storyline, together with the marvelous soundtracks. It puts you in the perspective of people who have a limited amount of time left, people whose future had been denied, people who have nothing left in life, people who live their lives everyday thinking about the day when they will pass on. This Visual Novel is able to invoke a series of emotions and feelings that will linger around even after you completed the story. It is also free of charge, I highly recommend Narcissu if you are a fan of tragic stories or Visual Novels. Definitely one of the better made visual novel there is on Steam. 
Right now, do you want me to pull you back, or instead, do you want me to give your back a push?
10/10 will climb Mt Fuji to complain to god again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166409255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1488784662}
review: This VN was simply amazing. Loved the music, the story, the characters. Everything. Very sad but you will never regret playing this wonderful game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069059526', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1433534905}
review:
22 minutes in the game and listening to the soundtrack just makes me cry. It's beautiful Q.Q

And finally, after 1.8 hours, I finished the Narcissu 1.

I have to say, I really like this VN and how the development of the characters.

It has a good plot and character development, but Setsumi's is the most apparent. Sense of mystery is nice and the fact that their time is really limited to an unknown amount puts more feeling to every moment.

The soundtrack is absolutely beautiful which adds to the sad (yeah, I have no other synonyms for sad) atmosphere of the story.

10/10 would cry again.

Except I didn't shed a tear (almost tho). I have no soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1189, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1433382038}
review:
Well written but I could only make it about 1.2 hours, or up to chapter 5. It was just putting me to sleep. I enjoy reading books, but this story was just excruciatingly boring and uneccesarily detailed. We don't need to have details of them getting gas and eating rice balls. I've read in the forums what happens in the end and I just did not feel like if I had kept reading that the outcomes of the story would have been worth my time. Not sad or depressing, just rather dull and sleep inducing. It is also not exactly a visual novel. Just widescreen still images that are well drawn but also boring to look at and add nothing to the story.

However it did get me curious to know if there are actually any good visual novels out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085709842', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1433190860}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050922291', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1433281843}
review:
Absolutely brilliant. Two heart touching stories very well attached with an amazing narrative, simply but effective artwork and a nice soundtrack. Dubbing is sensational, even in japanese or whatever, it makes you to know how they felt in every conversation.

Worth reading. The first one is a main story about Setsumi and the second one is the prequel of the first one but with another character, Himeko... longer and with many more details that explain to the reader why Setsumi behaves in that way.

No choices, even a game, nor the typical an audiovisual novel, is just like a book so there is nothing to do except read, listen and feel.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1433089147}
review:
First thing you need to know is.. 

This is NOT a game.  There are visual novel that have game choices and etc and that would be a choice and decision game...

This is not NOT a game. It doesn't have choices and the only thing you need to do is once a chapter end click the next chapter and you can press space to speed things up.

That being said.. 
This is FREE. 
This is a beautiful book with a wonderfully touching story.
This "Game" have achievements.

Despite being a girlish book it have some nice plots and fun to read. 
I enjoyed both 1 & 2.

IF you bored from gaming want sometime off reading book go for this one.. Again it's free.

IF you just want boost your achievement ratio. 
Turn this game on. Change speed to auto-read to high. 
Start this game "unvoiced" then press "A" to start auto-read. 
Watch some TV with this game on. Click A every once a while at stuck point or mouse click to chapter change.
Once your unvoiced achievement Pops just go to the menu and this time select "Voiced" then click last chapter.
Keep mouse clicking or space clicking until achievement.
Move to second book. Do the same thing.
Move to Extra ending. Do the same thing.
You just got another 100% game...

For review wise.. 
1/10 as A game.. 7/10 as a Book.
