author: {'steamid': '76561198129427514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1427332705}
review:
Narcissu (& Narcissu Side 2nd) is a beautiful, but sad visual novel game. The plot of both revolve around characters that have been admitted to a hospital level called the "7th Floor." This hospital floor is not your typical floor in a hospital (if that makes any sense). It's a "hospice," a place where people who suffer from incurable diseases and will eventually die go to live out the rest of their days. Each story is different from the other, and play out different from each other. However, they are both connected and intertwine with one another. 

Narcissu Side 2nd is the prequel to Narcissu. Narcissu Side 2nd tells the story of the relationship between two girls and basically how they spend the summer together. However, they both suffer from the same or similar disease that has no cure and will eventually kill them. This story is about Setsumi (who is a main character in the original Narcissu) and Himeko (Setsumi's new, cheery "deathrow" friend). The story is told primarily from the perspective of Setsumi, but at times switches to Himeko as she explains events in her past. At different points in the story, we learn alittle about the two. We learn about Setsumi's family, Himeko's family, Himeko's past, etc. There's alot more I could mention, but I don't want to give away too much. Just know that, like the original, this is a beautiful, sad, and whimsical quote-on-quote "game." This story also has the same beautiful and heart-felt music from Narcissu, as well as some new pieces which are just as good. Art style is also the same, although it seems there are more images in this version and they are of better quality. Dialogue is well written just like in the original. And as with Narcissu, I did almost cry towards the end of this story. More so on the verge of tears than Narcissu. The story, overall, I feel is BETTER than the original. There's a lot more depth and substance added to this story than the first Narcissu. However, this comes at the cost of greatly increasing the amount of chapters to read. While in the first Narcissu there were 7-8 chapters (including prologue), Narcissu Side 2nd has a whopping 20 chapters (including prologue)! So, a downside to this story is it's a lot longer than the original. Another potnetial downside to this story, which mostly pertains to how "sensitive" you are towards religion, is there's a fair amount of talk about God and Catholicism. I only bring this up because some people may hate the constant mention of God (i.e. if you are a nonworshiper of God or just hate talk of religion in general), and/or may hate how Catholics can be portrayed in this story (there are times in the story where a character tries to disown their Catholic past or ways; there are also times when characters describe Catholicism in a somewhat negative light). This aspect didn't bother me, but it is worth mentioning for others as a warning. Still, a great prequel to a great, original visual novel game.

Narcissu is the orginal story, or at least the one that was released first. This story follows the journey of two 7th Floor patients to a special destination. What is this "special place" and why are they going there? Well, you'll have to read the story to find out. The two patients are an unamed male patient and Setsumi. The story is told mostly from the perspective of the male patient, but a few times Setsumi narrates some of her life's story. This story is essentially that of a road trip story, but still good none the less. The music in this game is well-composed. Each track is beautiful and compelling. The art style is good. Slightly low budget looking, but still good to look at. The dialogue is well-written, and provokes many philosophical questions from the reader. While I said in my analysis of Narcissu Side 2nd it had less substance, the story of Narcissu is still a great story. I literally almost cried at the end. The characters were portrayed well and were very interesting. Overall, a good story and a good starting point for many other good stories within this universe to come.

All in all, this series is great. Two beautiful, yet sad stories in one beautiful, yet sad universe. The only problems I have with both of the stories is there is some heavy repetition (which can be annoying at times) and reading both stories back-to-back makes for one long reading experience (at least for me it did). I'm very inexperienced when it comes to visual novel games, and didn't expect to spend around 15 hours just reading both of these stories! I thought this series of stories would've been significantly shorter, but boy was I wrong!lol Still, I reccomend you "trudge" through those long hours to uncover a beautiful, intertwining story. As far as which one you should play first depends on your personal preference. The author of both stories reccomends you read the prequel then the original. However, I reccomend you read the original then the prequel. In my opinion, reading the prequel after the first game is a better way to experience the story. The prequel, essentially, fills in all the holes and makes many references to the first game. Seeing how the author wove all these intricate details from the first game into the story and showing how they made their appearance in the original Narcissu is very interesting. This particular analysis can only be done by reading the original first. Not only that, but I feel coming from the prequel to the original may dissapoint a few people. Like I said, Narcissu lacks substance in comparison to Narcissu Side 2nd. So, people may be let down when the original has a lot less story depth than the prequel. It may just feel kinda empty to them. Narcissu was, essentially, the foundation of the Narcissu "universe." So, it's understandable why that story felt alittle more bare bones. The prequel simply took all the good things from Narcissu and built upon them, making the story all the more better. But, still, the ultimate decision of in what order you read is left up to you. Me, I probably WOULD have read the prequel first then the original if I had known Side 2nd was a prequel. But I'm still ok with the order in which I read both. Anyhow, this is a visual novel game that I HIGHLY recommend. A lot of thought, love, and care was put into both of these games and it shows. And the best part of this game/games is...they're free! So, definitely check them out. You'll more than likely love them.:)

P.S. Also, as of March 26, 2015 the acheivements STILL do not work.:/

review: Think of it as A decent book with music and a few background pictures for the setting. It's more of an emotional type story, so if you're the type that cries over small tragedies - you'll be able to fill a bucket or two with tears from this one. It's a pretty good read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152037249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1425484451}
review: I can see why people think it's beautiful. I just can't feel it. Nothing fustrates me more than seeing people waiting to die, whether they are terminally ill or just plain mortal like the rest of us, taking death lying down is not a point of view I can empathise with, so I can't connect to any of the characters. Based on that and that unfortunately the concept isn't original enough to hold me to the end it might be subjective but I'm giving this a low score. 1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983194104', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1426200057}
review:
A story of those who have been denied a future, and what they do with the little time they have left.

First things first: Narcissu is [b]very[/b] minimal, even by visual novel standards. There are no carefully detailed character portraits or meticulously crafted scenes. There are no branching paths or any choosing of one's waifus. The minimal-ness is even outright stated by the creator (in the Notes) to be intentional, so as to encourage the reader to visualize for themselves the scenes as they play out. Don't go in expecting this to be something it isn't. 

The presentation seeks to evoke the atmosphere of a movie and does so effectively with its use of its (somewhat small) soundtrack, transitions, and screen layout. I recommend just turning on auto-play and watch (or, more accurately, read) the events of the story unfold, just as you would a movie.

It shouldn't need to be said that the main characters of these stories, Setsumi and Himeko for Narcissu 1st and 2nd respectfully, will die. There are no miracles or magic cures, no cheap ways out of their respective predicaments. It is with this in mind that the story really is at its most impactful; two people whose lives have been cut short, due to no fault of their own, and what they do with the precious few moments they have left. There is no angst here, no tantrums or curses or moping or complaining, as the two have long since come to terms with their soon-coming deaths. Instead the focus is on their actions and passing on what little they can to those they will soon be leaving behind. Narcissu 1st focuses more on the person who is dying, their experiences and choices as their death slowly approaches, while Narcissu 2nd focuses on the people around that person, those who will be invariably left behind. The two stories never felt like they were meant to be tear-jerky and never made any cheap stabs at my 'feels'-glands, all tears shed were well-earned by the writer (and translators!).

From a technical standpoint the game itself works fine, if at times a bit wonky. I had a problem where holding down 'ctrl' caused the game to skip forward to the end of a chapter and leave me stuck at the chapter select. Also, I remember seeing a couple of typos here and there.

If you made it this far and like what you've read I cannot recommend this game any more highly, I liked it enough to the point of writing this long-ass review as soon as I completed it. Also it's free, so you really have no excuse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062119704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1425518972}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072276164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2568, 'last_played': 1439047122}
review:
It's not much of a typical Visual Novel as it lacks interactivity, but it's a really well-scripted VN. 

Some people might get held back by the lack of interactivity of the VN (no branching choices or anything, just a linear story, and there's absolutely nothing to do but read) but if you can can past that then you'll like it.

The soundtrack is really beautiful, you can just listen to the soundtrack the game provides while you perform other actions (such as playing other games etc.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198122985262', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1425097470}
review: At first i was bored.  Then i was frustrated.  And eventually wound up having a hard time breathing and my heart hurting due to too much sad entering my soul.  Nice heavy VN.  Well worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104108015', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1528367669}
review:
Two beautiful, heartful stories, accompanied by lovely music. A masterpiece that will make even the toughest guy shed a tear, even if it's just one.

You can decide to start with either part 1 or part 2, since part 2 is the prequel to part 1. That way you might understand more about things happening in part 1. On the other hand, you could also start with part 1, then learn more about the characters background later in part 2. Both work pretty much equally well.

You can pick either voiced or unvoiced options, making the main characters talk, or not. I haven't played the unvoiced version yet, but I think it would be better when played voiced anyway. Too bad those achievements don't work...

EDIT: Now that the achievements do work, I skipped through the game to get them. Please, don't ever do that, just to get the achievements. It's sad enough as it is T nT

EDIT2: Now that the Anthology series is out, be sure to buy it! Written by the same people as these two parts, I'm sure you'll enjoy them just as much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142233628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1430201357}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014905381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1425907880}
review:
Okay, so, I've never played a Visual Novel before, and after playing this, I wish I still hadn't. Because, holy shit, this was depressing.

But, it's free, and I recommend it as something to experience once. Just once. Because you won't want to play it again.
Like watching Clannad: Afterstory, or Requiem for a Dream. Never again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996093948', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1578133049}
review:
If you were sick.
If you were all alone.
If you just accepted it.
If you got to know someone.

This is the story of a little girl with no parents, of a woman who pushed away her friends, of a girl that accepted her fate, and a boy who stood behind, waiting. All of them residents of the 7th floor, the floor for one to await for their turn... to die.

First, its probably better to explain what is Narcissu 2nd, while it's the second game, in reality it functions as a prequel to the first story. While both stories have different points of views, the person connceting them, and the main pillar, is Setsumi, a 22 year old girl (15 on the prequel).

On Narcissu 1st, the story is about a boy (Yuu Atou, although his name is never revealed on both games) who meets Setsumi, a girl who doesn't wants to die neither at home or on the 7th floor.
Narcissu 2nd is about the encounter between Setsumi and Himeko, a woman on her twenties, cheerful and full of energy, who is currently residing on the 7th floor.

While the autor says that in his opinion the playing order should start with the 2nd, I started with the 1st (hadn't noticed that before completing the first game), and with that, I can say that playing the 1st first, and then the 2nd, gives the feeling of "so that's how it happened", and it helps to see better some connections between both games. If one decides to start with the 2nd, in my opinion I think it will give a better connection with Setsumi and probably more emotional impact (although it still gives you one whatever game you decide to start first).

It's surprising that a free visual novel is so well built, the first game isn't fully voiced (and on an important note, both games HAVE NO CHOICE, which isn't very frequent in visual novels), the second one is fully (or 99%) voiced, and has better art. As for the OST, i liked it, most of it had a sad tone and managed to help deliver the emotions needed. All of this in about 12 hours of content.

As for the story itself and the characters, it gave me the feels...
The importance of ones death, and life, and how it affects the other.
Of those who have been left behind, and kept going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091178410', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1422940856}
review:
I can't possibly recommend Narcissu enough.

The story is beautiful. Prepare yourself for a heavy emotional journey. There are no choices in this visual novel, just a powerful tale about life. Don't pass up the opportunity to experience this story.

The music is moving. The voicing, captivating. The images combined with the flowing story text carries the mood and tone, flowing from beginning to end. The telling of the story is a gorgeous experience... don't miss out on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018969815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1422922530}
review:
(Early Access Version Review)

This is a moving visual novel into which a lot of care was obviously put.  The translation is generally good, although some phrasing is awkward, and the story itself is beautiful and will give you a lot to think about -- the general message, I think, can be applicable/relatable even if you are not in exactly the same situation as the characters in the novel.

For a free work, I was also impressed with some of the extras: several different translations are available as well as the original Japanese text; there is a full set of notes from both the original creator and the translators; and the lovely music is on display in a special "sound mode," which allows you to listen to music from either Narcissu 1st or 2nd.

Given that all it will cost you is a bit of space on your hard drive and a couple of hours of free time, this is definitely a worthwhile addition to your library.

*To the devs: (this may have been a fluke, but...) the one technical issue I found was that the game gets stuck at the end of one of the notes (I believe it was the last translation note for N1st): instead of being able to simply click and return to the "Notes" menu, you have to hit the "back" button and then "return to title."  Obviously, not a major problem, but I figured that I'd mention it, since the game is still in early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001768996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1426974310}
review:
Premettendo che non sono un appassionato di Visual Novel, anzi spesso non riesco a terminarle per mancanza di interesse o entusiasmo. Mi sento invece quasi obbligato a dare un giudizio positivo a Narcissu, che fin da subito mi ha catturato con la sua semplicitÃ  (Si basa su qualche immagine a rotazione e poco piÃ¹, niente effetti speciali), una colonna sonora malinconica degna di nota (che comprende anche alcune tracce cantate), un doppiaggio valido e ultimo ma non meno importante uno script realizzato, a mio parere, molto bene. 

Non ho ancora terminato entrambi i capitoli, ma considerando il fatto che sono GRATIS, se siete estranei al mondo delle visual novel, oppure volete provarne una nuova per curiositÃ , mi sento di consigliarvela piÃ¹ che volentieri.

Penalizzante puÃ² essere il ritmo abbastanza lento dello svolgimento degli eventi, o l'andazzo un po' volutamente strappalacrime della vicenda, ma personalmente non ha disturbato cosÃ¬ tanto il risultato finale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096664097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1422178878}
review:
[h1]Review - Narcissu 1st & 2nd[/h1]

[i]"If this one doesn't give you feels, then you're not human anymore."[/i]

Narcissu 1st & 2nd is a short and very simple visual novel. No heavy graphics and sound effects. Just a simple movie-like screen, some texts and an amazing soundtrack. The Narcissu 1st & 2nd tells the story of a girl who gave up on life before hers could have ended. This is not a game but a story-teller. It has a great story plot and the emotions of the voiceovers are outstanding! If you're a first-timer when it comes to visual novels, Narcissu 1st & 2nd is a good start for you and don't worry much, this VN is free and worth all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132674938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1422002819}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977869538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1421734624}
review:
Let me start by saying, I enjoyed what I read in the first chapter. I could infer the malaise and hopeless situation that the main characters find themselves in. The chapter ended with a good sense of mystery about the girl Narcissu.

That said, this was my first visual novel. I don't mean to knock the genere, but I was expecting more 'visual'. 20minutes into the novel, and all I saw was rain, a hospital ward, and some tables. I would have liked to have seen more of the scenes that were described by the text; parents, the school mates, the drivers licence. Even when Narcissu is first mentioned, perhaps I could see the back of her head as she whatched the TV?

I realize things will probably pick up as I advance in chapters, but this left a dull taste in my mouth for the genere. I guess it's not for me.

Some features that I would have liked to have seen:
-A save option. So I can stop in the middle of a chapter.
-A recap dialogue. So I can return to a save or chapter, and catch up.
-Full Screen mode, for immersion.

In short, probably good if you like the genere. Personally, I'm turned off. I may try again with something more up-beat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071041632', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1429254519}
review: TEARS....... The first one is much better than the second one in my opinion. This VN is about setsumi and the main character after being admited into a hospice. Its a very sad story, But i enjoyed it for that. The story works well with building on the love for the characters and the story is very well written. The sound track is phenomenal in my opinion. Saddly the VN does not have a multi ending or choices, So its more like just a book with music, But its a damn good book with music if you wanna call it that. Now excuse me while i go cry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084101505', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1412943652}
review:
A sad story about the terminally ill who go in an adventure to spend the remaining times of their lives. It will make you cry for days just thinking about what happened. 

[b]Graphics: 7/10[/b]
Mediocre visuals for what it shows. Itâ€™s nothing too great, but nothing too bad either. Itâ€™s clean and refined; and I do have to say, the character design is top notch. But, this is pretty much all I expected from a free VN. 

[b]Storyline: 10/10[/b]
I donâ€™t know if I can talk about this without spoiling it too muchâ€¦its very touching to say the least. Youâ€™ll cry at the end of it, Iâ€™m that certain for sure. If you love romance, drama and jumping on the feels train, this is the one for you.

[b]Sound: 7/10[/b]
There is a whole lot of soundtracks to listen to. Most of which are heavily repeated in many of the scenes, but they are very good for what they are. The sad ones really do get you though, itâ€™s half the reason why youâ€™ll cry reading this. You can even buy the Original Soundtrack for Â£5.59 if you want to support the creators. 

[b]Gameplay: 7/10[/b]
Decent. I mean you have the basic menu options for line speed pacing, sound, BGM and the lot. There is really nothing new that a VN hasnâ€™t offered yet at this point. But I read the whole VN without any issues whatsoever, not even a single crash or translation mistake from what I can remember. The way the game works will be familiar if youâ€™ve played VNs before. 

[b]Price: 10/10[/b]
It doesnâ€™t cost you a penny to own this. Itâ€™s absolutely FREE and anyone can just pick this up right now! And yes, this is totally worth getting. It is worth your time reading all of this, [b]it is worth it[/b], trust me on this one. I would pay for this if I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169907443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1428287645}
review: This is a very heartfelt story that brings out the reality of futile situtations. It explores the emotions of whether you should try when you already know the outcome and having a purpose or destination to strive towards. Nacissu is definitely a shining gem I happened to find admist all the visual novels out there. The music really keyed in and matched perfectly with the script. You know all to well what is their fate but you can't help but wonder how they wander around searching for the unreachable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061039200', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1421153133}
review: Sad, touching story. 2 hours used well, I highly recommend people who have been craving for VNs, and people new to VNs, to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157308735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1420909311}
review: This game was wow. I had so many mixed feelings when it came to the characters you meet, especially Setsumi in the 2nd side game with Himeko. One cannot help but smile at the characters many personalities, yet feel sad by the fact that everyone in this game is dying and you are reading through their final moments. Awesome story and soundtrack, just awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030323174', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1420521804}
review:
While I almost never do serious reviews, here's an exception [EDIT] The hell with tables.
  But seriously. Having stumbled upon this gem by accident, I found the narrative hard to break away from until I finished up both novels. Narcissu stands out to me in the fact that with most VNs, you get choices, but these are purely novels; click, read, continue. (Autoplay is also a thing, so it can be presented more like a movie.)

The Good
-Characters one can empathize/sympathize with
-Great presentation of a few powerful subjects
-Excellent use of music throughout both novels
-The options of voiced and unvoiced are available, should one want to leave more to the imagination

The Bad
-At points, it might disinterest the reader due to the pacing
-No inclusion of the third novel
    
 The Meh   
-[spoiler]Himeko's cheeriness might not appeal to some where it did with others[/spoiler]
-Religious aspects, view it how you will.
-Only one overlookable inconsistency between the two novels


9/10, would read again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144120748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1590082629}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027903916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1421058949}
review: This is the first VN I have red and it really is a piece of artwork. The music is just fantastic, I loved it. The whole story is well written; it made me apart of the story which I love as it makes me feel more for the characters. It is a very sad story but it certainly opens your eyes to reality. I've never cried my soul out as much as I did with the ending. I would definately recommend this VN to anyone but be prepared to take a rollercoaster of emotions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095254894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1420430109}
review:
Note: This isnt a game, it's a Visual Novel and (at least in Narcissu 1, I havent "played" Narcissu 2 that's also included yet) there aren't even choices or anything. Also there are Steam achievements, but they dont work yet.

Narcissu tells a moving tale of 2 people with a terminal disease and how they spent their final days. It has a very minimalistic approach both in the story and the accompanying art, and there were a few points in the writing that I found weird, but overall it was well written and interesting, with many parts making you think about life, death and how humans deal with it.

I can highly recommend experiencing it - even more so since it's completely free.

The accompanying music is awesome, if you like Japanese music. I am actually considering buying it so I can listen to it normally, outside the game. 

I found the main character's voice enjoyable. Because the voices are only in Japanese I didnt understand anything, though. Ah well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052361592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1507307529}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044129122', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1647790625}
review: After I finished this game, water started slowly seeping out of my eyes. I didn't know what was happening, a game had never made me feel this way before. I could feel my vision blur with water blocking my line of sight. My body mass slowly became lighter as the floor beneath me became more damp, water pooling beneath me. My mouth felt dry and my stomach felt empty, I quickly realized that all of the liquid inside of my body was being sucked out of my body and pouring out of my eyelids. My chair starting floating in the small lake that had formed in my room. There was no end in sight. The house had to be drained and dry cleaned four times to get rid of all the water. Don't read this visual novel.

review: This is NOT a game.  It's just a story that you click through.  People find it sentimantal, and that's fine, but you have NO OPTIONS.  The only point to clicking is to see the next line of text.  How about not listing it as a game? It was a litt;e boring, and poorly-translated.  If you find it charming to read your anime-type stories with bad grammar, enjoy.  But it's not a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005342368', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1531362326}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057046155', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1476787796}
review:
Tired of some bloody hack and slash and hardcore game ?

Bet you all enjoy seeing your enemy's tear, but how about taste your own tear this time ?

Let's take a break and play this lovely VN instead.

The storyline is great and the BGM ? It's really a masterpiece, blend in so well during the scenes. 69/10. (I came while playing)

author: {'steamid': '76561198156938027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1491530415}
review:
A short visual novel with a great storyline. The OST for both Narcissu and Narcissu Side 2nd are great. This particular VN has only one route. That is understandable though since this was made by the original author as free. The DLC is definitely recommended if you are into buying OSTs.

You can get a good gist on what this is all about if you check the in-game screenshots and the video trailer/promo. For me, this is a tearjerker.

Definitely recommended.

review:
Beautiful, captivating story. I found it hard to stay away! Very depressing, but at the same time it... helps put things in perspective a bit. I am definately looking forward to reading it again! It can be a little slow feeling at times, but over all I enjoy it.

 8.5/10 stars from me
 Note: I do not reccomend reading/playing this if you are sensitive to medical issues
Note 2: Added half a star for fixing/enabling the achivements. Thank you!

review: Narcissu is a sad, haunting tale accompanied by beautiful artwork and music, and itâ€™s a good example of a literary form of the visual novel. It requires a little patience from the reader, but itâ€™ll make you think, and unless youâ€™re carved out of stone, itâ€™ll make you feel, too. You may feel sad, you may feel confused, you may even feel outraged, but your emotions will be stirred, and that was the authorâ€™s sole intention. Itâ€™s a road trip worth taking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041446891', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1418445152}
review:
Narcissu is beautifully sad. You can feel the hearts of the girls spilling out from the story. Some might experience the stages of grief on their first play through. I've recently had a close family member pass away in hospice and for me Narcissu  gave me a calm acceptance of a life well lived.

10/10 

*CAUTION: may cause a strong emotional state in those not accepting of the cycle of life and death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044719949', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2958, 'last_played': 1430034636}
review:
This is not a game in the traditional sense. You don't have to navigate, survive, move, do anything at all. Consider it a Visual Novel with no decisions points at all. Think of it as listening to a story. 

One playtime of N1 is about 3-4 hours, and N2 approximately double of that. (Notwithstanding the time spent crying) Although the game allows you to save, I suggest taking a Saturday afternoon to finish your first playthrough in one sitting. I wouldn't finish N1 and N2 in a single day though, as both are very emotionally draining. 

The music is powerful. It complements the game really well, and is a good setting for the mood. The theme musical piece of N2 is just beautiful, although very painful if you understand the meaning of the lyrics. This is especially more so when you consider Himiko's background. There are only about 10+ song tracks per game though, and each song track is not perticularly long, so you may observe that the music gets repetative after a few hours. The VN offers a choice of voiced and unvoiced version, in Japanese. I love the voice acting. The tone was well done, and you can feel the personality and emotions of the characters through their voices. It was actually painful for me to listen to it, as though someone who was really hurting was there, right in front of me. 

The graphics isn't bad, but neither is it great. There's no animation throughout the entire game, it is just a series of largely nondescript scenery artwork. It probably would have been rather weird without the art, though. 

There's nothing much I can say of the story without being too spoilerish, so really, just try it out for yourself. Narcissu is a very though provoking piece centering on the topic of death, mainly on the process of dying. I'll not touch on the points raised, leaving the story open to your own interpretation. The writing transported me into their world, made me internalized their emotions as though I was the one actually going through everything. This is a real tear-jerker, although I'm glad its not because it wants to be a tear-jerker. That is to say, the storyline is not written such that it becomes a sad story, rather, the message behind the story generally evokes sad feelings in people. 

I've came across people who complained that the story behind N1 was too linear. (I must admit, I was an idiot for missing the blatently smoking Chekov's gun at the beginning) This is not a detective mystery novel, and to put an unexpected twist ending would go against the point of the game. N2 is significantly longer than N1, but touches on more topics as well. It is the prologue of N1, giving more details of unexaplined things which happened in N1, and giving more depth to Setsumi. Even so, it is a distinctly seperate story from N1.

After finishing N2, don't close the game just yet. Go back to the main page, as you've unlocked a short Epilogue/Acknowledgements. It is concluding section from the author, giving us what the ending after N1 would turn out to be. 

It would be good to read the game notes too, especially the part about translator's disambiguation of the two translation versions and the choice of voiced or unvoiced versions on which to choose for your first time. For my first playthrough I used a voiced version of Agilis' translation and did it in the order N1 followed by N2. Although the author  suggested playing it in the chronological order (N2 before N1), I recommend going through N1 first. There were limited information about the main character Setsumi, and her backgrounds in N1; I felt this actually helped to focus the story onto the important points. For those who don't like the slight confusion of not knowing the main character's background, go with the author's suggestion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027742235', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1418261222}

author: {'steamid': '76561198147815808', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1418090741}
review: Strap up to anything you can, because you're about to get hit by the feels truck. And just when you're almost dead, you get run over by the feels train. Not for the leaky eyes and not for the faint hearted. I had to fight a whole army of salarymen to make up for the manly tears I leaked at the ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004796884', 'num_games_owned': 1290, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1445559062}
review:
A short but emotional and touching minimalitic story that focuses around terminal illness, mortality and coming to terms with it.  The amazing OST adds to further it's aura.

Take note this is a Kinetic VN so there's no decision making. It's just simply reading and clicking through the story.  

It's also free so you can't really go wrong with trying it. Give it a go!

Story: 8/10
Music: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198163121530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1417303894}
review:
[h1]Conclusion/tl;dr up top[/h1]
Narcissu, being a kinetic novel, is not for everyone, but those who don't mind a "game" based primarily on reading or who are already fans of visual novels as a genre will be rewarded with a great story that will make you think and might just make you feel. Plus, hey, it's free, so it's hard not to recommend.

[h1]The nitty gritty[/h1]
Narcissu is a kinetic novel released by the doujin circle Stage-Nana in Japan and published here on Steam by Sekai Project. The story rotates around young people from the 7th Floor (the hospice ward). That is, people whose death has been decided. Without saying much as to the plot, I feel like the novel eloquently covers some heavy subjects: What are the things one has to do before dying? Faced with an unavoidable demise, how might people react to take back independence lost and march vibrantly toward their final act? How does one smile at the end, and how do those left behind smile after?

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[i]For people who have experience with visual/kinetic novels, this section is probably unnecessary, but for the unintiated:[/i]
A visual novel generally works like a 'Choose Your Own Adventure' book with graphics, music, and sometimes voices. The "player", usually in the guise of the protagonist, makes choices throughout the story that affect the plot. However, Narcissu 1st & 2nd are Kinetic Novels, so they have no choices and very little player interaction aside from a click or press of the enter key to advance the text (though autoplay is actually the default setting for Narcissu Side 2nd, and the author mentions in the notes that he himself sees it more like a movie). Personally, I'd describe it as a long minimalist cutscene with save, load, and backlog options. The game itself is much closer to a novel or a reading experience than a game, and this, no doubt will be what turns a lot of people off from Narcissu, if not the genre as a whole.

[h1]Answering common questions[/h1]
[b]Length?[/b]
Narcissu was about a 3 to 4 hour read for me. Narcissu Side 2nd (the included prequel) was 5 to 6 hours. Understandably, it might be a lot of reading for some, but both games are neatly divided into chapters, and the save feature works like a bookmark that you can use at any time.

[b]Order?[/b]
Narcissu was released in 2005, and Narcissu Side 2nd was released in 2007, both are included in this release, and I read them in the release order. However, Narcissu Side 2nd is actually a prequel to the events of the original Narcissu, and in the notes for Narcissu Side 2nd, the author suggests reading them in chronological order.

[b]Replay Value?[/b]
That probably depends on the player. The original Narcissu was kind of an experiment in minimalist storytelling for Stage-Nana, so it was released in both voiced and unvoiced versions, as the author wanted to see how the voices changed people's impression of the work, and subsequently Narcissu Side 2nd is presented similarly. An interesting mirror of that for this release is that two different translations are included: one made with the intent to localize the novel smoothly into English, and one made with the intent to replicate the phrasing of the original as faithfully as possible and paint a mental picture close to what the original author intended. Though I'm writing this review after just one reading, I can see how this approach would add replay value, and I intend to revisit Narcissu after it stews on me a bit.

[b]Why is this free?[/b]
Narcissu is a doujin (or fanmade/amatuer) work and was released for free in Japan. When Sekai-Project announced this Steam release, they said that in the spirit of the original release, Narcissu on Steam would be "As free as Steam would let it be," so here we are. With that said, don't take the lack of a price as a reflection of quality, because, quite frankly, there's no rule stating that professionals can't do doujin works. The music and voices are especially standout in this release, and a few of the voice actresses have both anime and game roles to their credit.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1] [i](finally)[/i]
Well, I put it at the top for a reason...

This is an excellent release that feels like a labor of love on the part of the author. To me, it stands as a great experiment in minimalist storytelling (especially in the original Narcissu, where I found myself endeared to the characters even with next to no background given about them). Though the novel (and the genre) may not be for everyone, if this feels like your kind of thing, and you have the time to give to reading a great story, I can't not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069172338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1412860420}
review:
A short and impactful free visual novel that's definitely worth the hour or so of normal gameplay. The game is linear in nature, and you'll spend time by simply reading. 

For a free VN, this is well worth the time to experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099633438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1416010763}
review: For a free game, this is a beautifully made game. The story is amazing, and the music just adds to the experience. In fact, this is one of the only games that legitimately made my cry. I should also note that this is a visual novel and not a "real" game. However, it's one of the greatest visual novels (Even up there with games such as Ace Attorney) ever created. I give this game a 9.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026325298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1416173150}
review:
I actually love the idea of more visual and interactive novels coming to steam so I fully knew what to expect. I got through the first book and part way through the other. It wasn't bad, but I guess I was hoping for a more interesting ending. The whole first one just seemed like missed potential. I started seeing the same thing in the second one so I just stopped reading. It seemed just as the characters were given an ounce of depth it ended. I know this is free and all, but I don't consider price when I review. At the end of the day it falls short because the author seems to lose interest in his own stories before they go anywhere.

Maybe since it is early access all the stories become more strongly linked eventually, but at the current pace of these I'd say I have no interest either way. Best wishes to the author in the future though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005481210', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1445875729}
review:
"Or could be that, when learned the meaning of death, is also the time they learned the meaning of living"

I wouldn't call this a unflawed masterpiece, but this is a game that leave me to think about it for a very long time. If Clannad is the game that teach you the meaning of life, Narcissu is the game that will teach you the meaning of death.

Narcissu 1st is an experiment on how minimalist a game could be. There are only two main characters, no supporting charactor and few minor characters. Setsumi, the female protagonist is quite quiet character while your character doesn't have a name or visible face. The game recommends you to play in unvoiced version as it has some lines modified but I played in voiced instead. Sometimes the game is kind of boring as a result of this

Narcissu 2nd side explores the backstory of Setsumi and put answers in several questions you might pose during reading of the first game. 2nd also has unvoiced version but this time it doesn't make much changes. The presentation is more cheerish and production quality is a lot higher than the 1st yet the sad ambience is still persistent.

Narcissu 1st & 2nd are not the games that will going to make you cry, and are designed that way to conveys the message behind this game more clearly. It will, however, make you feel sad, very sad for almost all of the running time.

The game together lasts for 8 hours for me using autoplay, which is kind of long in my standard but should be short for visual novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068383950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1415604731}
review:
A linear VN, pretty short and with a lack of background images. Anyhow as for most VN the strong point is the plot, and yes, this one compensates the other things.

I won't spoil anything, I'll just put it this way: Imagine playing Katawa Shoujo, now there are no routes just one girl, the game is pretty short, you cannot do anything to avoid the only one, and pretty sad ending.

I cannot tell anything else, but after finishing the VN, you'll have a weird feeling of beauty and sadness (5% beauty, 95% sadness).

review:
Couldn't finish this because I started to feel. 
Also, I realized it was a visual novel, so if you don't like visual novels then play something different I guess. However, if you like sad, pretty stories, then you might like this. *shrugs*

Also, I should note that its not an interactive visual novel. Its analogous to reading a book. I was expecting to be able to choose dialogue and such.

review:

The story that overwhelms the reader with feels, a story you'll never forget.

This was also my very first VN, wich makes it even better.

This both contains 1&2, so you will feel the whole experience.

Well, i hope you'll have a great time reading this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047424945', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1415291594}
review:
Narcissu (1st and 2nd) is a slightly sad, yet somewhat cute story that takes a look at patients of a hospital (hospice) who don't have a long time left to live. I definitely lean more towards the "thumbs up" button than to not recommend it. The game (read: visual novel) have that amateurish feel to it. It doesn't affect the game negatively. Perhaps more the opposite - like comparing a hand-made product to a mass produced one. The story holds up quite well and the background music is solid work that adds to the immersion. I would have liked a bit more depression to it for that extra impact. But that's just my personal love for depressing stories. The ending was quite satisfying. 

By all means, give it a go when you are bored or feel like trying out some non-interactive visual novel. It's a free title. You'll only lose time, but hopefully gain something worth it to think about.

EDIT: Oh yeah. The artwork is decent especially in the 2nd title. Scarce in quantity but it leaves more for your imagination. Manga/anime haters though: Don't bother. This is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082976728', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1446463038}
review:
Don't play this if you're
1. Easily offended (Especially with religion things)
2. Easy to get depressed
3. Don't want to read at all

First this is a one story & one ending Visual Novel
So, you don't have any choice at all
It's just like reading a book & listening to music

Narcissu (1st), where did I begin from?
I have played this since early access and I liked it
The story is about a girl who knew that her ends is near
And "we" (the male MC) is supposed to accompany her to do whatever she likes
Both of us are pretty sick and want to do a big journey to find "Narcissu"
Thus, the story is begin

The thing I like from this game are the musics & the messages
One of the message that I caught "Just live your life as free/fun as you want it to be.
Do fun things, reach your dreams, make good friends.
Fulfil your life with a satisying life before you're gone."
It's telling that you have to be more cheerful in life and have fun
(Maybe it's the purpose of the game too?)

Sorry, it's maybe kinda lacking of many things.. But I'll complete it soon
Anyway, if you think you're suited for this game you should play this beautiful game

Note : This game is also called winamp simulator 2015
(The musics are so pretty)
Please buy the ost for supporting the developers :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988034721', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1532129315}
review:
Una visual novel muy muy bonita y triste a la vez con una banda sonora sublime, una vieja joya que ahora se puede disfrutar en steam, recomiendo tomarse su tiempo en verla y disfrutarla poco a poco 

Pero, antes de nada:[list]
[*]Esto no es un "juego" es una "visual novel"
[*]Pertenece al genero de novelas kinetica es decir: no tiene elecciones sobre la historia, te conviertes en un mero espectador.
[*]Audio: japo, subtitulos: inglÃ©s o japo, es decir, no hay espaÃ±ol
[/list]

[b]Caracteristicas:[/b]
[list]
[*] [b]Muy buena historia[/b]
[*] [b]Inmejorable banda sonora[/b]
[*] FULL VOICE (excepto nosotros mismos), un lujo.
[*] Artwork (imagenes) un poco escasas pero bonitas y muy ligadas al momento e historia
[*] Es gratis!!! (y aÃºn asÃ­ yo habrÃ­a pagado)
[*] La primera parte sabe a poco cuando empeizas a jugar la segunda (es bastante mÃ¡s nueva)
[*] Se pueden jugar jugar por independiente pero recomiendo jugarlas en su orden
[*] LacrimÃ³gena, igual o incluso peor que clannad, tened paÃ±uelos al lado
[/list]

recomiendo ponerlo en modo automatico con la "a" o usar un gamepad (mando) para no tener que tener las manos en el teclado o el ratÃ³n y asÃ­ poder inmersionarte mÃ¡s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080478415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1414388610}
review: not sure what to say about this, since this is the first visual novel based game i'd played. what i am sure about is that the story was beautiful and very well written, the visuals were okay, and the music was nice too. there's also a lot of emotion flowing through it, as if you pay attention to the dialogue, yo can understand what the characters are dealing with. all in all, i recommend it to anyone who's interested in this sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136847580', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1430830242}
review: This Visual Novel has a emotional, somehow true story, which you (or at least me) get to cry and smile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016179939', 'num_games_owned': 2437, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1414268481}
review:
First, don't expect this to be a game. There's no interaction, no choices to make, nothing to do except read and press the space bar to progress through the story. 

Saying that, this is a really good visual novel. There are two stories. The first takes places after the second. If you want to do them chronologically, start with the second then the first. However, in my opinion, the stories work better if you go through them the other way. 

It needs to be said that there's a trigger warning for suicide in these stories. So if that bothers you, you may want to pass this over. If not, I highly recommend downloading and completing both stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095079846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1622108361}
review:
I truely love this game!  It's one extremely depressing visual novel though!  As soon as the game starts it displays suicide statistics! And that soundtrack music, just wow!  xD  I played for a decent amout of hours and didn't run across any bugs!

10+ Sountrack!
10+ Originality!
10+ Story!
10+ Charater Design!
10+ Visaul Art!
20+ For having a voice cast!
30+ For being free! "Stage Nana is truely worthy of developing Visual Novels, I will deffentaily buy any future releases!

This game is totaly worth it, speacially since it's free! Only thing I would of like to see is trading cards, and I know I am asking for a lot but I would of enjoyed having a English voice cast, I don't know of many visual novels that do, It would be nice though! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198041552633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1438298567}
review:
I could write a really long review for this game, but I just dont see the need. There is no reason you need to hesitate in playing this game; it is completly free to play and absolutly unforgettable. This is in my opinion the best story ever written and also the best game ever made. It is an experience like no other and extremely heartfelt. Just play it, seriously.

Also note that the game is also available on android.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020283565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1429933294}
review: After some time, I managed to finish this visual novel. When I first started reading it I was surprised by the complete lack of choices, since most other visual novels are a 'choose your own adventure' variant. This isn't necessarily bad, but I like to be in control of the main character, even if it's slight. This, naturally also leaves only one route to follow, and one possible ending. This makes replayability.... slim, as well as shorten the novels length. However, the story you do get is pretty interesting, and toys with your emotions pretty well, regardless of the fact that the first novel has no character development, and the protagonist just kind of does things. Setsumi, the protagonists 'friend', is dull and boring. She is overly intelligent with no explanations as to how she knows anything considering she's spent most of her time in the hospital. Side 2nd goes into some detail as to why she knows these things, and is in my opinion the better of the 2 novels. We learn more about Setsumi, and her past, as the story is told primarily from her point of view. Side 2nd was longer, and had a more satisfying end, and there was some character development with the main characters. The soundtrack is.... decent, it does the job, but there weren't any notable tracks that I particularly liked, and it didn't transition very well between scenes. It's nothing special. The voice acting was pretty good for the most part, particularly for setsumis character in the first novel. The same voice actor is in side 2nd as setsumi, but she sounded just as depressed as she is in the first novel, which doesn't make sense considering she still had some hope at this point in the timeline. The other female protagonist in side 2nd is great, she sounds very cheerful, and knew how to be fun, and serious when necessary. None of the other voice actors stood out, as they had few lines. If you're looking for a good read, I would recommend this, but don't expect anything too special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069927102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1495048102}
review:
Sorry,I regret writing a (not recommending) review about this game.It was my side that is wrong thinking this story doesn't make any sense.This game is actually a really sad story about a girl who is sick and can't be cured.Her parents and friends have abandon her and never to return.She only have one last friend who have the same sickness as her and they trying to survive with no cash.That actually very sad to think,few tears came out of my eyes.People who are emotional going to cry alot trust me. ^^

 This is actually a Free-To-Play,when i first think about it,I thought the author and developer are not going to give their best on this game but they actually did a perfect job writing the story and drawing it.They even did put some sound affects.

Once again I am very sorry writing a review (not recommend) for this game early,this is actually one of the best game.

5/5 Recommended for People who want some tears shed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025655099', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1413578942}
review:
Just... wow.

I was totally mindblown by the story, when I first downloaded it I was expecting your standard tragic VN, but this one took quite a different approach.

The story is absolutely amazing, and yet immensly sad, reminding us to value our time, and that nothing lasts forever.
You basically step into the shoes of the "Protagonist", an unnamed young man who has been determined terminally ill, and is therefore sent to the 7th floor of the local Hospital, during his stay at the 7th floor he meets a girl and an unexpected friendship starts to take place.

I'll give the story a 10/10, simply amazing.

The Art is pretty good, but the decision to almost never show the girl during the scenes was definetly the right one for this VN, same with never showing the "Protagonist".

So, art is a solid 8/10

The music is very touching and fits extremely well, seriously ramping up the feels.

Music is a 10/10

And finally I'll leave this right here: If you want a feeltrip, I implore you to finish Narcissu, it's so strong a piece that I started crying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113718154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1413509551}

Setsumi is my fave character though. :')

author: {'steamid': '76561198081318302', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1413661939}
review:
Do you like sad music , sad sounding people that speak japanese with english subs then this game about 2 people ( Nameless Male ) and the other setsumi the main female character.

Story 8/10

The story behind this game is about a girl named setsumi  has an illness they never put a name on  she lived normal her entier life still she was in middle school then she is hospitalized and her friend come to her every day at the hospital  and give her good wish cards , untill she keeps getting hospitalized that she becomes a fragment in everyones mind. Those people she called friends are now just strangers  to her she keeps doing the same  cycle over and over  < Hospital < Stay for Weeks < Clinic < Hospital > And it goes on and on. 

Protaginist (Nameless Male )

This Male you meet in the first chapter of the first game tells you that he has the same illness as the setsumi  and  is in the same cycle  as her and then he ends up on the 7th floor  with this girl setsumi  on his second  day there he sees her in the longue starring blankly  at the TV nothing interesting playing.



Sound Track 9/10

The sound track for this VN is just beautiful and has lots of  sad piano notes that add to the emotional break down to the characters that they have later in the story , like the first sound track you hear is  quite sadistic sounds but also kind of soothing to your ears cause of the fluid sound going with the piano it adds lots of emotion to the game as the characters are pretty dull cause of they're sad looking and bery depressed looking and sounds ( If you do voice over ) and then when they leave they kinda brighten not that much but it makes the story a littleless sad until , you get farther in the story and do the second game but the sound track gets better and worse has it's ups and downs everywhere.


My Verdict

My verdict in total  is a  9.1 as the sound track and story went together   so well in my opinion the characters  never had many dull points just a  few drops here or there that didn't make much  of a difference to me , the story/plot was amazing to my taste of story as i  have an attraction to sad and depression stories and situations , as well as games of sadness and All those kind of things. I recommend playing this VN it opens a lot of ideas up to simple minded people aswell as some amazing ideas for sad stories of death or relationships or something of that matter.


9/11 is my ACTUAL final verdict Hue Hue Hue

author: {'steamid': '76561198044538526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1588192154}
review:
Narcissu is a MUST in your steam library, but remember this is not a game, its a VN (visual novel), for people who are new into VN narcissu is a very recommended one, as it was the first VN i had ever played and i absolutely loved it, no regrets installing it.
The overall of the game is AMAZING, but the thing that will most stand out is the story and the music, there are some masterpieces that are worth listening to.

I give this visual novel a 10/10 without a doubt, anway, why are you still reading this review, go download it NOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066923470', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1420307395}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026599865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1413262512}
review:
The soundtracks themselves already worth the time to be put into trying out this game. They are probably the best ones I have ever heard among all the games that I have played. I dont always pause and listen to the music over and over again while I am playing a game but somehow this game has this magicial power in driving me into doing this. No, it is not because the story is awful that makes me choose to stop for a good 5 minutes just to listen to its music; it is simply because the music is too beautiful. It makes you wanna close your eyes as it takes your mind away from the reality. 

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065395947', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1442155160}
review:
Note: I played (or read this) offline while on a really long car ride

Narcissu is a Visual Novel so don't expect gameplay. It is just a book on a computer. The story is of a young man and woman with terminal diseases going on an adventure before they are gone. You read a relationship build from nothing but sorrow. If this story doesn't make you laugh, and doesn't make you cry, you don't have a heart.

9.5/10 would cry my eyes out again

Note: I played this offline. That's the reason for my low play time

author: {'steamid': '76561198062446484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1558733274}
review:
The text above tells me to describe what I liked or disliked...

Man, there is no dislike. This perfect Novel just mady me cry, made me open my eyes, let me see the world from a new side (again).
Yes, I cried many times... I guess I am getting too close to those characters. Also the problem with depression for myself came back.
It shows that the world still is a cruel place (Humanity. not the nature itself). We're not going to change it soon... and what's even worse, if you're not "normal" for the "normal" society, you are unwelcome. "Friends" become strangers and switch the path to not come close to you. You have nobody who will listen to you. Who will understand you.
Not many people will read it I assume. But those who do, and feel the characters emotions...
At least you have the right emotions to continue life and make the world even a bit brighter than it is now...

All I can say is...: "Soredewa... SayÅnara..."

Rating: 10/10
Personal Rating: âˆ/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054557836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1460163594}
review:
An amazing soundtrack and a deep, thoughtful storyline. 
I fell in love with the characters, but knowing they don't have long to live made it all the more emotional and heartbreaking.
Keep in mind, a lot of dialouge is very very thought provoking and the story should not be rushed. 
I don't like reading, but the story of Setsumi had me in tears all the time. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157696256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1413325412}
review: Enjoyable game so far. I love how emotionally-invested I got in this game, considering the lack of decision-making options. I highly reccomend this game to those who are in to fully-textual Visual Novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065580359', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1408813949}
review:
This Game.... Truly amazing with it's beautiful story and emotional plot.

It is one of the best works stage-nana had to offer so far in my opinion. The Ending will leave you in mixed emotions, sad, happy, relief and etc. You bet your ass you will have connections with the characters, the characters were pretty good and the main character was believable but there are barely any characters in this novel since it's focused between 2 characters so don't think this is a harem where you will bang every single girl nope instead you will have romance with this emotionless girl, not really love but you will see their mutual likings and views towards life and the situation they are in. I Highly reccommend this to anyone who loves beautiful things although this game was lacking in eye candy since only few pictures were given here to aid your visual needs so you'll have to use your imagination most of the time AND you can never miss out the soundtrack! The Soundtrack really fits the atmosphere and gives you an intense feeling! Kudos to the people in charge of the soundtrack, truly Amazing.

Now for the 2nd installment for this game, Man.... *Sniff* In my opinion this was the most powerful, it was the prequel for the whole story focused on Setsumi Sakura and Himeko Shinohara, it was truly amazing and beautiful and really really Unforgettable. Himeko Shinohara is a very likeable character that becomes ill after a bit and the climax to this was really memorable left me thinking for days. You should witness and experience it for yourself because there are literally no words for me to describe it.

Overall this was a good Visual novel, I repeat "Visual Novel" There is no gaming in this only interaction in browsing the different sections of the scripts most of the strength is given in the story.

9 / 10 Story
6 / 10 Art
9 / 10 Soundtrack

RECCOMENDED SO HARD THAT YOU HAVE TO PLAY THIS GAME, IT'S FREE SO GOOOOOOO It's worth your time :D

review:
ya lo jugue en el pasado, fue el primer visual novel que jugue y OH Dios mio, si lo vas a jugar tienes que tener lista la caja de paÃ±uelos y bebidas rehidratantes porque vas a llorar.

Es corto, en un solo dia lo puedes acabar (la primera parte) si no conoces que son las visual novel, no tienes que hacer combos de ataques ni nada, solo ver y escuchar la historia, dejar que los sentimientos de los personajes te lleven en la trama.

Para algunos sera aburrido porque prefieren juegos que tengan que trabajar, pero tomate tu tiempo para ver esta historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089669597', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1412695844}
review:
Narcissu is not a game,it's a masterpiece.
This game has one of the most heartwarming story i have ever read.Unlike any other free VNs i have played,this one has great voice acting,great art and a delightful soundtrack,it's so good that i often listen to it when i'm doing homework or sleeping.
You should support Stage-nana and Sekai Project by buying the soundtrack.I can't wait to see more games from them.
This game deserves my 10/10.

Play it and be ready for the feels train.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079031957', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1431260807}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025179595', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1529295273}
review:
A story that drags, but ultimately moves you...

- The soundtrack is a bit repetitive, but has some real gems. The Side 2nd theme is amazing.
- You could see the ending coming quite clearly - the buildup is the emotional part of this game.
- The beginning/middle drag a bit, but looking back, it was the little things that happened that contribute to the ending's impact.

There is a "sequel" of sorts now (the Anthology edition), which adds more stories in the same theme, along with an epilogue for a character in Side 2nd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069244438', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1661965557}
review:
I've read through Narcissu several times by now, across various versions.  Every time I do, my opinion increases, and by now I think it might be one of the greatest visual novel achievements ever.  I don't think I've ever read another work of fiction as genuinely nihilist as this.

Well worth it, even if Narcissu 2 really isn't the same level as the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087087590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1452831269}
review:
What is there to say about Narcissu...
It's a tale of hardship, depression and dealing with hopelessness. It's a very touching story, but... well depressing... so it's not for the faint of heart.

It is one of the most depressing things I have ever read, but it's beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041242023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1527490447}
review:
When beautiful art, expressive music, and thoughtful words combine, the result is [i]Narcissu 1st & 2nd[/i].

Written from a first-person perspective, this visual novel often takes you deep into the thoughts of the character in question. Art is very minimal, but used to excellent effect, with Japanese voice acting also included during key parts of the story.

It should be noted that there is absolutely [b]no interaction[/b] beyond clicking to navigate menus and proceed forwards and backwards through the text. The story is completely linear. You simply read through from start to finish, with no choices to be made to affect the final outcome.

What was most notable to me about Narcissu 1st & 2nd was the depth of thought and feeling that went into its storytelling. It made me want all the best for the characters in the story. It made me, on more than one occasion, hope that a certain character would succeed in doing something illegal, if only so that they could help someone else or that some suffering could be alleviated, even if the result of their success would only be temporary. It truly made me feel for the plight of the characters, and I'm not ashamed to say that I cried on numerous occasions throughout both sides 1 and 2 of Narcissu.

The music in this title is mostly instrumental, with the piano making a common appearance in most tracks. There is the general feeling of hopelessness and sadness, but not in a downcast, depressive way (this may have been influenced by my reading of the story). It's more a feeling of acceptance, whether you like it or not, and just trying your best to smile and say goodbye.

This version of Narcissu comes with two English translations by different people, as well as the original Japanese text. Although there is an option to read through the story with or without the voice acting (which only comes in Japanese), there is no option to turn the music off (though I see this as a good thing, since the music adds so much to the atmosphere and feeling of the narrative and dialogue). It is apparent that much effort has been placed into preserving the accuracy of the original Japanese text. Included are also many notes left behind by people who worked on Narcissu, including Tomo Kataoka who is the writer.

The story also raises a lot of questions and gives the reader many things to think about, though I'll leave prospective readers/players to discover these for themselves.

[u]Read this visual novel if:[/u]
- You like deep, thoughtful narrative with a melancholy setting.
- You have an interest in philosophy.
- You have a soft spot for 'tear-jerkers', or want a story that will [b]really make you feel something[/b].

[u]Don't read this visual novel if:[/u]
- You have an aversion to sad things and stories.
- You are uncomfortable with the idea or theme of death.
- You want a visual novel with multiple endings and choices that you can make.

---

It's rare to find a title of this high quality. From what I could see, spelling and grammar errors in the English text were few and far between. The music, art, and writing all meld together so perfectly that I can hardly find anything to complain about. The only possible complaint I might have is that there is no end-game gallery to view all the art upon total completion of both sides 1 and 2.

Otherwise, I more than recommend [i]Narcissu 1st & 2nd[/i] to anyone who has an interest in visual novels, or a sad, yet beautifully told story. Personally, I would rate it among one of the best visual novels I've ever read, and can easily give it a 10/10. Stage-Nana and Tomo Kataoka have produced an utterly unforgettable title and have even given it to us all for free.

Go and download it now. Just make sure you have a box of tissues handy. Oh my [i]bleeding[/i] heart...

author: {'steamid': '76561198096746483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1411033441}
review:
About 4 years ago, I recall myself writing an essay arguing against letting teminally-ill patients euthanize themselves, namely because it was a defeatist thing to do, and that it would waste what precious time they had left.

After getting through Narcissu 1, I realize how short-sighted that opinion was.

Narcissu doesn't boast any gamplay at all; but it doesn't need any.

The primary focus of this Visual Novel is Setsumi, a terminally-ill young woman who has been relegated to living in a hospice for 7 years without any hope of recovery, and how the pain of isolation has already numbed her emotionally to the prospect of death.

Enter the main character, who himself has been diagnosed with a terminal condition, and is checked into the same hospice as Setsumi. What follows is a desperate, yet touching tale about how even those who have no more hope can still fight to pursue happiness and the final choice of how their lives end.

I played Part I first, but looking back, I highly advise playing Part I last so that everything ends more conclusively.

On an ending note: there is a good reason why this story has been reprinted and retold in physically form, and you have to play this VN to discover it. This game will make you think about how precious our lives are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050151346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1410930620}
review:
Finished the game about 5 yrs ago in another language while I was still in high school, now thinking back, it's probably part of the reason why I'm so into soundtracks instead of actual songs now. 

Really glad that it came to steam. I don't wanna overhype anything, but the translation is very, very qualified, the music is quite good, and the game is free. So why the hell not. 

I probably need an afternoon to replay it. Damn it, time flies.
