author: {'steamid': '76561198053639248', 'num_games_owned': 4730, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1431813934}
review:
I'm not really into deep sad stories, but I'll recommend it anyway.
It's a Visual Novel, you basically scroll through a story and read it.
There is an option for voiced or not, and there will be achievements for completing the game on each mode, but those aren't available at the moment since the game is on Early Access.
I still haven't finished the first story, but seems they are quite long.
The OST is nice, and the girl is cute, even though she doesn't appear in many pannels. 
It's quite to the feels side and pretty sad, so if you really hate sad stories that's probably not for you.

review:
Sin duda, puedo decir que las 3 o 4 horas seguidas que he pasado con esta novela grÃ¡fica han sido muy envolventes, la trama junto con las sencillas imagenes, los efectos de sonido y la mÃºsica, han captado toda mi atenciÃ³n, haciendo que me centrase totalmente en los escenarios que se plantean.

Es la primera vez que leo una novela grÃ¡fica entera (siempre me acaban cansando), por no decir, repito, que del tirÃ³n...

Una historia crudamente realista, y por ello absorventemente preciosa, no tiene nada que ver con otras del estilo, que pretenciosamente se ahogan en el drama y la tragedia....

 Es gratis, y estÃ¡ en steam, bÃ¡jatela, es una obra que te llega.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002539100', 'num_games_owned': 1473, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1526280876}
review:
Narcissu and Narcissu 2nd have different tones but they're both similar. The writing is brief and the story is linear without choices unlike most visual novels. 

Narcissu is about 1.5 hours long if you're listening to the voiced edition. It's difficult to get into because both characters are very jaded (They have been spending their time in the hospital waiting to die.) It's alright for a short read. I found it more happy than depressing based on how the characters act towards the end.

Narcissu 2nd is significantly longer, about 3-4 hours (voiced) and is the prequel to the first story. The tone is different, the characters are much more happy and you're able to learn the characters' backgrounds. Also, the production quality is noticeably higher with more art and has a short animation. Much easier to get into than the first.

review:
la historia es interesante, tal como se debe esperar de una novela grÃ¡fica de estilo manga que consigue llegar a occidente, sin embargo solo la podrÃ¡n  disfrutar un grupo muy selecto, ya que ademas de saber apreciar la temÃ¡tica de no interacciÃ³n por parte del jugador o mejor dicho lector, el alto nivel de ingles que se debe poseer para disfrutarla no esta al alcance de cualquiera, quizÃ¡s mas adelante se haga un parche para traducirla pero hasta entonces depende de los lectores aficionados al manga y anime, sin embargo he de decir que es un cambio agradable que contradice la elevada cantidad de clichÃ©s de que los videojuegos solo deben ser violentos o competitivos.
A mi parecer este juego es interesante, los personajes son complejos y te atraen de manera que es fÃ¡cil sumergirse en una historia profunda llena de sentimentalismos, la banda sonora es la adecuada en cada momento, solo con oÃ­rla ya puedes soÃ±ar y desear no dar click para poder oÃ­rla mas tiempo.    Este juego podrÃ­a ser un buen comienzo para que el extenso mercado japones consiga llegar a occidente de una manera mas fÃ¡cil y rÃ¡pida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094032398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1464400572}
review: I highly recommend this game to anyone. The story is melancholy and touching as it takes you into the lives of a young man and woman who are diagnosed with terminal illnesses. The game touches on lifes value, acceptance of death, and the willingness to let it all go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077102529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1412326385}
review: LOVE THIS

author: {'steamid': '76561198068085052', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1497680395}
review: Not a fan of visual novels at all. But I would still recommend Narcissu as an almost perfect, heart wrenching and tear jerking, yet inspiring and at times exciting and joyful story of multiple themes; how hard it is to let someone/something you love so much go, at the same time as how hard it is to hold onto something you know you can't keep; not letting circumstances, people, or the world in general make decisions for you; and the difference between simply not being dead and actually being alive.  I was extremely moved by the story in the base game, and cannot recommend it more, especially considering it's free.  The 10th anniversary pack also has very good content, and I would also recommend that.  Music is very nice and adds to the emotional impact the story has.  I could not recommend this story more, please try it out :')

author: {'steamid': '76561198102681550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1634139991}
review: This is an amazing game. I have played many Japanese Galgames and this game brings me the first feeling of a true situation: the meaning of the death and life. This is amazing, in my opinion, galgame is just a type of game that meet a girl and have a nice love story. However this game shows me another spirit, I feel very sad when I knew the girl's death but after that I still thinking. The girl isn't happy when she alive and the only thing she want in this hopeless world is just a scene of flowers.When she really came to there, I think she has already gain the value of her life though it is a very short and painful life. At last she committed suicide but I think she must do this with a bright smile. So this is a wonderful meaning game. If you like a story with the meaning of life, if you are a painful and hopeless patient like the girl, or if you want to commit suicide, I strongly recommend you to play this game. This game will help you find the meaning of your life and help you to gain your own value of your life. Before you die, why not play this game first and find something that can really move you?

review:
Beautiful ... well,my English is poor,so don't know how to  describe this game with other words.
As you see,this is a free game,but it doesn't mean it's not a valuable game to play.
I used to play this game in Chinese,now Englishi version,had to say the art of language is amazing,same line in different language will give you different feelings.
The clean picture and character design leave me a deep impressions,and so the Ending has provide much material for thought.
By the way,the soundtrack is worth to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092147449', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1543946059}
review:
Lovely, albeit sad, visual novel with a good plot,and wonderful sound track.
This is a story about a girl whose life ended long before her last breath, and about a guy whose life is about to be interrupted. The story is about a guy who wants to live, and the story of a girl who wants to die.
10/10 Awesome game, please, stop my tears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058692990', 'num_games_owned': 1291, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1401755323}
review: Incredibly depressing, especially if you've had a friend or family member with a terminal illness. that said, it's very well written, but I wouldn't recommend playing in one sitting. best played in small sessions, since it can have a very powerful psychological effect. It keeps you [strike] playing [/strike] reading but leaves you feeling horrible afterwards. Not for the faint of heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086249854', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 72519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1688050441}
review:
For the very first time N1&2 looks like some slides of pictures integrated with simple words to illustrate an ordinary story which might happen all around and all the time all over the world but if you take a close observation on this <video> game, you would possibly discover some more than just a grieving and unfortunate story that you've watched for the first sight. It does require some more patience to watch, to read, to reflect upon the words in this video before you can eventually grasp its intelligibility. Also the BGM mainly played by piano (if there're other instrumental facilities included you can point them out 'coz I'm not good at this) goes perfectly well with the plot, absolutely brilliant and impressive. 

Plot: 9/10
music: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026753348', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1431648640}
review:
I played through both games in a single night; starting with 1st and ending with 2nd. Narcissu is beautifully written, and the story flows brilliantly, with a recurring melancholic theme of vain hope and the acceptance of fate. I loved it and would highly recommend it to anyone, especially if you are considering getting into VNs.
Oh, and the soundtrack is pretty good too! And it's free, so you have no excuses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113327887', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1448816698}
review:
Vamos a ver, antes de empezar con la crÃ­tica tengo que poner en su sitio a los otros anÃ¡lisis en espaÃ±ol. Â¿Acaso es normal NO recomendar un juego porque no es una novela visual interactiva?
Â¿No es lo normal informarse antes de descargar el "juego"?
EstÃ¡ claro que a mÃ¡s de uno no se le pasÃ³ por la cabeza eso.
ESTO NO ES UN JUEGO. ES UNA NOVELA VISUAL, Y SI NO TE GUSTAN LAS NOVELAS VISUALES, NO SÃ‰ QUE HACES AQUÃ.

Ahora que hemos dejado claro esto pasemos a la review.

No solo cuenta con la primera parte de la historia, llamada Narcissu, sino que tambiÃ©n cuenta con su segunda ediciÃ³n, (casualmente es una precuela de lo que sucediÃ³ en la primera historia.)
Ya he terminado la primera parte y ahora estoy terminando la segunda. Y la verdad es que tengo que decir algunas cosas al respecto.


1- Narcissu 1, hasta el momento me ha parecido mucho mÃ¡s dramÃ¡tico, interesante y con una historia mÃ¡s profunda. (Si bien yo juguÃ© la versiÃ³n mal traducida al espaÃ±ol que hizo la experiencia de juego mucho peor, la versiÃ³n en inglÃ©s si que es pasable.)
2- No esperÃ©is un eroge ni nada por el estilo. Es ambas historias se narra la vida de jÃ³venes enfermos, que pasan su tiempo en la sÃ©ptima planta de un hospital, esperando a que en algÃºn momento les llegue la hora, pero a ninguno de ellos les interesa morir en un lugar tan tÃ©trico o en su propia casa, (la historia parte desde este punto, obviamente.)
3- La narraciÃ³n es correcta en todo momento y en muy pocas ocasiones se hace cargada.
4- Una banda sonora tan simple como magistral. Perfecta en cada momento y que por mucho que se lleguen a repetir algunos soundtrakcs nunca me cansarÃ© de oÃ­r.
ConclusiÃ³n:

A los pocos que estÃ¡n dispuestos a jugar en inglÃ©s a una novela visual sin interacciÃ³n. (Gente que hable espaÃ±ol debe haber muy poca interesada); pues le dirÃ­a que jugara solo la primera parte. Ya que es la mÃ¡s interesante, dramÃ¡tica y buena de las dos. Si se le da una oportunidad seguro que no decepciona.

Si querÃ©is que califique esto como un juego, obviamente le pondrÃ­a un 0, pero como no lo es, no puedo hacerlo.

Como novela visual, tal y como es, le pondrÃ­a un 8.5/10
(Ojo, a la primera parte, a la segunda un 6.5/10, ya que el argumento decae de manera notable.)

En fin, he intentado ser lo mÃ¡s objetivo posible sin tener en cuenta de que se trata de mi novela visual favorita.

Nota:

No he visto ni un sÃ³lo anÃ¡lisis negativo que muestre verdaderas razones del porquÃ© es mala esta novela visual. Me ha hecho gracia, Â¿acaso nadie puede expresarse correctamente?

author: {'steamid': '76561198095298892', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1411825597}
review:
To say that this is a game, i would be wrong.
To say that this doesn't hit my feeling and makes me sad, i would be wrong too.

Narcissu is a Kinetic Novel (interactive book with pictures and voice acting) about a patient named Setsumi that is about to die in a hospital. The story pace is really slow so you could be bored, but when you started to connect to the story and feel Setsumi and all other people feelings in the novel, you would be sucked in the.. uhhmm.. feel train.
It might not be for everyone, but if you like to read or really like a good story telling you would love this story. And possibly cry or at least sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030169739', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1406377532}
review:
There are two kinds of people who read this story:
Those who cry
And those who are soulless monsters

10/10 liek dis if u cri eerytiem ;_;



Seriously though. This story will give you a much deeper appreciation for the value of life. Which, in turn, will make you question if you're properly spending your life. Or if you're wasting it. And if you ARE wasting any of it, Setsumi's plight will make you feel horribly guilty for it.
...At least it did that to me...
And if you are Christian, it will reawaken your sense of urgency about sharing the Gospel...

review:
So this is a Visual Novel, not a game at all.
But its good like really good, the writing is nice and the story is deep like really deep Mariana Trench deep.
Be prepared to be confronted with despair, like real hopelessnes. If you are up for a ride like that, I really hope you brace yourself because the "feels" as they are known are with this novel.

Also the chronological order is 2 then 1, yup prequels with confusing names :P

And for the love of god (ignore the heresy) its for free so give it a try.

review: Very touching and sad story at the same time other then that its a excellent story I'd give the story for this VN a 5/5 the visuals a 4/5 audio 5/5 note that for the audio I'm only rating the music part I don't speak Japanese so it be a waste to rate some thing I can't understand a word of. The 2nd 1 was the best out of the 2 it had the most detail out of the 2, and it had the better storyline and though not by much better artwork in my opinion. Both had a really good story don't get me wrong both were touching and sad but the 2nd had more detail so it for that reason is the better of the 2 in my opinion. Also if you want to really understand whats going on in the 1st read the 2nd before the 1st the 2nd is the background story for the 1st.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059096697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1405902184}
review:
Narcissu and Narcissu Side 2nd are two short indie visual novels about residents of the 7th floor of an hospital. However, those residents aren't only sick; they cannot be cured, and so they wait for death to take them.

With such a premise, you can easily tell the story will make you shed some tears, and trust me it will. It is a sad, but incredibly beautiful, journey, which makes me recommend it wholeheartedly. Also, while there aren't that many songs in the soundtrack, they all are beautiful and really add to the atmosphere and emotions of the story.

On a more technical standpoint, both Narcissu and Narcissu Side 2nd are quite short VNs (completed both aswell as the epilogue in 9.3 hours) in which there aren't any choices to make. Some might say this lack of any gameplay mechanics is a bad thing, but in my opinion it allows you to stay focused, if not immerged, in the story.

The only things I might complain about would be the few mistakes in the text, the sometimes confusing syntax (though I understand the goal of the translators, as described in the translators' notes), and the rather small pictures and text-box.

All in all, Narcissu and Narcissu Side 2nd are really worth the time reading in my opinion, even more so considering they are free. Give them a try, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046235360', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1398500524}
review: Let me start off with saying that if you are not into Visual Novels then don't play this at all. This isn't exactly a long story, but nonetheless I was compelled by its' story. The OST is pretty good, and I would say the main theme in this story is death. Without giving out too many details; the story follows our main characters on the verge of death. They don't want to die in a sad setting such as the hospital, and as if to defy fate they run away; seeking something more out of their dwindling life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010076353', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1405181780}
review:
ive played it really briefly, stuck at ep 4. Why i publish a bad review? Well let's be honest its a free vn and i do see alot of reasons why it is so.

1. the storyline is boring, after watching plenty of drama animes it just does not apply to me at all. scenario is just poor.
2. scenes are repeating, some of arent picked according to what characters are actually doing, there is a scene where 2 of em are driving a car and suddenly there is a picture where character is looking thru the hospital window and the text under it is still connected to the actuall driving so its no story rollback.
3. dialogues are rather poor
4. second main character is "all knowing" even tho she spent her whole life in hospital... riiiiight that's very viable lol.
5. dialogues are repeatable and perdictiable
6. music quality is very very poor
7. voice acting is very limited, would be good if there was none.

The only good thing about that novel is calm and fitting music, unluckily for me music is as said before rather harsh quality.

That said a big NO for me and i wish author to continue his/her's hard work and deliver something better in a future.

8. i almost forgot, characters are supposed to be 22~ and some older yet pictures shows person that looks like 12 at best... seriously?

author: {'steamid': '76561198019143680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1405740810}
review:
A truly beautiful and heart-rending experience, Narcissu is a visual novel that everyone should pick up and play at least once. You'll find yourself compulsively clicking through the engaging and impeccably written dialogue, rabid with the desire to learn what comes next. The OST also compliments the game beautifully, with each and every track bringing a new, intense feeling to an already startlingly emotional story.

If you like visual novels, have heard of visual novels, or are just looking for something to read and look at, Narcissu is a great choice, and with the extremely appealing price tag of $0.00, you really have no excuse for not picking up this gem. Take a few hours off and experience the ride of a lifetime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058428357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1405707698}
review:
Narcissu 1st and 2nd is a beautiful story based around the sufferings of patients. The first installment is based in the future of the series, whereas the second is an almost "prologue". The 1st is based on two characters, a 22 year old woman and a 20 year old man, both residing in the level 7 of an unnamed hospital. The way they interreact and the emotions I got from this installment were amazing and pure. The 2nd is the story of the 22 year old woman, set around the time she was first admitted to the hospital. 

This series uses slow tension and the reinforcment of facts and tones to help build a breathtaking story, and I would reccomend it to any and everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020320483', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 7031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6570, 'last_played': 1434991396}
review:
To describe a story as "emotional" isn't necessarily a good thing. However, although [i]Narcissu[/i] certainly does invoke strong emotions, it does so in all the right ways. Despite the melancholic nature of the tale, you will want to keep reading to find out more about the characters and their situation.

There are no choices to make in this visual novel. Just sit back, relax, and enjoy reading this wonderful story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058653037', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1403912416}
review:
(Spoilers ahead)

Narcissu is an unavoidable story. It's the only way it could ever happen. But this isn't enough. What I always wanted to say is, Setsumi wouldn't have it another way. She would travel with someone to a place where there are Narcissus and she would kill herself, drowning in the sea.

But this isn't (only) because she wanted so. She knew every escape route, she had saved money, she specifically stated she didn't want to die neither at home nor at the hospital. What's the protagonist's role, then, since he's but a witness in all this process?

This is what I couldn't decipher. True, Setsumi can't drive, but as aforementioned, she could very well take the train. She knew where she wanted to go, she knew how she wanted to die. Yet, the story was written in such a way that you just had to be there.

Both you and the protagonist know or at least have a clue that she's coaxing you into taking her to her desired place with all her "not particularly..." catch phrase instances. There's a dissonance here too, between you and the protagonist. You are presented to her circumstances before you are presented to his. Both had possessions, albeit not particularly important ones, stripped away from them - he had the license, she had (or was going to have) the swimsuit. So when she says she doesn't particularly want a swimsuit, you know exactly what it means to her. It's a moment of joy, to see her playing in the water. A moment of closure.

...But closure of what, really?

See, we never get to know which condition Setsumi really bears. Her symptoms were specifically described as not to give away what she suffers from so that we have no idea when she is going to die. She's in a stasis. There's no story happening, but there is her desire for a story, for this specific story to happen. To sum it up, her existence is floating, adrift. Waiting for a current to take her to the fate she wants to fulfill, but can't. Or, rather, it's that she isn't capable of swimming. The current is you, the protagonist and the silver coupÃ©.

This is why we get involved, bid her farewell in a noncommittal yet passionate way. To bring her to her suicide was our job and it's all we can do. We're merely observers, but also the only ones who could ever do what had to be done.

Setsumi is a narcissus flower. We're nothing but the wind, taking it to the sea, where it will never grow.

review:
This VN is a linear ,bittersweet tragedy about how a boy and a girl struggle in the face of despair seeking to control over the fate of last few days of their lives .The soundtrack is amazing ,wouldnt believe it's a doujin game if not for the graphic(not the artwork,just the technical level). 8.5/10 Heartbreaking story , and even if you dont have time for reading the story,the soundtrack is enough of a reason to download this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198043642419', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1403534161}
review:
Yo siempre fui una persona bastante prejuiciosa, capaz tendria que ver mÃ¡s alla de lo que se ve a simple vista...

Consegui este juego por la pagina FogFx, de Taringa, donde se enseÃ±a a conseguir juegos gratuitos, este juego salto un dia, y yo pense "Bah, otro jueguito Anime de mierda" (Como diria siempre, ya que no me gusta el Anime, exceptuando a algunos ejemplos) y luego "Bue, igual, es otro para mi biblioteca"
Tras tenerlo unos cuantos meses, estaba ayer a la noche en mi habitacion, y el Internet no llegaba bien (Como siempre), me puse a mirar los juegos que tenia, y entonces lo vi, estaba ahi, en medio de otros juegos, esperando a ser probado.
Cuando termine de leer el capitulo 1, ya estaba llorando. Y por cosas como esta, hasta me haria Otaku.

Que les puedo decir sobre Narcissu? Narcissu es una Novela o Aventura grafica Japonesa, esta muy bien narrada, y su traduccion es bastante buena, las canciones que le pusieron son tambien excelentes, y vienen justo al caso para la lectura de esta gran aventura, todavia me falta leer el 2nd, pero estoy seguro que estara bueno. La historia es muy triste, habla de gente que espera para morir, y como consiguen hacer que esos ultimos minutos de vida valgan.

Ademas, esta Gratis, venga, no veo razon para no darle una oportunidad, si te gustan las historias tanto como a mi, o eres un seguidor del casi extinto genero de la Novela Grafica, bajatelo, ponte unos auriculares, y comienza.

>Steam no guardo mis estadisticas de juego porque lo jugue en Modo Offline

author: {'steamid': '76561198129927684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1403673451}

I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999009276', 'num_games_owned': 1343, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1403506577}
review:
I've played a decent amount of visual novels in my time. In my time of playing them I've never really encountered a story that hit me as hard as this one did. It's a beautiful story that is not terribly long, and is definitely well worth your time. It includes both the original Narcissu, and it's prequel, Side 2nd. Both are incredible stories.The soundtrack is perfectly fitting. My only real complaint would be the narrow visual style can get kind of hard to look at after awhile, but it is visually distinctive and does look nice. I should note as well that you don't get to make choices in this like other visual novels, but as mentioned previously, the story it gives you is astounding.

All in all, it's a free visual novel and it is well worth a few hours of your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088454440', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1404435723}
review: It's a really good VN from what I have played so far. The story seems well developed and the scenery, accompanied by the music, is very heart warming when it needs to and sad aswell. I'd gladly play this over a couple a times and get into the story more. Voices are great aswell when playing on the "Voiced" setting. However one complaint I have is the cutting of music and chapters into different sections. I just wish the transitions could be a better, but that's about it. 9/10 in my opinion :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039524706', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1398573837}
review:
This gam- it's not really a game, in the traditional sense. Again. Skip straight to the bottom for the TL;DR version.

This is a visual novel style "game" and if you don't like clicking and reading and doing ONLY that, avoid this game at all costs. 

If, however, you enjoy a good story AND don't mind the lack of interaction, play this game, and/or read on. Mild spoilers follow.

This visual novel talks about suicide rates and the somewhat personal pain the young, terminally ill go through, pain transcending the physical realm, coming to hurt you right in your head and heart. The story is well crafted and, while the ending was not unexpected, the message it was trying to deliever was solid, clear and strong. If you have had a friend who was terminally ill (I did) this "game" speaks volumes. As I said, however, do NOT play this game if you do not intend or like to read lines of text over and over and over and - you get what I mean. In games, this would be the tedious "clicker" genre, only with nice story. While Narcissu has a great story, personally interaction within this genre is still dominated by "To The Moon", which, by the way, you should play.

TL;DR: play this game if you like story and don't mind lots of somewhat useless clicking, otherwise, avoid at ALL costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084628792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1404021580}
review:
A true-to-life visual novel simulating real-life crisis, depression, torment, and sadness.  Told in 2 parts, Narcissu 1st and Narcissu 2nd (which actually narrates the events that occurred before Narcissu 1st) both bring out the feels in you.  You will not only come to feel that you are just someone who is filled with anguis, pain, and hopelessness after being diagnosed with life-ending disease but worse than that is experiencing the loss of the love and acknowledgement of your very existence as a homo-sapien by the people who are very close to you or those that share a special bond with you.  

You may choose from many translations and having the characters be either voiced or unvoiced which is very nice.  The art style is very minimalistic but is quite effective in portraying the setting and conveying the concurrent mood to the reader.  The audio tracks are also excellent and noticeably alters the ambient setting in a dynamic fashion to which later events may be foreshadowed when combined with powerful imagery.  Both novels are broken up into chapters which also make it very easy to locate and resume from the last checkpoint; and not mentioning a save function that allows continuation from any point in a chapter.  The cream of the crop in terms of enriching user experience, in this review at least, is having the ability to auto-advance text with no manual mouse-clicking necessary.

All-in-all you can be sure to possibly shed a few tears along the way--so prepare some cleanex before you dive in. Even if you arent easily perturbed, emotionally-wise, you can still be surprised by how the novel project its powerful elements upon you to a resounding degree which easily invoke feelings of sentiment for the character.  it is, in essence, very touching text-wrapped journey that recounts the tale of a girl who is passionate about cars and her tireless endeavours in seeking true freedom and the gift of life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065869922', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1405228773}
review:
"Right in the feels. Well worth the free download." - Me

Anyways... my gosh this is an amazng story. I felt connected to the character, and I had yet to see her face. 15 minutes in, I already was halfway to tears. This is the most sad "game" I have ever played. This isn't an interactive game, it's more of a narrative, and a damn good one at that.

I don't want to give any spoilers of the story, because every single word captures your attention, and you are glued to the screen for the first 3 chapters...then you turn the game off 'cus you dont want to start crying. But basically, the story is about a girl who at a very young age is striken withh illness, and has to spend 2/3 of her waking life in the hospital. when she is a young high-school student, she has very few, if any, friends left from her youth. se wakes up one morning after a driving test to a searing pain in her chest, and it's back to the hospital for a while :( . She is given a very fancy room on a new floor sh hasnt been on before; she gets the room to herself (as opposed to regular rooms in Japanese hospitals which have 5-8 people in them), it has a nice lounge, big open ceilings... th windows dont open... the nurses don't walk through... oh my lord. They are leaving her to die :'(... and thats where I will stop telling you.

So far, and I havent gotten all the way through the story, its an 11/10. Absolute masterpeice of story telling. The music is amazing too. As for the game play... like I said, it's not a game.

review:
A simple yet lovely visual novel that holds true to the developer's vision: whether to have or not to have. It's a pure visual novel that paints an image with words, emotion, and sound. Beautiful heart-wrenching stories that I enjoyed the English translation of the stories. If you enjoy audio, short stories, and/or visual novels, I highly recommend. It's simply amazing to pass up, I think. 

By and by, the first story will always get me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096381617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1415414614}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070718528', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1403914467}
review:
A free visual novel. Narcissu has no real desicion points and mostly shows only pictures of the scenery in this visual novel, but I have personally taken a liking to the soundtracks in this game.
As for the story, it's certainly capable of making you feel something for these characters as they carry on throughout the last days of their lives in Narcissu 1st. Narcissu 2nd side may not be -as- depressing as the first, but still delivers the feels every now and then~
If you're mostly interested in the story, capable of dealing with tearing up once in awhile, and fine with a visual novel that isn't always going to provide top-knotch visuals around every single corner, I certainly recommend this free visual novel game.
It's certainly a try if you like decent stories.

review: This will be my first ever steam review! Whoooo! or should a say "Boooo" In the case of this one? Anyway, i love the story of setsumi so much that i don't want to read the second part in fear of something ruining it. Really, i could tell that the writer went at his own pace and made it the way HE wanted it. Didn't concern himself with engaging the auidence, just telling the story he wanted to tell. To me, thats how a story should be told and this is a great example of why. Wholeheartily give this a 10/10 without the slightest reservation!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012900200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1402202351}
review:
A visual novel about two young people with terminal lung cancer who join together for one last trip through Japan.

A story about inevitable death, its acceptance and the worth of life.

(For those of you who only go for achievements. They are broken)

author: {'steamid': '76561198126434485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1401935300}
review: I wasnt really sure about this story i get the they didnt have much emotion because they knew they were going to die but it could have had more of a attachment from character and viewer. No spoilers but the end of the story was just a slight end. Its sad to know that no matter what they did they were going to die but i guess thats life. Thank you for a well made story. i wish i was more sad for a characters death but i was just upset at the idea of two girls knowing they're fate.  I was expecting more of a Clannad experience but it was special in its own way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030689094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1429841397}
review: It is difficult to write a review for Narcissu 1& 2 as it is not a game nor is it completely a visual novel with branching choices; it is more so what people call a â€œkinetic novelâ€.  While the player has little control over what is happening on the screen, as they can only move forward with the plot, I however have never been more engrossed into a story on screen.  Everything from the minimal visuals and the hauntingly memorable soundtrack all helps the player in being attached to this depressingly beautiful plot full of heartache, death, meaning, and life.  I encourage everyone to try this out; I strongly believe anyone who experiences this VN will come out as a better person with a new appreciation for life.  Best of all, it is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022262933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2896, 'last_played': 1402099056}
review:
Narcissu is... really quite hard to describe with words alone. The story is fantastic in the most depressing and sorrowful way. As you progress through the experience you will travel on a journey of emotions; hope, despair, joy... along with the characters. Anyone who enjoys deep feeling stories, whether they be books, anime, or any other medium will greatly enjoy being placed into deep depression by this VN.

- Oh... the 64 hours is because I left it open during a work week >_>

review: Worth taking a nice play through at. Was playing this and found myself through an old classic VN. What I believe will kind of settle in is it's own pace but if you play through the top of it, it will make you think and enjoy it. I'd recommend it because of it obviously being free and the story has some sort of compelling elements that if you think about give it an above average addition. I'd give it a 4.8/5. Either way it has it's own way of enveloping something to you. At times it seems like there is a little boredom but it's like a book, the more you read into it, the more of a feel you get. What kinda threw out at me was the placement. It got me a bit sentimental to be honest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973612806', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1479984440}
review:
Get ready for a feel trip. 

This is an absolutely incredible, heartwrenchingly beautiful story. You know the ending, but it's about the journey.

Despite this not being a gamer per-say, it is an amazing piece of art. I've only finished the first part (the main story), and will try to update this when I finish the second (the prequal), but there is a lot of content. If you like anime and manga I highly recommend this. You will get lost in the world and story for several hours, even if you have it set to autoplay and just read along without clicking anything. And the soundtrack! The soundtrack is phenominal! Go through this at night and just relax and let yourself be brought into the world. 

I do have to say though, there was a downside, but I'm pretty sure this is just because it's in early access, which is totally understandable. There was however, at least for me, so not sure if it wasn't loading properly or the whole early access thing, but there is a lot of times throughout the story when no accompanying picture will appear with the text and you'll be stuck with just a grey or white block on your screen. Didn't bother me too much, definitely not the worst thing ever, but the artwork is just amazing and so well done that it really does add to the atmosphere and story. 

I got totally dragged in by this. First visual novel I've read, and I loved it! You'll lose yourself for hours in this world. 
9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197982972936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1401193416}
review:
Narcissu is one of the best Visual Novels I've ever played, which is odd because it lacks a staple feature of the genre in having no choices.Reading the author's notes he states that he wanted this VN to flow like a movie and have good pacing which really adds to it more than it takes away. The story has more meaning behind it than just tear-jerking/FEELS, and the minimalistic art makes you feel like your a bystander listening in instead of looking at talking heads for hours. After playing both Narcissu 1 and 2, I feel that 1 has a better story and has a stronger experience behind it, but 2 is better produced and has a sadder story. Narcissu 2nd definitely makes you feel for Setsumi more in part 1, and gives you some insight into how she feels.

      I think I should mention that the author states in the notes he would like people to play 2nd before 1st because it's the chronological order. I personally played 1st before 2nd as I played 1st when it was first translated by insani a few years ago. But it definitely would probably be a more powerful experience if you played 2nd before 1st, knowing what happens kind of gave me a weird feeling, it's hard to explain, but I think it would make the 1st game an even greater experience if you had the build up of 2nd still in your mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136840747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1431679760}
review:
Narcissu is the first visual novel I've played. It has different vibes than the other visual novels. The game's words are really filled with something I can't say so myself. I know that it's just a visual novel game filled with only text or word--but keep in mind; words are enough to express itself.

I really do recommend this novel to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044995440', 'num_games_owned': 774, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1400705623}
review: The feels, man, the feels. This is by far, the sadest game I've have ever played in my life. (And 1 of my favorite games.) This game should have been the most played game in the world (Not Leauge of Lesbians.) due to the impact it has on the player. It has a loveable character that sadly dies in the end. It has the best story I've had ever read. It also has the most sadest soundtrack in Video Game history. Graphics: 10/10. Story: 10/10. Everything else: 10/10. I highly recommend this game to everybody so they can feel the feels I have feeled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041494528', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1400276599}
review:
Due to several reasons, Friday nights are an important time for me, and I have a tradition of trying to get myself overdosed with emotions at least once during each of those. This task had become easier ever since I'd discovered visual novels, and I can assure you that Narcissu did the job this last Friday.
It's a beautiful short story accompanied by an equally beautiful soundtrack. If you're looking for some feels, certainly do give Narcissu a shot. I was shedding tears near the end of it. (I'm not a very manly kind of person so I guess I'm not the best example, but the point still stands xD.  ...Kinda.)

P.S - I've only read the first one so far, so this review is only aimed for it. Additionally, I didn't read it on Steam, because by the time I discovered Narcissu was on Steam I was already close to finishing it on my non-Steam version, but I imagine there isn't much difference. I read Insani's translation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969656365', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1400430913}
review:
Narcissu is a classic amongs Visual Novels.

This is the story of a guy being terminally ill. Once admitted into the hospital he meets another patient, Setsumi. She is, like him, going to die. However, both of them want to die somewhere else than in the hospital. They will escape, and travel through a few prefectures of Japan. This is their story. Up until the very end.

Do not expect this story to be any kind of funny. This is very emotionnal and you might probably cry. The storytelling is good enough. Two differents translations are available, and you can choose to activate the voices or not.
I read this visual novel a long time ago. Voices and episode 2 were not available at the time.

I do strongly recommend this "game" to anyone wanting to try the Visual Novel genre. This VN, is linear and there are no choices. No interactivity. Technically, this is a subgenre of Visual Novel called a Kinetic Novel. You just read. And do nothing else. Narcissu is however very minimalistic. There are not many pictures compared to other visual novels. Please do not be rebuked, and read, immerse yourself in the story. Like you would for any good book.

This is very close to reading a comic book, except you have music, voice and -- sometimes -- animated pictures. You have to experience at least one visual novel in your life, the same way you should play an RTS or FPS if you havenâ€™t done so. This genre is not well known enough, it's kinda sad.
A lot of other visual novels exists and are masterpieces. This is a good start for anyone not knowing what this media is.

Since Narcissu is Free, do not miss this opportunity, and try it. You will hate it or love it. But, you have to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019258617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1407917056}
review:
First of all, this is a book, a novel.  This is not a game where you have choices, and those choices will influence the ending.

As a litmus test on whether you will enjoy Narcissu or not, imagine yourself picking up a book at a bookstore.  The "About this game" section is the back of the book and the pictures are the front cover of the book.  If you like it and want to continue reading, go on and download the game.  More likely than not, you will enjoy the game.  If not, then you should move on.

This game has a very beautiful soundtrack that nicely complements the story, which adds to the whole experience.   It is something that you can't find in paperback novels.  So if you enjoy reading novels but never tried visual novels, give Narcissu a try : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198055508221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1400154401}
review:
I've finished Narcissu 1,2 and 3 before 1 and 2 even got green-lit. Tomo Kataoka did a great job for it. Hopefully this will make people read more visual novels. I see this as an opportunity for more visual novel titles to be up here.

The story was beautifully written and it wasn't in any case forced drama. What I like about this visual novel is it's story is feels almost in touch with reality and not something that is far-fetched. One might think otherwise but it has a natural feel about it. The OST used was also rather smooth and it did great enhancing the mood and atmosphere of the story as it progress. I don't know how well the translations were but Tomo Kataoka did a good job. I hope the translators who translate this don't pull down the quality. It's simply a masterpiece, something not many visual novels could achieve. I for one, recommend this visual novel for visual novel readers. Unless you dislike nakige and utsuge, this visual novel should be a very good read. It isn't very long either so it should be picked up even if one doesn't have loads of spare time as this visual novel is considerably shorter than other visual novels.

I don't want to post any spoilers so I shan't say much about how the story is but I truly recommend this visual novel. I was expecting some tears to flow since this is a nakige and utsuge but I almost never cried anywhere harder. This visual novel took that emotion to a whole new level, something not many visual novel/anime can do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068706307', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1418540718}
review:
This is about a bunch of people that their future are closed. How they are struggling to keep smiling even though their heart is in pain, knowing that they will gone forever. How they spent the rest of their time. And how they pass the rules.

Narcissu's gameplay is simple. Just sit back, relax, and enjoy each of the scene (or words perhaps?) in this game. There's no choice selection so you don't need a walkthrough for it.

I totally recommend Narcissu. Why? Because the story of course!!
I won't spoil the full story for you so you need to play it yourself (even though i spoil it a little in the first paragraph :p)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044418298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1400041083}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074454674', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1485802070}
review: One of the best storys i have ever read hands down. touching and sad. you realy get to know the charecters well and when you finish the story its likely that you will want more ive read through this once before and i still want more. I would recomend this to anyone who likes sad storys the only problem i had was there were a few drawings in the first side that could have been more well drawn as you can see by the later pictures of the people. but other than that amazing story i honestly for one cried at the end. 9.9/10 the 9.9 is only because of those picutres but if they were drawn beter defenitly 10/10 its realy the story that makes the novel not the pictures when you get down to it. On top of all of that ITS FREE! no paying and being disipointed. If you hate sad storys from the bottom of your heart look somewere else but alot of people could enjoy this. this is a good story for when you are just looking for a way for when your bored to kill time and relax. maybe shed a few tears depending on the person. For all you people hating on it on how its not a game. it says Visual Novel in the tags. if you were looking for a game dont download something that has Visual novel in the tags or you will be disipointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029726507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1399119144}
review:
Narcissu is a Kinetic Novel - essentially something like reading a novel on the computer, only with music, voicing and background music. It's also considered an 'Utsuge', which basically means it has an incredibly heartwrenching story.

Now, onto the game itself. Without spoilers, by the end of it, you will feel for characters, the music is beautiful, while the amount art is lacking, I personally find that it adds to the themes of the game.

This isn't considered an 'Utsuge' for nothing, however. Excepting those with cold hearts of stone, you will feel sad, you may likely even cry. Though, this is far from a bad thing, and it has some pretty thought provoking themes such as, without spoiling too much, the fate of those with no place in society and suicide.

It is quite short read, it only took me a few hours to complete. So if you're looking for a short, yet powerful read, and aren't afraid to shed some manly(or womanly) tears, then by all means try this out. I can all but guarantee you will not regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076870468', 'num_games_owned': 9809, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1399873273}
review:
With just around 2 hours put into it...I feel like I've just barely scratched the surface of Narcissu...

I didn't really know what to expect going into this at all, despite the many reviews that are about this.  I admit it took a little bit to get into the story...and I'm really just on the first episode, or really what feels like an introduction.  But maybe 10-15 min I just got hooked and couldn't stop reading.  Looking at some of the other people and the time with this title I feel like I have a long way to go...and frankly, I'm excited.

The story telling felt awkward at first but when I realized it was like a manga but needing to visualize the majority myself (there are plenty of story card images to help along the way)...I just fell straight into the story and got hooked.

The imagery mentioned above is simple and at times hazy...which I feel like is a connection to the characters themselves.

And the music...probably one of my favorites parts of this thus far.  The music is probably the biggest part of the whole package to me and just the ride I end up taking sinking myself into the depths the music can take me while the characters figure out what they really want of the lives they have...

I really can't wait to get into it more, but I feel like I need to keep watch over myself else I'll lose the time and put myself into a bad situation, especially if I get into more of it late at night. lol...

As I've mentioned before, I'm just on Narcissu 1st right now and maybe 7 or 8 chapters in.  I have no idea how long 1st is...nor an inkling of 2nd, but I can't wait to see where they all go...

If 2nd is actually a prequel and 1st is the main story like one review says...maybe I should have started that way, but I think I'll finish 1st since I've just dove into that anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103659644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1399872493}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066339830', 'num_games_owned': 4107, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1527201086}
review:
Another brilliant Visual Novel with touching, well written story. Narcissu shows that even text can convey the deepest of the emotion.

To play the 'game', you need to sit back, relax, click thru the dialogues slowly and enjoy it. Just don't forget to occassionally save so you won't bang your head against the wall if your machine magically crashes and you need to restart the story all over again.

Replayability is zero. Once you finish once, that's all you need to do. Except if you want to recall the story later.

As an Early Access, Narcissu is pretty much done and polished - except for blank so-called Achievements - and most importantly it's completely translated into English. I'm surprised they didn't charge a dime for this on Steam.

The only purchasable DLC here is OSTs. While I don't own the DLC myself, it's been said that the quality of the OSTs are FLAC, pretty much what we expect nowadays (who likes lossy MP3s now?). Even so, I can vet for the quality of the OSTs in-game, it's very memorable and deep, perfectly blend into the story and I can fully recommend this set for your listening pleasure.

All in all, it's a free stuff with great presentation and story that you can finish in one sitting (at least for each part). Well worth your time. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088125697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1405740836}

author: {'steamid': '76561198132118002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1399865887}
review:
Narcissu 1st & 2nd, first of all, is a short story and not a game. In keeping with true Japanese style if you want to follow the story chronologically you should read part 2 first as it explains how the two main characters come to meet. Part 1, however, is the heart of the story but is also resoundingly bittersweet, so be warned. 

You follow along on their journey to find one last moment of meaning in an otherwise fated existence. The voice-over is not complete but when present adds a unique connection to an already emotion packed dialogue. It is, however, the soft keening of the somber soundtrack that accompanies each backdrop that will make this story one to remember.

review: Whenever a game is available for free I take notice. This game wasn't what I nor, anyone can expect. The game is a long novel in the beggining appearing as a monolouge. The crisp an overwhealming sound is breath taking throughout the read of the novel. The novel wasn't the greatest part to me as I'm not a big book reader but, the sound track makes the freebie worth even more of the while. Definitely while its free download it.  The only cons i must add is, 1. Achivements are locked in beta. and 2. Final chapter is blocked if not done in sequential order. Any ways ill be fair yet crutial I give the game/"novel" an 8/10.

review: now before you blast me let me say why i don't recommend this. while the story is pretty good and the soundtrack as well it lacks a critical prt that any game no matter the genre needs: interactivity. even a good visual novel has some level of interactivity.you can just click through the thing only pausing for chapter changes. this is a good story that would likely be better off as an anime, manga or book or movie. but unless this game gets some interactivity it shall unfortanetly be marked as a bad game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021339494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1399267792}
review:
I actually never heard of this Visual novel before i saw it on steam; I saw it on Greenlight, and I voted for it (mainly because I am a HUGE visual novel fan; even to the point of adding Katawa Shoujo to my non-steam steam games). I saw it finally was released and decided to download it immediately. I then sat down and beat the 1st 'side'; and decided to write my review (also apologies if it is vague, I wanted to avoid spoilers, and this is my first in depth review I wrote). 

This visual novel is quite amazing in my opinion; it really brought emotion out of me, something most movies, games, and books cannot do (although there have been one or two games and books, and a handful of movies).

There aren't too many images used, but what images are used are amazing looking, and are very beautiful. The dialog is very descriptive, and it is translated amazingly. 

The music score/soundtrack to this game is just as amazing as the rest of this visual novel; it fits in perfectly, and both sets and amplifies the mood, making the scenes much more powerful. (The soundtrack is available for purchase, and i recomend picking it up if you have the money)

The impact this game left on me is strong, I even cried at the end [I know; Iâ€™m a dork ha-ha] because of its depressing... but strangely satisfying and even somewhat happy ending (I know this seems like a contradicting statement; but it will make sense when you beat it).  

I whole-heartedly recommend this to anyone who enjoys visual novels, great stories, or emotionally charged entertainment; best of all is that this amazing experience is free. I give narcissu a 10/10!!

review:
Narcissu 1st & 2nd is a Japanese visual novel developed by stage-nana and written originally in Japanese by Tomo Kataoka. This VN tells the story about the residence of 7th floor Setsumi Sakura and her experience during the last moment of her life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999188745', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1399185209}
review: Narcissu 1st and 2nd are hands down, the most emotional and heartbreaking stories I have ever experienced in my entire life and they're both delivered flawlessly with excellent music, amazing voice acting, and beautiful artwork. I'm glad they finally put these masterpieces on Steam. Try them! Trust me, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982837520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1443831184}
review:
Like so many VN's, Narcissu delivers what no other game medium is capable of. Pure, positive, negative, happy and sad feelings. You read, you imagine you will feel.

I don't want to tell anything about the stories, but it's a very, very good experience and it gives you a certain understanding why some terminal patients decide to do certain things. it makes you understand, not always accept, but understand that not all people are born to live a long life and that the length of ones life doesn't really guarantee a good quality. Sometimes it's better to end things prematuraly. And Narcissu gives you insight in those situations and some of the feelings that come with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075376669', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1399404984}
review:
[b]Ich trenne die Spiele untereinander ab. Der zweite Teil folgt weiter unten.[/b]

[u]Narcissu[/u]

Narcissu ist ein Spiel, welches mehr eine Geschichte ist als ein Spiel. Die Handlung behandelt ein ernstes Thema: Eine tÃ¶dliche Krankheit. Ein Spiel, welches die Geschichte zwei todkranken Personen erzÃ¤hlt.

Pro
- RÃ¼hrende Story
- MitfÃ¼hlen der Charaktere
- Leichte Bedienung
- SchÃ¶ne Bilder(An den Zeichenstyle muss man sich jedoch erst gewÃ¶hnen)
- Fabelhafte Musik

Contra
- Auf Englisch(Allerdings gibt es eine Deutsche Version im Netz)
- Kurze Spieldauer

Fazit:
Ein wirklich tolles Spiel mit einer wundervollen Geschichte. Mehr als nur empfehlenswert!

Punkte
- Story 8,7/10
- Charaktere 7,0/10
- Grafik 7,5/10
- Gameplay 7,0/10
- Musik 9,5/10

Ergebnis: 7,94/10



[u]Narcissu Side 2nd[/u]

Narcissu Side 2nd spielt in der Vergangenheit und die Geschichte der weiblichen Protagonistin wird erzÃ¤hlt.

Pro
- RÃ¼hrende Story
- MitfÃ¼hlen der Charaktere
- Leichte Bedienung
- SchÃ¶ne Bilder(An den Zeichenstyle muss man sich jedoch erst gewÃ¶hnen)
- Fabelhafte Musik

Contra
- Bis jetzt nur auf Englisch
- Kurze Spieldauer

Fazit:
Ein wirklich tolles Spiel mit einer wundervollen Geschichte. Mehr als nur empfehlenswert!

Punkte
- Story 8,7/10
- Charaktere 7,2/10
- Grafik 7,5/10
- Gameplay 7,0/10
- Musik 9,5/10

Ergebnis: 7,98/10


[u]Gesamte Bewertung[/u]

Narcissu und Narcissu Side 2nd ist eine wunderbare Spielserie. Wer diese Geschichte an sich vorbei rauschen lÃ¤sst, dem entgeht etwas. Das Thema ist zwar nicht gerade leicht zu verkraften, aber trotzdem beinhaltet die Narcissu-Serie wundervolle Bilder und eine spannende und zugleich rÃ¼hrende Geschichte.

Folgender Text enthÃ¤lt Spoiler

[spoiler]Der erste Teil fand ich sehr gut. Einige Szenen kommen total unerwartet und das macht das Spiel/die Geschichte umso besser. Setsumi ist anfangs noch das mysteriÃ¶se und seltsame MÃ¤dchen. Doch im Laufe der Geschichte zeigt sie ihre wahre PersÃ¶nlichkeit. Im Gegensatz zu ihr kann man sich in den mÃ¤nnlichen Protagonisten besser hineinversetzen. Anfangs ist Setsumi sehr schwer zu durchschauen, da sie erst spÃ¤t ihr wahres Ich zeigt. Doch bei dem mÃ¤nn. Protagonist erhÃ¤lt man etwas VerstÃ¤ndnis. Er erfÃ¤hrt, dass er an Lungenkrebs erkrankt ist und sterben wird. Sein gesamtes vorheriges Leben verÃ¤ndert sich von jetzt auf eben. Alles ist Neu und anders. Deswegen kann man sich in ihn besser hineinversetzen.
Der zweite Teil ist meiner Meinung nach sehr gelungen und sogar noch besser als der Erste. Es wird Setsumis Vergangenheit erzÃ¤hlt. Aber gleichzeitig auch neue Charakter eingefÃ¼gt. Anfangs hat man es noch schwer mit zu kommen, aber nach der Zeit versteht man alles. Der zweite Teil hat mich mehr zu TrÃ¤nen gefÃ¼hrt als der Erste. Wahrscheinlich wegen dem Kind, der Schwester und Yuka.[/spoiler]

Punkte:
- Story 9,0/10
- Charaktere 7,2/10
- Grafik 7,5/10
- Gameplay 7,0/10
- Musik 9,5/10

Ergebnis: 8,04/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072145791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1407417099}
review:
One of the few Visual Novels currently on Steam,  Narcissu is an expirience unlike one I have ever had before.  It isn't really a game, and in fact can't really even be considered a Visual Novel in the broad sense of the term.  It literally is a novel; one with pictures, music and partial narration.  This is a sad, soulful piece of art that also tends to branch away from traditional VN expirirences by not having a palphable romantic streak or a hard, action based storyline. Although I am only at chapter 3 in 1st, I am completely enthralled and did start crying at some of the more eloquently worded scenes of reflection.  Again, although I have barely touched the surface I have no doubt that for all the more abstract and open-minded gamers out there who can accept a touching linear click-and-read this is a must.

11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043850289', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1412535085}
review:
ALL ABOARD THE FEELS TRAIN!!
Without further ado let's start: 

Story - You ''play'' an unnamed 20 year old man, suffering from an terminal illness called lung carcinoma who has been hospitalized and will die because of that illness, they place him in a wing called 7F where he meets a  young woman named Setsumi, 22 years of age. she has a body physique like a child and has a quiet personality. The story properly begins when the protagonists father visits his son in the hospital and leaves his car keys on a table, protagonist takes them and invites Setsumi to go along with him. The two escape the hospital and begin a roadtrip with seemingly no end goal.

Gameplay - The game is a visual novel with little to no interaction if you have autoscroll on the text, so it isn't a ''game'' excactly.

Voice acting and presentation - The ''game'' has very little of the characters and is compromised of a textwindow and a narrow movielike image, the voiceacting is completely optional but i recommend turning it on with autoplay enabled so you don't accidentally skip any speech.

Overall the visual novel is touching and has a very sad undertone driven by the fate of the main characters (incurable illness) so they both know they will die soon or sooner and the novel leaves a bittersweet taste of tears afterwards so i would conclude this with a rating for anyone who loves sad stories of visual novels definetly a 8/10 (would feel again) but for any other person do not expect too much.

review:

Pulgar arriba para los creadores, una excelente novela visual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055041049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1398808650}
review: This story grabbed me with an iron grip and wouldn't release me until I finished it. I didn't know what to expect at first, but a few good emotional hours later and I am proud to have clicked through this great tale. I hope more people get the chance to experience Narcissu 1st & 2nd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065102185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1398798176}
review: Narcissu isn't what most people think of when they think of a video game. But that is because this is a visual novel. This game has received negative comments claiming it's all script and artwork with no real play. They are correct. But they failed to realize, is that Narcissu is a visual novel and that script and artwork is all a visual novel is. They chose to judge the game on what it's not instead of what it is. Me on the other hand, I highly enjoyed this game. The artwork is detailed and beutiful, the story is depressing but well done, and the setup for the game is great. As the description says, this is about a girl and a boy both dying of desease. Wanting to escape from the fate laid out for them. They knew they would die. They knew that there was nothing they could do. But they leave 7f. I highly enjoyed this game. I cried on several occasions. So prepare for feels if you play. I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys storyline or visual novels. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198131296085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1398782468}
review:
OMG!!! This is a masterpiece all in it's on right. It really is a said story, but I also think it's a story about choosing your own way to leave this world. And at the end, when Setsumi went into the see in the final chapter it made me cry so damn hard. I was hoping that the main character would stop her cuz I could see them being a lovely couple. All in all bravo this game has so much emotional depth to it that I really enjoyed it. I also think that this game will pave the way for other games with this kind of narrative. 

Also the soundtrack is amazing although as I think about it the soundtrack sounds like it could belong to a Japanese RPG game, which isn't a bad thing the soundtrack is beautiful and fits with the theme of the overall story greatly all in all if I was a major game reviewer like gametrailers or ign, I would give this a 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052214296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1420466261}
review:
The strongest point of Narcissu, the one thing that holds everything it has together is that it has a heart. That alone puts this game above 90% of the commercial stuff on the mainstream market, let alone on Steam.

There is no barrier to entry, the game is entirely free. There is no excuse for you not to give this game a chance. Narcissu is something everybody should play before it's their turn to face certain death.

JÃ¡ na segunda histÃ³ria, Narcissu 2nd Ã© dividido na visÃ£o de uma outra garota chamada Himeko e a prÃ³pria Setsumi. Claro que a maior parte vocÃª vÃª pela visÃ£o da Setsumi, quando ela nÃ£o era uma paciente do 7Âºandar.

review: Narcissu 1 et 2 ne sont pas des jeux Ã  proprement parler : ce sont ce qu'on appelle des "Visuals Novels", comprendre par lÃ  des histoires imagÃ©es. En effet, tout ce que vous aurez Ã  faire ici sera de lire et de cliquer pour faire dÃ©filer les lignes de dialogues. De temps en temps, des images (graphiquement et artistiquement trÃ¨s belles) viendront ponctuer les scÃ©narii afin d'accroitre l'immersion.  A ce propos, les histoires sont vraiment trÃ¨s bien Ã©crites ; on les suit sans en dÃ©crocher. Par ailleurs, elles ne sont disponibles qu'en anglais : rassurez-vous, le niveau requis n'est pas incroyablement Ã©levÃ© (un niveau lycÃ©e suffit largement). En bref, je recommande trÃ¨s fortement de tÃ©lÃ©charger ces magnifiques histoires pour passer un trÃ¨s bon moment, loin des barbaries des jeux plus classiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044005424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1402448367}
review:
I've just finished the first story, and let me just say... wow. I don't even know what to type right now; it's been a long time since I've been this depressed. The story is about a male protagonist (who remains anonymous, probably for immersive purposes), and a quiet woman who's a few years older than him. Both have been denied their future. Not wanting to have their final moments in a hopsital or at home, the two run away. Initially with no goal in mind, the two travel aimlessly before deciding to finally set their sights on the narcissus fields in Awaji Island.

Do I recommend this game? Yes, but be prepared to feel sad. I really took a feels trip with this visual novel. Also the music is great- at least a x3 feels multiplier. It moved me and changed the way that I looke at things. Anyway, the less info you know about the game, the better experience you'll have with it- that's my opinion. Consider taking a few hours out of your day to experience this beautiful, yet sad piece crafted by Tomo Kataka.

Note- Give it a go even if you don't like the 'anime' style of it. You will only see the characters a few times- most of it will be just settings; you can also chose to have it unvoiced. Pressing 'a' will turn on auto progress if you're tired of clicking.

Will update after finishing the second story. For now, I'm sorta scared to progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125569478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1398638860}
review:
Few novels of any sort are dedicated to chronic or terminal illness, especially when they afflict the young.  I'm as close to an expert as one can be on this subject and still be living.  I survived a nearly fatal heart issue at age 18 and had two open heart surgeries.  I also volunteered in the child life department (duties very similar to the "helper" in this story -- basically being a supportive friend) for several years at a children's hospital on the acute care floor, the hem/onc floor and the NICU.

That said, I was really intrigued by this and hoping to find something that spoke to the experiences I have shared with children who I have worked with who are terminally ill and the friends I have made in support groups who have struggled with giant chest scars in their teens, coping with confronting death while your college friends are out partying, learning to change your IV bags while your bff is talking about her favorite clothes, and generally losing your supposed best years of your life.

I was ideally hoping for something I could pass on to my friends who have dealt with these same issues or my family who truly cannot fathom what that kind of life experience does to an 18-23 year old.  Unfortunately, I can't say that this really deals with many of the issues we face.  I believe that there are some really important points it manages to pick up on briefly that healthy individuals may not have ever considered: the families that abandon children in hospitals because it's too much to bear, the isolation of the young in a landscape of the dying elderly, the alienation one feels from her own body -- particularly because of scarring or the presentation of what is considered acceptable by the fashion industry.  

However, I did think this could have used some editing and likely some research into specific illnesses as well.  Portraying nebulous illnesses, sternotomy scars and "medications" didn't really impact me when that kind of stuff becomes your daily bag in reality.  I also thought some of the character switches were clumsy at times, though the pay-offs at times when things came full circle was cute.  All in all, though, I was left feeling like this did not ring true to the experiences I knew of we young folk trapped in hospitals -- though it was a valiant attempt and some people might enjoy it.  I wouldn't recommend it to my friends or families to learn more about our experiences, and I wouldn't recommend it to my peers as an introspective dip into our pasts.

I think my largest problem was the complete absence of the illness, its accoutrements and its physical impacts from these characters despite their being apparently near death.  I get that this isn't a documentary, but truly, being half machine, rooted semi-permanently to various tubes, plugs and massive IVs, and being sliced and diced is such a huge part of what one has to process and your identity while your best friends are just like, "Man.  Essays suck."  The fact that the characters only deal with half of dying is a hard thing for me to let go of, especially when the characters just generally seem to be withering away from a general 19th c malaise.

Barely recommended as a fair attempt to portray a complex subject on which the authors did not have a clear grasp.  Glad someone tackled it, however.  6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079931881', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1408892096}
review:
Beautiful,
This is not a game but a story, you can't interact but just read, the story is about a sick girl during his life, alone... musics are so beautiful and you can get so many emotions when you are reading. It's divide into chapter (30 min per chapter I think), and because it's free I really recommend to test it!

Magnifique,
Ce n'est pas un jeu mais une histoire, vous ne pouvez pas interragir juste lire, il s'agit de l'histoire d'une fille malade, seule... Les musiques sont magnifique et vous pouvez avoir enormement d'emotions en le lisant. Il est en plusieurs chapitre (30 min par chapitre je pense), et parce qu'il est gratuit je recommende vraiment de la tester!
