author: {'steamid': '76561198049786534', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1408582191}
review:
A mature and painfully saddening tale that will leave you engrossed in your feelings aftering completing it, Narcissu was a great find for me reccomended by a friend. Iv'e only just read the first one and I can say as a visual novel fan I fell in love with this story. Griping, paced well and told with some good voice acting the musical scores really helped set the tone for this story. From the start it captivates you, bringing you along for the feels train. If I had to rate this out of a 10 I'd give it a 8; however, I think it may have been better as just a novel albeit myself enjoying the voice of Setsuna and the wonderful music. For a visual novel it lacked the art  expected of it and at times left me wanting more, as an example where you'd expect a stunning image of Setsuna giving her "bashful sour expression" you often weren't rewarded it. Yet, this does not take away from the beauty of this VN, nor should it deter you. If you are a fan of this type of genre, enjoy reading or simply want to play something to pass time its well it. With a fantasitcly saddening story, moving musical selection and spot on voice acting Its a gem in the visual novel bin.

(PLACE HOLDER FOR PART 2)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049510164', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1398596826}
review:
One of the greatest Visual Novels ever created has finally made it's way on to Steam.

It's sweet. It's heart-wrenching. It's beautiful. But most importantly, it's an unforgettable experience.
Narcissu is a game you really owe yourself to play, and is one of the few games I'd ever consider a masterpiece.

Oh, it's also free. So what are you waiting for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198044656848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1430080847}
review: This is not a game, total garbage!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043793930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1398535874}
review:
Narcissu is a VN that lacks the typical VN feeling of agency, the feeling of that you are making your own decisicion or dialogue choices.what I mean by lacking is that This game has none of those, oh no.This VN is literaly a VN, a Visual Novel.With no interactions and no branching storyline whatsoever, however.The game provides a strong narative that immerses you with the characters.With death as a theme and a canvas for the narative, death is a inevitable end and This VN doesnt contain any romance.Which is not this VN is about, this VN is about death and of one's experience before their demise.

I recommend this game for people who wants a good and solid story of death told in a form of a VN.
I dont recommend this game for people who wants agency and romance in their VNs ,because there is none.

review:
This isn't a game, nor a visual novel. It is a piece of art.
The music is truly beautiful, and the story is flowing.
Make sure you don't have parents or annoying siblings that will ruin the experience.
Nothing more can be said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030125439', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1430098911}
review: This was, I believe, my second visual novel. It was sad. Play it. That is all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084957586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1408734998}
review:
I'm only one chapter in, but this is an amazing experience. Narcissu is written almost just aswell as a book. It's art is really beautiful and the music is intense. This game makes you attached to the characters just like a TV show or Movie should. It's music has the same feel as an anime. So overall this game gets an 8.5/10

After now finishing Narcissu Side 1, I must say this is amazing. If you've seen anime such as Clannad, Angel Beats, or Darker than black you'll love this. The ending is so well written and so well delivered that even I cried. New rating for this visual novel is 9.75/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023226144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1398813720}
review:
The first visual novel game's story that I very like. Now it available on Steam, translated and yet still free. 

One of my best visual novel game of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1459616959}
review:
We do not get many visual novels on steam, so I was pleasantly surprised to see Narcissu 1 and 2 in the steam free to play section the other day. While I myself am not a huge fan of visual novels, I do like when authors take something Melancholy or macabre and manage to turn it into something emotional and beautiful. I think if you are a fan of storys that take a painful subject and make it something more, you should take the time to play (read) through Narcissu (1 and 2). Its free so there is not any harm in trying it.    

NOTE: Lets hope the steamworks integration is finished soon, people want there achievements. 6/9/14

review:
This Visual Novel is unforgettable. 
The emotional and story aspects of the game are excellently paired. 
Leaving an enormous amount of "feels" to the reader. 
The music/soundtrack of the VN is also beautiful. The melody is soothing and REALLY aids in defining the mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023091277', 'num_games_owned': 3358, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1398474817}
review:
Anyone looking to read this novel. It was great. It is amazing.
It made me very emotional so if you're sensitive to sad stories, be wary that you might even cry at the ending of part one.
Overall, it was an amazing story. You really felt for the persona's and become a part of them as they become a part of you.

10/10 would read again even though I brawled my eyes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081945143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1398509910}
review:
We should get more VN on Steam, and all aboard on the feel train and dont look back. 
The girl who loved cars & Narcissus flowers...... :'(
[spoiler] Should I stop you?, or should i pull you back? T^T[/spoiler]
The girl reminds me of Nagisa and Ushio from Clannad...
( Kind of a spoilers & my favorite speech. )
[spoiler] She was always without expression, and would only rarely face you, but once in a while, she would even make this embarrassed pouting face...
The emerald sea to her back...
As if dancing, happily, like a magazine mode, she smiled...
And yet...On this cheap disposable camera, only a single picture remained of her smile.
... But even so......
... Even with just one picture...
It was the proof of ourselves that we left behind...[/spoiler]
And the sentence that gave me the most feels goes to 
[spoiler] In reality, she liked bikini swimsuits, knew more about the roads than a navigation system, and loved cars. She even had a license. </3[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197986448970', 'num_games_owned': 8182, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1504987467}
review:
I remember I had this on the GP2X handheld back in 2005, except I only had the 1st story.

I'll be damned if I lie and say this didn't have me cryin' my a** off back then.
One of the best heartwarming stories in a visual novel out there.

The Steam version includes 2 stories. Narcissu which was originally released in 2005 and Narcissu: Side 2nd which was released in 2007. Unfortunately, Narcissu 3rd - Die Dritte Welt was released in 2009 only for PSP.

This is one of the best visual novels on Steam. You should definitely check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097404203', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 59970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29989, 'last_played': 1415164146}
review:
PLEASE READ
Im not a fan of reading,and since this is not a game i do not recommend it for that reason

HOWEVER,this is a very good read and a sad story at best,you will feel touched and cry a tiny bit.

This game is one of thoses games,wehre you learn a true meaning of life. A meaning where only true feelings for the one you love will shine over any conflict of human nature and provide a deep and rich meaning to yourself.
in all seriousness its a visual novel with japanese words,not bad and its free apprently.

also the game takes place in 2004 so only 2000s kids will get the references.

so the big question,is it SFW?
Well i,ll leave that a surprise :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198036931813', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1443542954}
review:
Narcissu 1st & 2nd is a Japanese visual novel developed by stage-nana and written originally in Japanese by Tomo Kataoka. This VN tells the story about the residence of [i]7th floor[/i] Setsumi Sakura and her experience during the last moment of her life.

This game includes both the Narcissu 1st & Narcissu 2nd. 2nd being the prequel and 1st is the main story of Setsumi. 
The 2nd tells the story of Himeko Sunohara as her life take a 180 degree turn when she was diagnosed with a diseased that can't be cured, thus she's moved to the 7th floor. Himeko used to work as helper in 7th floor so she kinda used to the situation, but then it all changes when she met Setsumi.

Narcissu 1st set appx. 6-7 years after 2nd. The story is focused on the anonymous Protagonist (just think of him as us) who is terminally ill & Setsumi as both of them realizes their feeling of not wanting to die in the hospital or at home with their respective families. The two of them begin a long journey accross Japan until they find that place...
[b] NARCISSU [/b]

I have completed the game 2 years ago and when I found this game on Steam Greenlight, I immediately vote it up as I think this [u] COULD BE[/u] first step of introducing the Visual Novel medium to the West. Currently the game is in Early Access but don't let that bother you because the story itself is completed & translated. I'm also part of the Closed Beta tester and I could say that Sekai Project did a good job of making the game engine compatible with Steamwork.

Definitely a must have if you are an avid VN player or you are interested in this medium, even after 2 years of finishing this, I still get [i] dem feels [/i] moment :') a Masterpiece indeed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025427955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1398453320}
